Reviews.Title: “perfect Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robinhood_9
Reviews.Content: We just completed a three night stay at this wonderful hotel. We chose it based on Tripadvisor reviews and loved it! Cedric upgraded us to a tower view room which made an already romantic trip even more so. Eiffel Tower is a four minute walk and metro station is probably five minutes. Hotel breakfast is rather expensive at 14 euros, so we had complementary coffee and walked two minutes to a pastry shop each morning. Our room was spotless and hotel staff were all very nice. They will offer advice on restaurants, metros, taxis etc. Our room was small as we expected, but you don't go to Paris to stay in the room. My best advice for visiting Paris is learn the metro system so when you get tired of walking you can use it to rest your legs and still see everything.

Reviews.Title: “Small with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: uplifter
Reviews.Content: In the global centre of excellence for arrogant, self- important, condescending hotel staff lies this wonderful exception. The staff here are charming, helpful and really jolly nice. The French Government should compulsorily purchase them to instruct at hotel staff school. When disaster struck- my wallet was stolen on the Metro, the duty manager saved the day and was really kind and helpful. As frequent visitors to France will know, the country has more than it's fair share of street crime and this was not my first experience as a victim. On the previous occasion, my hotel staff were as unhelpful and obstructive as they could have been, yet these guys were great and the trip was saved. The hotel itself is small and the beds are tiny, but location is great, its well done and does a good breakfast. And... England beat France at Rugby in Paris.....

Reviews.Title: “Home sweet Home Paris!”
Reviews.Author: nikendayu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and could say that this hotel feels like home to us. The staffs were friendly and helpful. I left my earrings and some electronic equipment after we checked out and they called us. We really appreciate it. The room was small, but clean and nice interior. Bathroom was ok and equipped with L'occitane toiletries. The location was not bad, 10 minutes walking to nearest metro station, though the street is little bit confusing at first. 5 minutes to eiffel tower. Nearby hotel there's supermarket, laundry, pharmacies, bakeries, gift shop and famous restaurant, Constant Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location close to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: CorkeSydney
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our two night stay at Londres Eiffel , rooms are very small as is expected in Paris, however very clean and everything you need for short stay.Staff were very helpful. Would skip Breakfast as there are plent of cafes in the vicinity. Just do not expect a large room and you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sommer9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a pretty great location - <10 min walking from Ecole Militaire metro and just a couple blocks away from the 69 bus. Our room was unsurprisingly small, but very nicely decorated and clean. Our windows opened up onto the street, though it wasn't too loud. since it's in a relatively quiet neighborhood. I was awoken, however, to the delicious smell of fresh bread baking at the several bakeries nearby. The staff was very nice and always accessible, since you have to leave your key at the front desk when you leave. The hotel is around the corner from a street with bakeries, a supermarket, and all sorts of restaurants. It's also less than 10 min away from the Eiffel Tower, which is really fun to see light up at night.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect visit”
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Paris with my daughter who had been several times before. The staff was eager to please, the accomodations were very clean, modern and quaint. The accomodations were exactly what I could have hoped for. The location is within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and Champs de Mars and close to the RER and bus. And we had no trouble calling for a taxi. There were many small boutiques and restaurants in this very safe and friendly residiential area. I would not hesitate to recommend the Hotel de Londres Eiffel to anyone who wanted to assure him'herself of a very positive visit to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was minutes form the Eiffel Tower and lots of shops and restaurants. Our concierge was very helpful in making my first trip to Paris enjoyable. Cafe Constant on the corner and Pastiere shops in each direction. Don't miss a dinner at Le Ptit Troquet, reservation was secured by our concierge. I did not request the hotel breakfast but came down for coffee long after breakfast was over. The server ran out to the pastiere shop to make sure I had something to go with my coffee. Praise to the hotel and staff. Bath are modern and rooms were very clean with view of Eiffel Tower from our 6th floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Slava F
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Paris where we were celebrating my daughter's 10th birthday (March 13 - March 18). It was our first trip to Paris and I couldn't say enough good words about the hotel. People who work there are super nice and very helpful. The rooms are very pretty and very Parisian. Also, very clean! We had breakfasts at the hotel every day and we really enjoyed it. Location is beyond amazing! We walked everywhere. When we decided to take a tour bus we realized there is no point as we have already walked to all the sights. Beautiful neighbourhood. We will definitely be back (hopefully soon)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel around the corner from the Eiffel Tower!”
Reviews.Author: bobbo01p
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hotel de Londres Eiffel for 4 nights this March. Upon arriving, we were told our room would not be ready until 1/2 (the normal check in time). We had just arrived from Italy and wanted to sit and relax for a minute. They have a computer in the lobby for you to use, so we went on that for a couple of minutes and then were told the room was ready now, only 10 min later! We were much relived at this! Room was adequate in size but met all of ours needs. Not overally huge, not small, just right. Hotel is literally around the corner from the Eiffel Tower, maybe a 5 min walk away at the most. Metro is about a 5-8 min walk away, and from here you can transfer to all the sights you want to see in Paris and beyond. Area is quiet, but very nice and safe. Tons of restaurants and cafes and bakeries around. Tip: Don't pay for breakfast. There are plenty of bakeries in the area. We got breakfast every day for 2.25 Euro TOTAL. The place was a min walk away and was great! Would definitely recommend this hotel and would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: megstu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great area just minutes from the Eiffel Tower and near numerous excellent restaurants. While it's very small, it's very nice and very clean. We didn't do the breakfast because we sleep late and I thought it was a bit overpriced. The staff was pretty good, not as good as I've experienced at some other hotels in Europe but certainly not unpleasant. We didn't get maid service one day which was disappointing but I'll just assume it's because we slept too late? Overall it's a great value for a nice, cozy, clean hotel in a wonderful location. I would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: honestmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 2012 for 4 nights. Arnaud, the hotel concierge provided excellent service from the day we arrived until we left. He gave us great recommendations each day that helped us to maximize the time we had to discover Paris. He was instrumental in booking a dinner reservation at Le Petit Troquet for the best meal we had while in Paris. His information was invaluable, his courtesy exceptional. Indeed, the entire hotel staff was wonderful and they all deserve high praise. The rooms were clean and comfortable we had booked the two connecting rooms on the sixth floor. Wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower at night. Cafe Constant on the corner was great for a meal, cafe and drinks. Lots of great little food shops and restaurants in the area, close to the metro, buses and even the water taxi batobus. The next time I visit Paris I will definitely stay at the Hotel Londres Eiffel and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Mszs10
Reviews.Content: Superb location. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: pleggesgd
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Londres Eiffel was an excellent location to start from to explore the city! There are excellent restaurants within 50 yards and the Eiffel Tower is about a 2 minute walk! The rooms are clean, bathrooms are beautiful and the beds are comfortable. The rooms are small (compared to Canada or the US) but I have definitely stayed in smaller rooms. It's all the space you need unless you travel with multiple trunks! The staff is helpful and directed us to sights and arranged rides to and from the airport. I will stay here again when I go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Cleaness”
Reviews.Author: SP_LAW_HK
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent if you are driving a car. It is not difficult to find a place for parking. The rooms are clean and more than acceptable. They are small but so is most hotel in that price range. The managers are helpful as well. The only problem is the heated tower hanger is cold no matter which direction we turn the switch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: watpack
Reviews.Content: Wonderful weekend with friends in Paris. The hotel is in such a good location only a stones throw from the Eiffle Tower and the Seine. The local area has lots of small resturants and boulangeries, for a quick pastry and coffee, so you don't need to go far from the hotel to eat if you don't want to. The romms are small but they are very comfortable and beautifully decorated with all mod cons. When we arrived at CDG we purchased a visitor travel ticket for three days (43euro) which meant we could travel on RER, the Metro, SNCF and buses unlimited for the three days. Armund at reception gave us a leaflet, that the hotel had produced, giving a list of the local bus routes and the sights of interest they went to, this was fantastic, we used the buses to go everywhere and it was so simple to hop on and off with our pre-paid ticket ( and the buses stopped at the end of the street). We would stay at this hotel again without a second thought!

Reviews.Title: “The ideal spot for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: hgpcend
Reviews.Content: The Londres Eiffel made our stay. We spent 3 nights at the hotel, and found the location to be ideal, the staff to be very helpful and the hotel itself to be cosy and clean. Restaurants litter the streets around the hotel and there are a couple of excellent patisseries in the area. We stayed on the top floor with views of the tower which is always nice to wake up to.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: broncoal06
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff. We loved getting a free upgrade to the Pavillon room (for our anniversary) and having a view of the Eiffel Tower. Its location is top-notch. The room was very nice, small for most, but like others have said, good by Parisian standards. Loved staying here and would love to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Small but sweet”
Reviews.Author: AA678
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a wonderful time in Paris. The hotel staff were incredibly hospitable and helpful, directing us to particular sights in order for us to optimise our short stay. Its central location was ideal for this, as the majority of sights were a short distance from the hotel. The hotel itself was beautiful, homely, and amazingly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Friendly Staff. Small rooms, small beds.”
Reviews.Author: kt127
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 night stay here. My room was on the 1st floor, and surprisingly included a mini fridge as well as a safe. Hotel was nice and cozy, although having to leave the room key with the desk each time you leave is a little annoying. The room and hotel were extremely clean and for the most part comfortable. My only complaint is the bed. It was pretty small - a double room with two narrow twin beds pushed side by side. The matress was a little thin, so I tossed and turned a bit, and to be honest I didn't get a good night sleep's while I was there. A smaller person or someone who prefers a very firm mattress may be better satisfied with the sleeping conditions. Otherwise, the neighborhood was very nice and charming, plenty of shops and places to eat very close by. Metro is about a 6-8 minute walk, and there's a taxi stand about 2-3 blocks away. WiFi was free and worked very well. There was an iMac in the small lobby. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel, there were too many other options that I wanted to try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience! I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: rappe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. My stay started completely wonderfully - I arrived at 9am after a night flight. I was rehearsing my "can you keep my luggage for me" speech, but they had a room ready and gave it to me! The staff continued to be very helpful and pleasant. The shower was great, lots of hot water. My single room was small, but perfectly adequate. The only down side to the room was that there wasn't a very good place to keep my open suitcase. There was a small closet with a safe. Room was very quiet (but possibly the adjacent rooms were empty). Great location. Seven minutes walk to the metro. Close to the tower. I really liked the neighborhood. Lots of very good restaurants as well as more mundane shopping and not overly touristic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good renovation and a friendly team”
Reviews.Author: JulieAre
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2 linked rooms on the first floor at the back of the hotel. The set up was perfect for 2 adults and a 10+12 year old. The rooms are a good size for Paris, with plenty of storage. The bathroom/shower room were newly renovated, and again a good size by Paris standards. I have stayed in Paris many times and I think this is a top find.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: guyfromthenorthwest
Reviews.Content: We saw all the good reviews and booked a room. It was more expensive by the end with a couple of hidden charges, and they put us in quite a small and unimpressive room. The location is nice with proximity to the tower, but it's quite hot and the view of our room is tantamount to a back alley. Not sure I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small ,friendly , great location”
Reviews.Author: hazel w
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights in a freezing cold feb but the hotel was warm comfortable and very friendly. All hotel rooms in Paris are small so no surprise here but this was well decorated, clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was very modern and the shower was hot. The location is great for metro and RER and there are excellent places to eat on the doorstep. The food in the Cafe next door was excellent. We would definetly go back .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely decor, small room!”
Reviews.Author: LondonnOlive
Reviews.Content: Having read plenty of reviews on tripadvisor we booked a room (February) and asked for a room with a view. Unfortunately, even though it seemed there was hardly anyone in the hotel we were given quite a small room with no view on the 4th floor. Initial impression did not quite meet all the great things we'd heard in the reviews but after 2 days it grew on us and we quite liked the room. Bathroom was tiny, but really nicely refurbished and very clean and modern. It was also warm which was good because it was -5C outside! Only thing that was annoying was that we could hear everything that went on in the bathroom next door - we think they had a bathtub and we could hear someone moving around for quite sometime, a little awkward. Also we were told check out was by noon but at 9am when we were still in bed the cleaner walked in! Luckily she closed the door and disappeared but came back to knock again at 10am and 10.30am!! I wish they had a do not disturb sign!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Comfortable, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Tx_Traveling_Lite
Reviews.Content: We stayed four pleasant nights in this very nice, clean quiet hotel within 10 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. Located in a non-touristy area with great neighborhood feel. Our room was quite small, but had a nice updated bathroom. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast selection was limited for the price - suggest nearby cafes instead. Staff was very friendly, with good suggestions for cafes and getting around Paris. Five to ten minute walk to Rue Cler, with affordable cafes such as Cafe Du Marche. We enjoyed the stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: kebenarans
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel near the Eiffel tower. The location is great, there is a supermarket round the corner, laundry across the street and lots of restaurant and cafes around the neighborhood. The metro is about 10 minutes stroll. The staffs are real friendly and always willing to greet you and gives you recommendations. The room are a bit small but they are clean and cosy. Overall i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cesar Z
Reviews.Content: Great location, great rooms and the most important, great staff. The hotel is charming and peacefull. There are excellent restaurants just about the corner and you are very close to the Eiffel Tower. Bathroom is great, the shower hot (one during winter time you need a hot shower) and everything else was perfect. Very good breakfast. I will definetively stay there again another time when going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Frankchester55
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel just before Christmas and were surprised by the price. This is definitely a boutique hotel and lives up to those gorgeous pictures. The room we stayed in was on the ground floor (I believe there are only two on the ground). It was a gorgeous and stylish. The bed was beautifully comfortable and the shower room was perfect. The staff were also very friendly and were on the desk 24/7 to help us out. The only thing the room lacked was a view, as it was on the groundfloor it looked out onto a tiny courtyard! We still had plenty of daylight though, and if I'm in a city as beautiful as Paris I don't think I need to worry too much about what I see out my window! The location is perfect as the hotel is just round the corner from the Eiffel Tower. Useful as you NEVER get lost trying to find it! The street the hotel adjoins is lovely too, with loads of great little cafes and lovely restaurants. (We visited one called Bistro St Dominique which is set back on a little square just round the corner. For 25EUR fixed price it was an amazing meal). Definitely would stay here again. It was worth the money for the location alone!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of place with wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: Packerbear
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay to see Paris. Close to the subway and the Eiffel Tower and Napoleon's Tomb. The rooms are wonderful and clean. The staff is wonderful, helpful and all spoke English (which was nice for us since we do not speak French). I would give this small intimate hotel six stars if I could. We had three rooms and each was very nice. Breakfast is extra. Wifi worked very well and is free. I have already recommended this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alagen
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to the beautiful pictures on its website; the lounge and breakfast area are tastefully and wittily decorated, the room was lovely and clean, and the service was so helpful! The Eiffel Tower was just a few steps from the hotel, which itself is located near many restaurants and delicious patisseries. The Metro was close enough, about a 7 minute walk and I walk pretty quickly. I got a great deal on a room here, which at the time of booking was ranked in the top 25 on Trip Advisor, and when I checked a few of the hotels ranked before and after it, the rates were at least $100 more than this one, some even upwards of $200 more! It would be impossible to find a better hotel than this for its location, service, and style alone, much less for its cost.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Selma M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in Paris and we had a wonderful stay. The hotel was absolutely lovely and charming - the exact feel we were looking for on our Parisian holiday. The decor of the hotel is beautiful and the hotel itself is on a quaint street closely situated amongst restaurants, stores/markets, patisseries etc. We would recommend this stay to our friends and family! FYI - Please note that the elevator is small and the hotel does not allow food to be brought into the hotel Our rooms was small/aka "cozy" . This hotel may not be for you if you have big luggage or need a lot of space to sprawl out. I agree w/ one post that commented how sad they were to not be able to bring in any of the local desserts and fruit from the local market/bakeries.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: trave1gir1
Reviews.Content: I echo the comments by others - I stayed there 20-22 january based on the recommendations and was not disappointed. The area is great for getting around and there are lots of good bars and restaurants very near by. Head to Rue Cler Sunday for the market. The staff are all friendly and helpful. The decor is lovely, the rooms are really well done. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Engagement trip”
Reviews.Author: BrendanANDkaitlyn
Reviews.Content: This review is very late coming (my apologies to Hotel Londres), but well deserved by Hotel Londres! My fiance and I started our trip in Paris, at the Hotel Londres, and upon arrival I proposed to my girlfriend! Before arriving I called ahead and had the Hotel Londres staff help me out with some arrangements to setup the room, and they accommodated every request I had, and more! They did this without expecting compensation either, I might add. Everything about our stay was fantastic. This was also our first trip to Europe, and we couldn't have asked for more. Cedric and Arnaud are the most hospitable hosts anyone can ask for. They helped us navigate the city with great efficiency and suggested some magnificence places to eat at/visit (check out au petit southwest - best dinner we had in Paris!). The hotel manager was also very friendly and helpful. I should also mention that we stayed in a room on the top floor with an eiffel tower view, that was even better than the pictures online! The location is also perfect for tourists. You won't find a better price for this quality of stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Skyebabi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during the lead up to Christmas last year and booked based on the recommendations on Trip Advisor. We could not have made a better decision. The hotel is well located to transport, the Eiffel Tower and local shops. The staff where amazing and extremely helpful, making us feel like we were staying in a home and not a hotel. Special thanks goes to Arnaud, who helped with phone calls to locate some missing luggage. The breakfast was perfect for Paris. Fresh bread and croissants from a nearby bakery; served with lovely cheese and fresh coffee. I agree with others about the size of the rooms. But, why would you want to spend all your time in a hotel room in Paris? The size was perfect for our needs, was very clean and had a view of the tower. We could not fault this hotel in any way. It was extremely clean, had very helpful staff and was cosy and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique as always”
Reviews.Author: Junie13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this very fine hotel for our third trip to Paris. The hotel had been since our stay in 2009 remodeled very nicely. We thought it was lovely before as it was, but now they have made it a bit more contemporary. We had a wonderfully comfortable room with a partial view of the Eiffel Tower. Our stay couldn't have been any more special. We enjoy the wonderful people at the desk - Arneau and Cedric and everyone on staff. The breakfast is always simple and fresh. We look forward to their breakfast to start our day. The weather being unpredictable, and having forgotten our umbrella, there are plenty to borrow in the lobby next to the door. The location of this boutique hotel is superb. There are many restaurants around the area and if only we could have sampled them all! The metro is easily within walking distance. We highly recommend this hotel to those who love the boutique-style stay with a family feeling. We know that when we return to Paris, we will always stay at this hotel. It is our home-away-from-home.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: KEL2000
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel de Londres Eiffel for 2 nights in early January 2012. We chose this hotel based on other Trip Advisor recommendations and we weren't disappointed! The staff was very courteous and we felt they went out of their way to make our stay easy and enjoyable. The staff spoke English well and we really appreciated the communication before our actual arrival to assist with transportation from the airport and restaurant/cabaret reservations and recommendations. We also were kindly upgraded to a room on the 5th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower! The room was small (though I think this is standard in Europe), but it was clean and the size wasn't really a big deal since we weren't hanging out in the room too much during the day. There's also free wifi in the rooms. I think this is a boutique hotel (there are only 4 rooms or so per floor and there are 6 floors). As a result, we really felt like the staff knew who we were which added a personalized feel to our stay. There's no restaurant, but a very cheerful woman serves a nice breakfast in the morning (though it's not a hot breakfast so if you want eggs, etc. go somewhere else). We loved the location - the hotel is right by the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler (a great street with bakeries, cafes, etc.) and about a 6 minute walk to the nearest Metro. You can take a leisurely walk up the Seine or a quick Metro ride to get to the other main tourist sites (Louvre, Notre-Dame, Saint-Chapelle, etc.). The only small complaint is that food/beverages are not allowed in the rooms, but that is the only negative thing I have to say about this hotel. The level of service was exceptional. I would definitely recommend this for couples and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: James T
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I (both in our early 30's) stayed for a weekend in January 2012. This is a really easy review. Great location, good value, pleasant and helpful staff, very clean with nice decor. Would recommend it both to my 16 year old niece and to my (age unknown!) mother. It will appeal to all. Really good and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “the maids were memorable, breakfast left me wanting better”
Reviews.Author: legsbut_boo_b_elly
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October 2011 for four nights. The maids like to make early morning noise. They start as soon as the first guests check out. They immediately went to that room and opened all the doors and windows. It became very cold in the breakfast area and hall. They slap the pillows loudly. The dirty bed linen from the rooms were thrown down at the bottom of the stairs. We had to walk over them. Upon entering the breakfast room, we noticed all the morning drink containers were nearly empty. After sitting down in the breakfast room the maids were not around. So the hotel clerk served the luke warm coffee. Even other guests remarked the coffee was luke warm. It was 09:30am. Finally the maids arrived. They came in from outside of the hotel with a couple of croissants. That's it. I could have gone out myself sooner. The maids also started arguing with the hotel clerk. All this for 14 euros each. I strongly suggest you get breakfast somewhere else. We had a more expensive Pavillion room. Still very small feeling for an upgraded room. I thought the renovations were very beautiful. The location is very nice too. About 10 minutes from the metro and 3 mintues from the bus. Nice area for some restaurants and shops. Nice area to get to the eiffel tower itself. Nice view of the tower from just outside the hotel. Probably will seek out another place in the future. Have been to Paris every year for the past 4 years. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay under the Eiffel Tower!”
Reviews.Author: GATraveljunkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Londres from November 28 through December 3, 2011. We requested a 6th floor room for the view of the Eiffel Tower (Racine Room), and we weren't disappointed. The room was small, but very cozy and comfortable, like a stereotypical top floor (romantic!) atelier. The room has a full-size bath, althought the shower was a bit challenging for those of us taller than about 5 feet. The location was convenient to the metro/train, so it was easy to get around during the day, but really nice to retire to a more quiet area for the evening. We found some great restaurants within walking distance to the hotel, and enoyed the evening stroll with a view of the Eiffel Tower from every vantage! The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful (Arnaud gave great directions and spoke excellent English; Cedric was very nice, too and helpful with arranging our taxi to the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: familyof4Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, 2 adults & 2 children aged 5 & 13, stayed at this hotel for a week in December & would definitely stay here again simply for the great location. We had a family room located in the back of the hotel which consisted of 2 small interconnecting bedrooms (1 was very small when compaired to non European hotels but hey this is Europe) & 2 bathrooms. No elevator at to the rooms in the back. Once we got ourselves and our luggage organised the rooms worked well for our stay. Rooms were very clean, bathrooms are modern. Beds were a little hard for us but that's just personal preference. Staff were friendly. Good free WIFI. Our only complaint would be the no food in rooms request. This is almost impossible when travelling with children. However we would not hesitate to stay here again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “top location - lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: s p
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 3 children aged 5, 3 and 1) had a wonderful stay in Paris in this gorgoues little hotel. The location just down the road from the effiel tower is superb. there are also great places to eat nearby with rue cler markets just 5 mins walk.(cafe constant 2 shops down on the corner is superb). Also only about 15 mins walk to champs elyesee too! Staff were so friendly and welcoming - made us tea/coffee to drink i lobby etc.. the connecting family rooms are a real bonus too! Everything is very clean and neat and new! thanks for a wonderfully memorable holiday! location is extremly quiet too!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable! Really enjoyed my stay there!”
Reviews.Author: JacWong
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights and it is just impeccable as per reviews made by others! Cleaniness, ambience, front desk services and neighborhood environment, location etc are all superb! Room is small in size but basically it has everything you need. Night time is quiet but you would feel safe even walking alone in the neighbourhood. Staff are friendly and helpful - they gave me best advice on transport and even printed off a copy of the bus route for me! There are quite a few highly rated restaurants nearby, actually just around the corner. Or from the delicatessen stores nearby, you can get free range roast chicken, fro gras etc back to the hotel for a quick lunch! There are even fresh oysters selling in front of the supermarket nearby in weekend. Highly recommended to anyone who prefer a cozy and warm feeling hotel than spending extra on staying a 4-5 stars international hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AandHSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night after spend a week with friends in the 5th. We really liked this hotel. The rooms were clean, modern and comfortable, and the location was perfect. It was an easy stroll to the Eiffel Tower, and Cafe Constant is a brilliant restaurant next door which had been recommended many times to us. The only problem we had was that we requested a shuttle to the airport the next morning and the concierge forgot to book it. However the staff the next morning went out of their way once they realised the error and made sure we got to the airport in time. Despite this small issue, we would definitely recommend it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: mayday19
Reviews.Content: We decided to book a last minute trip to Paris for a weekend in November and was very lucky to have found this cute boutique hotel, right next to the Eiffel Tower! We were traveling with a one year (which can always be a little challenging) and from the moment we arrived the staff did everything they could to make our stay as stress free as possible. They gave us milk, let us use their fridge for the baby's food, and even gave us a late check out so the baby could finish her nap. In addition, operating from the front desk, Arno was the BEST tour guide. There wasn't a question he did could not answer and directed us, on more then one occasion, to the best places! The rooms were nice and quiet (we were on the first floor) and the beds were comfortable. There was a great bakery just down the street and it was within walking distant from the metro. When I return to Paris, I will stay here without a doubt. The staff made our first Paris experience very enjoyable...thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “100% Plus..location, service and accomodation”
Reviews.Author: judith c
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 years ago with 5 friends and was impressed with this (I believe a family) Hotel. This fall I was travelling with my adult son and heading home from Kenya to Canada. I thought it would be nice to have a stop over in Paris with my son for a couple of days. I contacted the hotel by e-mail and they made my plans come true. They made the arrangements with the shuttle company for us to be picked up at the airport, got us tickets for Moulin Rouge (which was great)...booked us taxis etc. The location is great..walking is 5 minutes to the Eiffel Tower..City Bus Tours and the Metro. Restaurants, drug stores, dry cleaners are all within steps. The hotel is very clean...the rooms are small and decorated very nicely. You have everything one would need to make your stay comfortable. And the hotel is located in a good district of Paris which is greatttttttt. The staff is very friendly. I have no complaints and would go back without any question and would recommend it 100%...ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: isobel e
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a great location. Right next to the Eiffel Tower and 5 minutes walk from a Metro stop. In a really nice neighbourhood with lots of nearby shops, cafes and restaurants. The rooms were really nicely decorated and very clean. The staff were very friendly and the included breakfast was great. The free wi-fi is also a plus point. Overall a great boutique hotel that was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: tetarpa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 4 nights in Hotel Londres-Eiffel. Our last three stays in Paris (within the last 5 years and this one included) have been in the 7th district, but in three different hotels. Considering price and comfort+hotel looks, this is my favorite so far! Rue Augereau is a quiet street with hardly any vehicles passing through; it has a couple of laundromats, tailoring/alterations shops, and a grocery store (back entrance) all near the hotel. The nearest Metro stop is Ecole Militaire, which is about 5-7 minutes leisurely walk away--we arrived via train from the south of France, then took the Metro. Even with luggage, it was no hassle at all walking to Hotel Londres. There's a pastry shop right across the hotel, a nice resto right beside it (we didn't eat there, but it was always full), another at the nearest corner, and a dozen or so fantastic dining options (we ate at a couple of those) along Rue Saint Dominique and Rue de l'Exposition... all less than two minutes walking after rounding the corner of Augereau and Saint Dominique. The park Champs de Mars, Eiffel Tower, and Pont de l'Alma (where you can catch Seine cruises) are all within convenient distance (10-15 minutes no-rush walking). Our hotel room (standard Paris size) was on the 3rd floor, had lovely wallpaper, alcoves in lieu of bedside tables, a console, one closet with hangers and another with shelves, and a good sized window with pretty drapes and flowers outside. There's no safe and no bathtub, but the shower has the rain-type fixture and a separate handheld one. Full length mirror on the bathroom door, and yes, there's a hair dryer. All the staff (from front desk to housecleaning) are friendly, courteous, and pleasant. Cedric, at the desk, arranged our dinner river cruise for us and gave the hubby some assistance with dining reservations even prior to our arrival (via email exchange with him). Books may be borrowed from the hotel's collection (a whole wall in the dining area is lined with bookshelves), and you may bring the books to your room... except the very-much-in-demand Rick Steves guide books, which you must read/browse in the dining room or lobby. Departing for CDG airport, we took the hotel's shuttle service which was a good deal at 36 euros (guide books estimate 50-60 euros to the airport from the 7th district).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: Babalou88
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful introduction to Paris! The hotel staff were warm, responsive and focused on making our stay special. The view of the Eiffel Tower from the window was breathtaking! This hotel is a small one but BIG on value and ambiance, surrounded by a safe and welcoming neighborhood! Great restaurants surround the hotel. I heartily recommend you consider the Hotel de Londres for your next jaunt to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and nice”
Reviews.Author: SedaTanova
Reviews.Content: Very customer friendly hotel, free wifi ! , helpful reception staff, basic breakfast but enough to get you going. Right next to the tower a bit of a walk from the metro station but overall excellent place to stay, quite nice restaurants and shops right around the corner. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin H
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in great neighborhood. We really loved the breakfast and the staff was very friendly. We are looking forward to our next stay

Reviews.Title: “Very warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: agentone
Reviews.Content: My client stayed at this hotel and loved it, servie winderful and so friendly, would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Rules made me feel we were staying in a hostel”
Reviews.Author: Chitownbigcityfan
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews I wondered did we stay in the same hotel? While the lobby is nice. The people that work there were nice I did have some serious problems with the hotel. You are no allowed to bring ANY food into the hotel. So all the lovely fruit stands etc you pass you can not bring anything in. No stops at the pastry shop for treats, no wine in your room etc. See the pics of the nice tables in the breakfast room? Don't even think about maybe a night snack there. You are not allowed to eat there except if you pay for their breakfast. We had to hide our snacks and then throw them away wrapped up to hide it in our rooms. I would guess they must have a rodent problem? I did not see any but can not think of any other reason? I have stayed at hotels all over the world and have never been told this before. Felt like I was in a hostel. Also I hear they have large rooms. Ours was a match box which I know is normal for Paris but there was no room to put luggage. They have these little closet things to "hold" your luggage. My daughter and I had the size just over a carry on and they would not fit in these. Half the room was taken up by a fridge which I have no idea why it is there since you can not bring food into your room? Because there was no room for our suitcases we had to put them in the very tiny space in front of our beds. You had to step over them to get to the other side of the bed. One day the owner told me as I was leaving. (You had to turn in your key each time) that I had to put all my stuff away because the maids were having trouble cleaning the room. We did not have any thing out but the suitcases and our bathroom stuff out. So each day we had to put everything and I mean everything packed up and away so they would then clean the room. I was afraid to see her each time we came back for fear we would have done something else wrong and get in trouble. Again I felt like I was in a hostel. My husband and son had a room right next to the staircase and as each person went up and down the staircase it sounded like a herd of animals. There are so many choices for hotels in Paris why go to one that makes you feel like you did something wrong everyday?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Carol B
Reviews.Content: We spent nine nights at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel. It was convenient to metro, bus, and rail service. Our room for two singles was comfortable, clean, quiet, and nicely decorated. The bathroom and shower were especially generous by European hotel standards. The staff was very warm and hospitable and helped us plan our daily excursions to get the most out of our day. And it was fun being greeted by Samba, le chien de la maison. We thoroughly enjoyed the shops and cafes in the neighborhood. It was fun and easy to blend into the rhythms of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LKHKYbum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! We stayed for two nights and loved every minute of it. The staff is extremely helpful, from helping with taxis to giving excellent directions and recommendations. Conveniently located to the Eiffel Tower, the location couldn't have been better for us. The property is well maintained, very clean and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: tkrombac
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Paris with our 4-year old and found this hotel on Tripadvisor. The price for a double-room with connecting door was very competitive for his quality of hotel. The room was lovely and very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only negative point I could find was the mattress, which was a little too hard for me. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: goodtravel68
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on business for my husband. Our room was small on the 6th floor but everything we needed was there(once we found the wardrobe). Lovely clean bathroom with a great shower. Staff went out of their way to help in every way they could

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Welcome to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: NewCruisers
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe and after many months of saving and planning the time had finally arrived! I can't imagine a nicer way to begin than being greeted by Arnauld as our taxi from the airport pulled in front of the hotel. He was friendly, efficient, and really helped to make us feel at home after our 8 hour flight and the chaos of the airport! Check-in was a breeze, and our room was a cozy double facing the front of the hotel, with double windows that we could fling open and enjoy the sights, sounds, and views from both the bedroom and bathroom. While the room appeared tiny at first, we were amazed that it did, indeed, include everything that we could possibly need for our 5 day stay! It's all in the engineering, I guess. There was plenty of room for the two of us to move around. The bed was comfy and the wall mounted air conditioning unit was both very quiet and effective. The "small" closets actually held everything we brought with room to spare! The bathroom was bright, clean, and had a nice assortment of soaps, shampoos, etc. We also made full use of the wall mounted towel warmer (not because we needed to, but rather, because we had never seen one before...I now want one!) The room and bath were kept spotlessly clean during our stay. There was a TV mounted on the wall and reading lights over the bed, too. The Hotel is located on a tiny side street in a quaint neighborhood, with small businesses, restaurants, and cafés all around, and really gave us the feeling of living in Paris that we had imagined. The Eiffel Tower is literally less than 5 minute walk down the street. Of course, it took us longer because we couldn't walk past the wonderful bakeries and shops without stopping in! After long busy days of sightseeing, shows, dining, and shopping, we actually looked forward to heading back to the hotel to relax and "be in Paris"! Kudos to Isabelle and her staff for making our stay one of the highlights of our European vacation! We would definitely stay with them again, and look forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice choice near the Eiffel Tower.”
Reviews.Author: MissHo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this little boutique hotel on Oct 29, a Saturday night, and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The hotel is located on a quiet street but very close to Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler (an outdoor market street). There are many good restaurants and bakery shops nearby so you can find something to eat anytime of the day. The room is not big but of reasonable size and I particularly like their taste in decoration. For example, for the room I stayed in, the color scheme is not the usual "motel colors" like beige and mauve. Instead, they picked a dark gray pattern for the wallpaper while the rest of the furniture is in black and red. Very cool. While my room has a cool and bold color scheme, the lobby and the dinning room are on the opposite side of the spectrum, very warm and cozy. Simply adorable. I paid 142 euro for a single room, not cheap but considering the convenient location and the quailty of the stay, I will say this is a hotel worth my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in Paris !”
Reviews.Author: Ann S
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel de Londres Eiffel. The room was attractive and very clean. The bathroom was updated and had a wonderful shower/tub. The English breakfast had enough dishes to provide variety from day to day. We especially enjoyed the attentive and friendly ladies who managed the breakfast area. This hotel is in a very nice, quiet area close to subway and bus connections.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: Raul H
Reviews.Content: Hotel Londres Eiffel was just one of our many stops during our 2 week European romp this past September. For a young couple on some sort of a budget, this hotel was exactly what we were looking for and beyond! This was my wife's first trip to Paris and the location of Londres Eiffel was perfect for us and I will tell you why. First of all, you can definitely walk to many of the key sights in Paris from here. Second, if you just want to stroll the quaint streets of this tourist friendly neighborhood, you just hang a right from the hotel and you are easily just steps away from a convenience store, market, creperie, atm machine, etc. Last but definitely not least, the hotel is just a 2 minute stroll from the Eiffel Tower and the Champ Du Mars park which we highly recommend you walk through after an espresso across the street! The rooms are "par for the course" when it comes to its dimensions but they are definitely cozy enough to make your nights memorable. Hotel staff was just outstanding. They will do whatever it takes to enhance your Parisian experience! Arnaud specifically would greet us each morning with a smile and would take the time to help us plan our days. He was always patient enough to explain to us how to access the nearest metro without rolling his eyes and would even suggest a restaurant or two! Our visit to this hotel was during a lull in tourist season so hotel management was nice enough to upgrade us to a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower itself and that just simply put our experience over the top! Honestly speaking, tower view or not, we would stay here again! A bientot Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and lovely atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: pinkskytravel
Reviews.Content: I chased sales online before finally realizing that this was the best value and location you can find in Paris. The remodel a previous reviewer talked about appears to be complete. The lobby and breakfast area are decorated in a bright, cozy Parisian style. The cloth "wallpaper" is perfectly seamed and matched, light fixtures are unique for each breakfast table and the wall paint is nearly flawless. No scuffs or scratches that you see in chain hotels! A small library with a good selection of English and French books lines the breakfast room. We stayed in room 34 (a room of the poets) which faced out to the street. It was a bit loud if you aren't keeping Parisian time. The rooms are small but well designed with closets on each side of the bed, a small desk and a stylish bathroom with tiled shower (and rain shower head.) The bed was comfy with extra pillows and blankets if needed. The room was perfect for my husband and I. We walked to the hotel from the Metro, suitcase in tow, and had no problems finding our way. There is WiFi throughout the hotel but you can leave your laptop at home as the lobby has a shared computer. The staff is helpful and the resident dog adds to a friendly and relaxed atmosphere. A great place to stay while in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “hôtel excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: desertfleurs
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from Paris. Although we rented an apartment during this stay we needed a hotel for two of the nights. So pleased we chose this one!!! Very helpful & friendly staff!!!!! They all make such a kind effort to communicate in English but can mean so much when we return the kindness by using what ever French we can. At the least the basic good manner words in French. A nice bonjour in the morning, merci for thank you........ Lovely rooms with stunning view of tour Eiffel if requested ahead of time. Sure the rooms are on the small side, but remember this is Paris. Plenty of space for a reasonable amount of luggage & to move about & such. The bathroom shower could be on the snug side for some but should be fine for most. Always plenty of warm water with delightful soaps & fluffy towels provided. Normally I would suggest skipping the hotel offered breakfast going out for your own but in this case I highly suggest paying the bit extra. The breakfast is Magnifique as are the two beautiful ladies that greet & take such good care of all who join them each morning. I dare you not to walk away with a happy belly & a big smile! Oh & although it isn't required, just a little reminder not to forget to leave a few coins of appreciation on the table & in the rooms. We are already home sick for Paris & can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terry H
Reviews.Content: Londres Eiffel was a treat on our recent trip to Paris. Location was perfect, halfway between Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler. The staff got to know us quickly and were extremely helpful and cheerful. The room, while small, was well organized, with space for all our stuff, and a large bath with full tub. Hotel was clean and quiet. Our room had large, opening windows to look out on the street, which was in a mostly residential neighborhood. The air conditioning actually worked well. Laundromat directly across the street, a supermarket around the corner, and cafes, restaurants, patisseries and boulangeries within a block's walk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and very French”
Reviews.Author: lindah93637
Reviews.Content: We chose a Rick Steve's Tour for late October. We added three days by coming in to Paris early. We were lucky to find rooms at Hotel Londres Eiffel. Knowing RS had chosen it for the tour we assumed it was a nice place. It is far beyond "nice." The staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions on places to eat and events to attend. The locaton is perfect, especially if this is your first trip to Paris, as it was for us. Walking to the river and the tower became daily events. The rooms are very clean and the breakfasts are always fresh and wonderful. We would stay there again and plan to when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little Parisian hideaway!”
Reviews.Author: Lori S
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from Paris, and my first Rick Steves tour, and the hotel they chose was the Londres Eiffel. What a little gem!! Rick sure knows how to pick them! I will list the things that stood out to me, and I will preface this by saying that I am a seasoned, rather fussy traveler that constantly searches for perfection. My room was ready at 9:30am, perfect after an overnight flight. Charming lobby, welcoming staff, delicious breakfast buffet, and charming breakfast area. The breakfast had fresh fruit, ham, cheese, yogurt, fresh juices and amazing bagettes and croissants....yum! (I am still trying to figure out why the food is that much better in Paris. WOW!!) The breakfast staff actually sing a little tune while they work...sweet! Cute "hotel" dog, Samba, with her little bed in the lobby fireplace area. The hotel is in the perfect location (7th arrondisment), near everything this nice little neighborhood needs; laundry across the street, supermarket a block away (water and snacks), amazing pastry shop a block in the other direction, bus #69 about 2-blocks away, Rue Cler neighborhood shopping area and market 5-blocks, perfect little restaurants within a few blocks walk, Eiffel Tower about 10-blocks, metro 5-blocks, and about 5 blocks to the Seine. Bus 69 takes you to all the other sites in town, so this bus-stop is perfectly located near the hotel. My "single Poet's room" (#25) was small but lovely, with a modern bathroom, great shower and a wonderful bed. The view was in the back of the hotel, and it was quiet. The walls were actually padded, which is something you usually don't see in a smaller hotel like this. All of the staff were quite helpful in every way; Arnaud, Patrice, Cedric, etc. I am already planning on a trip for next spring and will definitely include another visit to Paris and this fine lovely hotel. It really felt like home after my 7-night stay. Ohhhh...did I mention the affordability?! I paid 165 euro for my first night, which was not included on the tour. That equates to about $200.00......amazing!! Stay here and you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Janet P
Reviews.Content: The best location, room and breakfast. The staff is super efficient and super helpful! Rooms are clean, cozy and comfy....and you're barely in it - This is PARIS people! Loved it and will stay here again and again! Arnaud is a Gem! Janet Seattle, WA

Reviews.Title: “A most beautiful holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Anna J
Reviews.Content: My friend and I travelled to Paris for the first time. Thanks to the wonderful staff at Hotel de Londres Eiffel, we were able to do everything we had planned. They were helpful. Breakfast was wonderful. And they sent us on our way each to to return to the most comfortable setting. It was like being at home-but in Paris! We hope to return many times, but always to the Hotel de Londres Eiffel. Anna J.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip to paris.”
Reviews.Author: tanya a
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our family trip to Paris! It was so close to everything especially the Eiffel tower which our son just loved. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the rooms were great. We will be back and recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris! We were so close to the metro and everything. The location was very friendly and we felt very safe too.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be so much better!”
Reviews.Author: PaDorn
Reviews.Content: We scheduled a 3 week visit to Paris for our 25th wedding anniversary several months in advance, and selected a room with a view of the Eiffel tower. Upon arrival , everything looked great. We loved the location and the small hotel was charming. But, they neglected to mention a remodeling project of the lobby, scheduled during our visit! The entire heart of the hotel was torn out to bare bones! The workmen were actually really nice, greeting us at the door, helping with luggage,packages, etc. but the daytime staff seemed unconcerned about the inconvenience .the nighttime staff, however we're wonderfull! They helped us book tours,find bus and metro staitions,restaurants etc. We wondered why the day staff was not so helpfull?

Reviews.Title: “a good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: mjgave
Reviews.Content: Only a brief stay here but the hotel is well located in a quiet neighborhood near the Eiffel Tower. Our room was small but clean and comfortable with a good shower. Very friendly service. A very good value for this location in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CharlesGCanada
Reviews.Content: We recently spent eight nights at this boutique hotel in the Eiffel Tower region of Paris. The hotel is a quaint small hotel, was very clean, and the staff were friendly and helpful; Arnaud was our main contact and he was easily able to communicate to us in English. The location was great for a first visit to Paris, with close proximity to many sites, and easy access to the Metro and RER stations. Great cafes and restaurants were all within walking distance and some in buildings attached to the hotel! Although the room and bathroom were tight for North American standards, they were adequate considering you don't spend much time in the room anyway. We did not partake in the breakfast at the hotel, but our friends who were also staying at the hotel did, and reported that it was wonderful. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel if in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darlene L
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 3 nights at this hotel and it was the very best! The location to the Eiffel Tower is excellent. The staff were great and made us feel like we were home. We had 2 rooms that connected, that worked so well for our family. The rooms are very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We will enjoy staying at this property on any future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location! Great rooms as well...”
Reviews.Author: gdmyers
Reviews.Content: Just spent a seven night stay here and enjoyed it tremendously. I have stayed in several of the Rick Steves medium priced, good location recommended hotels over the years and this is one of the best. Excellent location close to the Eiffel Tower and the Metro and RER. Metro very easy to use here in Paris. A little crowded around rush hour but what big city does not have that problem. Use the RER if your going to Versailles. The hotel is very clean, the rooms a little small compared to American standards, but if you travel at all in Europe you know this is standard. Free Wifi in the hotel with good coverage. I was on the 2nd floor (3rd in USA) and getting 54 Mbps. 30 feet away from hotel is a laundry-mat. So nice to be able to clean my clothes without having to dry them in the room. Bit of a learning curve to use the automated controls but doable. Plenty of nice restaurants around the hotel with one of the most popular being the Cafe Constant just a few yards away. Extremely popular, with 30-40 minute wait times starting 8pm on. Get their early 6-7pm to avoid the large wait times. Everyone who ate there (in our group) raved about the food. Lots of other nice cafes, bistros and higher end restaurants in the surrounding blocks. Nice store for grocery items (wine) and for getting toothpaste, etc just half a block away. The only real problem I had with the hotel was their breakfast. Very basic with a diced fruit bowl, yogurt and cereal. Great coffee though. No eggs and no way to toast your bread. Only protein was cheese or sliced salami or ham tray. The same every day, but I found that the French are not big breakfast eaters anyway. I have no problem recommending this hotel for you stay. The staff are very friendly and helpful, with great location and amenities nearby, its hard to beat. Note to use the laundry-mat, always type in the machine number first then enter you money. For soap dispenser enter in 44 then one euro coin and wait for the box to dispense. Decide on the washer size (small or large), use all the soap and fill both sides equally. Put your clothes in, select time (30 to 95 minutes) then go back to control box type in you washer number and put in the money. Same for the dryer. Couldn't be easier... Happy travels....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerParis23
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a seven night stay at the hotel. First off, the locations was excellent. Minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and many great restaurants and food shops. We walked everywhere while we were in Paris, and it is only a few miles to the major sites, which was great for us. The staff was very friendly and helpful with recommendations and arranging for transportation to and fromt the airport. The accomodations were what I had been expecting in Paris. The room was small, but very clean and well decorated, as was the bathroom and shower. We had a wonderful time on our trip and the hotel location and staff made it all that much better. If we are ever in Paris again, we will certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: MazeyHunt
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hôtel Londres-Eiffel was outstanding. The staff was accommodating and friendly. The rooms and beds were very comfortable. Modern convenient bathrooms, and an easy walk to the closest Metro stop. By the end of our four-day stay, we considered the 7th arrondissement "our neighborhood" and we were always glad to return "home" to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real 'GEM'”
Reviews.Author: Traveler584
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were with a Rick Steves tour group in early September and Hotel de Londres Eiffel was chosen for our groups' stay. Months before, we had made contact with Arnaud and Cedric for 'extra days' beyond our group tour and they proved to be the nicest, and most efficient staff to communicate with on the phone and via email. We must say they were just as nice in person too! Also at the desk was Matthias and Ninette is the one with the nice smile who greets you with a sweet BONJOUR in the breakfast room(we'd sing a French song together most mornings and attempt bridging the languages of French and English with a lot of laughter and fun!) Needless to say, a great staff was there for us,,,professional, approachable and accomodating! The hotel is located in the center of Parisian life. The neighborhood is alive with its people doing what they do, at work and at play. Restaurants, shops, Metro, the museums, the Seine...all just a walk away once you leave the hotel. Our comfy, quiet room was delightfully small but not an issue with us. It was sweetly decorated, always clean, had a full tub and shower, air conditioner to cool us on the warm nites we were there, a nice flatscreen to update us on news back home, and a cheery planter full of pink geraniums in front of our window. We'd arrive at breakfast by 7am and tables would be set. You serve yourself to an array of yogurt, fruit, meats and cheese, cereals, juices and milk. Around 7:10 the freshly baked baguettes and croissants usually are brought in with change of staff. You're served a fresh brewed pot of coffee along with a basket of those delicious warm pastires. It doesn't get any better!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roger H
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at Londres Eiffel on a Rick Steves Paris city tour and recommend it highly. The location is on a quiet side street 2 blocks from Champs de Mar, just off rue Ste Dominique, a wonderful neighborhood. Everything you could want is a short walk, including shops, a supermercato, laundries, pharmacy, ATMs. Metro stops are just a few blocks away. You have your choice from a myriad of restaurants and bars. The hotel has beautiful room interiors and public areas. Rooms on each floor vary in size. We stayed in one of the smallest, a "Room of the Poets," but certainly comfortable for us as a couple. To preserve the pristine condition of the recently remodelled hotel, the management does request that food and wine not be brought in. The English speaking front desk staff, Arnaud, Cedric, and Guy are friendly as well as efficient. A memorable highlight was the smell of the fresh, hot bread and croissants that they bring every morning from the boulanger around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: My wife & I had an absolutely wonderful trip in Paris last week and much of it thanks to the fantastic staff at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel. Arnaud & Matthias (apologize for the spelling!!) were extremely helpful and accommodating, especially considering our struggles with the French language. They provided a terrific home base while we were there, and had some great suggestions re: restaurants in the neighborhood (especially the La Fontaine de Mars - a must visit). We absolutely loved the experience. Look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for the perfect city”
Reviews.Author: KittyB41575
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 10 days in Paris. The Hôtel de Londres Eiffel was a wonderful and unexpected treat! Its location is ideal. Close to lovely restaurants (Café Constant just steps away!) and convenient to the Metro, the RER, and Bus #69, (a wonderful resource for visitors)! Some outstanding features of this beautiful little hotel: Rooms are small, compact, and efficient. But have everything you need to make your stay comfortable. We did not have a view of the Tower, but the tradeoff was that the room was quiet. No street noise, and so sleeping was undisturbed, even in a busy Paris neighborhood. (And we could see the reflection of tower twinkling if we really craned our necks!) The staff is unrivaled for attention to detail, care for its guests, knowledge about the city, and for creating and sustaining a friendly atmosphere. Arnaud and Cedric were outstanding! (Arnaud even put up with my attempts at writing and speaking French). The night manager was helpful and patient when I had an emergency. (My Blackberry was stolen on a museum visit, and I needed to report it to the company.) It's not easy to understand the intricacies of foreign telephone numbers in a stressful situation. He also helped me navigate the keyboard of the hotel computer. Ninette, the lovely lady who served us breakfast each morning was a delight to see each day! Her cheerful Bonjour, Madam! was a perfect greeting to start our day. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family who travel in Paris, and we will definitely stay there the next time we have the pleasure and luxury of this glorious city! It was a real home away from home, and I don't say that about many hotels!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pburkefox
Reviews.Content: We only spent one nite here on our way to a tour and loved it. The location is great, the neighborhood charming. We went the extra mile and got a room at the top with a view of the Eiffel tower (just this once.) What a beautiful sight at night! The staff were very friendly and spoke english, even tho I do speak a little French. The bed was very comfortable and the breakfast was lovely. I haven't yet put my photos on my computer, but the picture on the website of the view is accurate, even better in real life. Try the small restaurant down the street called Phillipes!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityGirl2011
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 (parents and 3 kids ages 6-8). We spent our first 2 nights in Paris at the Hotel de Londres (the balance was spent in a rental apartment). The location in the 7th is perfect - 5 minutes to the Eiffel Tower and nearest Metro stop and surrounded by lots of cafes and shops. I worked with Arnaud to make my reservations and check in - and he was very helpful and kind (I don't speak French). We were tired from our travels and they checked us in early (which we really appreciated!) Our connecting rooms were small, but nicely appointed and clean. It's a small, boutique-style hotel and full of charm. Only downside is the "no food in your room" rule - somewhat unrealistic when traveling with small children. Also, our particular room did not have elevator access so dragging our luggage up the stairs was tough. That said, I would recommend this hotel to anyone I knew traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Charming Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: furnacefighter
Reviews.Content: Fourth trip to Paris, second stay at Hotel de Londres Eiffel. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Paris. Staff was up to high level of service that we have come to expect from this hotel. Hotel staff remained unchanged from our last trip, it was comforting reaquainting ourselves with our Parisian friends. Very good breakfast featuring the finest coffee in France. Ipad had no trouble picking up the Wi-Fi signal. Room was always clean, lobby was recently redecorated. Fridge in the room was a nice amenity. Lots of great restaurants and many safe cash points in the area. Five minutes away from the Rue Cler. Would we stay here again? Yeah, and we did, and God willing we will stay return to Paris and stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Rnieves48864
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for 12 days & made the Hotel De Londres our home for the duration of our stay in Paris. The hotels proximity to restaurants, metro,Eiffel Tower, parks,cafes, bus & its charming residential area was wonderful. What the rooms lack in size by american standard hotel was made up for in charm,character and most importanly its grecious and hospitable staff,including Samba the hotels mascot dog. I highly reccommend this hotel & ask for room #35. I would recommend you bring additional hangers & a small iron if possible.The hotel was limited on hangers & does not provide an iron. We were very happy & satisfied with our accommodations & would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Fred S
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in a great location at reasonable price. Close to Eiffel Tower and many fine restaurants. Nice comfortable room, helpful staff particularly Cedric and Arnaud both of whom speak English. Good breakfast to start the day. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but......”
Reviews.Author: corio
Reviews.Content: There is no denying that this hotel is in a fantastic location. It is surrounded by cafes, patisseries, boulangeries, fromageries and much more. We had an extended stay at the hotel so imagine our disappointment when we were not allowed to have a snack from one of these wonderful food establishments in our room. We found this baffling as on the hotel website many of the photos show trays of food and drink in the rooms. The twin beds in the minuscule room were decidedly firm and made for many restless nights. Our room was next to the lift which generates a lot of noise. This was our fourth hotel on our trip and we rated it as the least desirable.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Torcgirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Londres Eiffel is a perfect hotel. We decided to stay at the hotel after Rick Steves recommended it. The hotel is nicely decorated, clean, quiet and in the most perfect location to see Paris. We had a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower from our 6th floor window. Which by the way is only about a 7 minute walk away. This was our first time here and the staff was very helpful, friendly and went out of their way to help us in any way that they could. The room was beautifully decorated. There is an elevator ,which was a must have for us. There are many restaurants and stores nearby . There is also a taxi stand a few steps away. And the hop on hop off bus is right near the Eiffel Tower. This hotel is most convenient to everything in Paris. Everything depicted on their website is just the same as in real life. Everything is beautiful. We loved the Hotel and we would recommend it to everyone and we will definately be staying here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location !”
Reviews.Author: Sandborne
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel was in the perfect location. There's a restaurant called Cafe Constant right beside it that we couldn't resist going back to again and again. Staff was wonderful and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Karin G
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, so we researched many hotels. We wanted a more parisiene, boutique hotel, which is what we got. However, we were very disappointed with the decor of the room....it didn't look at all like the photos posted on their website. We also knew the room would be small, but we didn't know it would be so tiny with no storage available. We could hardly walk around the room with our luggage on the floor. The bed was also very firm and low to the ground (not comfortable for our taste) and no food or drinks are allowed in the room. The bathroom was adequate. The staff and service were wonderful, the location was great, the lobby and breakfast areas were charming, and the room was very clean. We only stayed for three nights, so on our next visit to Paris, we plan on staying longer and will definitely want more comfort, luxury and amenities (including an iron, ironing board, drawer space, closet space, etc.) We would also consider staying in the 7th arrondisement again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice LITTLE hotel”
Reviews.Author: sigourneySigourney
Reviews.Content: Our recent 3 night stay at this hotel was just fine. The pluses are the friendly and helpful front desk personnel and the quiet rooms with nice decor, and most of all, the wonderful location. The only complaint we have is that the rooms are TRES PETITS! If you are above average size, I am not sure you could turn around in the room we had. And the fact that they do not furnish "Kleenex" in the rooms and only flimsy plastic glasses was somewhat annoying. They do not want you to bring food into the rooms either. We did not opt for the breakfast offered at the hotel because we thought it seemed overpriced. But 25 paces from the front door we could get an "Express Petit Dejeuner" for 7 euros at Cafe Constant that was all we wanted. Dinner there is excellent also.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely staff, who could ask for more?”
Reviews.Author: FezoRN
Reviews.Content: Spent a delightful week at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel while I helped my daughter settle into her new life in Paris. Located on a quiet street in the 7th arr. the hotel is in a wonderful location for shopping, dining, & within a short distance of Rue Cler the street food market. Better still is the Saxe/Breteuil outdoor food market held every Thursday & Saturday, by far the best outdoor market in Paris & still within a 15 minute walk of the hotel. The hotel itself is impeccably clean as was my large room. My spacious bathroom was outfitted with gleaming fixtures, well lit; complimentary toiletries were high calibre. My initial correspondence when planning this trip via email was prompt & thorough. Arnaud & Cedric greeted me each morning with a genuine smile & answered my myriad of questions. Patrice who worked nights was also delightful. When my daughter lost her apt before she even moved in, Arnaud immediately made phone calls, offered suggestions & advice & a sympathetic ear. Cedric also tried to help my daughter with her crisis. You could not ask for better service, a more welcoming reception or a lovelier place to rest your head in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and people”
Reviews.Author: DAHutton
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a great location (2 blocks from the Eiffel Tower) on a side street, so, it is quiet. Room (our room) was small, but this is Paris afterall. The owners are very nice accommodating and willing to help arrange transportation to airport, recommend restaurants. English is very good (much better than my French). Night staff is also good, servers are attentive and nice. I loved the breakfast and felt it worth it. There is no eating in the room, and while for Americans this is odd, this is the norm in France. Housekeeping is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “No space”
Reviews.Author: Geoff W
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior double for three nights as part of our anniversary celebrations. We nearly left when we saw the size of the room - just enough space to walk around both sides of the bed, and only enough room for one at a time in the shower room (no bath). The wardrobe space was very limited. Nicely decorated though. We asked for a larger room - and I was prepared to pay more - but nothing available. We stayed a little way up the road in 2010 for less per night in a larger room with a great bathroom - should have gone back there. Breakfast was ok - good coffee! Staff helpful and efficient. A good area - but Paris is so easy to get round you don' t need to be right next to the Eiffel Tower to enjoy it - and the views of it are better from a few hundred yards further away. Overall, not a good deal for the price we paid, even accepting that Paris is an expensive city now.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very small room”
Reviews.Author: wahawaha
Reviews.Content: Paris was our 2nd stop in our London/Paris/Amsterdam summer vacation, and Paris was our favorite. This hotel is in an excellent location, just 2 blocks from the Eiffel Tower, near many restaurants & a Hop on-Hop off bus stop. We did not have a tower view. We stayed here for 3 nights. This was our first trip to Paris, so I don't have a comparison of Paris hotel prices compared to room size (but I live in NY, & have been to many major cities as comparison), but we paid a lot per night & the room was extremely small.
