It had a bed in it, with about 1 & 1/2 foot of space around the sides & bottom of the bed for you to be able to walk by. If your luggage was on the floor there was no room to pass by. Elevator was very small as well. My husband and I couldn't fit in the elevator with our two suitcases, we had to take separate trips up to our room. As a plus, there was wifi in the room. Also, there is a bakery on the next block with the most amazing eclairs. I would definitely recommend buying tickets for the Hop on-Hop off bus as it stops in 8 different attractions that you would probably want to see anyway - Arc de Triomphe, Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Champs de Elysse, Notre Dame, etc., has a free audio tour & is a nice ride. Your ticket is good for 2 days, so we used this to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Best Location, Spotlessly Clean!”
Reviews.Author: larzdave
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel as a solo female traveler and as part of a Rick Steves' Best of Paris tour group for a total of 12 days in August/September 2011. Upon arrival I was greeted by name by Arnaud who not only had my room ready early but also had a packet of information about the hotel, the neighborhood and best of all-the best Paris public transportation routes serving the area. Literally within minutes of my arrival time I was able to leave my bags in my room and be out the door sampling the boulangeries and patisseries on Rue St. Dominique. The #69 bus has a stop within meters of the front door taking you directly to many famous museums and other locations in central Paris. A metro stop and an RER line are within a 7-10 minute walk of the hotel as is the fames Rue Cler street market. As for the hotel itself the rooms are small but efficient and the bathrooms are spotlessly clean and modern. A plentiful French breakfast of cold cuts, cheeses, dried fruit, yoghurt, muesli, as well as scrumptious croissants is available for an additional charge. I only had the breakfast while I was on the Rick Steves' tour and regretted that I hadn't purchased it for my additional time as well. It would have saved time and fueled me for hours. Best of all though is the welcoming, friendly assistance from the hotel's professional staff. I am already planning a return trip to Paris and will certainly stay at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: Susan O
Reviews.Content: A lovely, clean, quiet hotel in a convenient and pleasant neighborhood behind the Eiffel Tower. The staff are kind, helpful and go beyond expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot for a single traveler”
Reviews.Author: Nancy L
Reviews.Content: Nice room and attentive staff and nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Gleah
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris so we especially appreciated everyone's help while we got oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, inexpensive for Paris, great location”
Reviews.Author: SharnaC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our first wedding anniversary. We paid for a room with a view of the Eiffel tower and were not disappointed. It was absolutely lovely waking up to the tower right outside the window and watching it sparkle at night - wow! The room was small, but very clean and nicely decorated. English speaking staff were very helpful. The bakery just down the road serves the best creme beignets and if you stay here, you must try Cafe Constant on the corner - one of the best meals I have eaten in my life. Overall, a great find in a lovely neighborhood very close to the Eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharon57597
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay. It is about 5-7 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. The people there are very nice, courteous and helpful. Before we even had time to ask anything, Arnaud greeted us with a map and pointed out the sites, answered all our questions and made recommendations. We stayed in the "music" room which was charming. The room and bathroom were spotless and there were nice toiletries. The shower was small but that is the only negative. The bed was firm and very comfortable. There is a wonderful cafe down the street. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!!”
Reviews.Author: Christygal19
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very cosy. The receptionist was very friendly and helped us with the use of transport and other useful information. I really liked the rooms, how they were designed. We had connecting rooms. They were really clean. The breakfast was delicious.. The location was very good.. few minutes away from the Eiffel Tower and Champ de Mars. 5 minute walk from the metro station (Ecole Militaire) and it was also near a bus stop. For a 3 star hotel it's really really good! =]

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Even Better Staff”
Reviews.Author: Brent159
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent four nights in the hotel and have nothing but great things to say. The location was perfect, close to the Eiffel Tower/Champ du Mars, Pont d'Alma, Ecole Militaire Metro, and various restaurants, cafes, and brasseries. The WiFi worked well, the room was a great value, the bathroom was spacious by Paris standards (shower/tub combo), the windows opened, and the air conditioning was very effective. The staff at the hotel were quick to help with any questions and worked to ensure we enjoyed our stay. We would definitely stay at this location for future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be Back”
Reviews.Author: OhSunny
Reviews.Content: Very nice facility. All the staff are very friendly and helpful and certainly spoke better English than we do French. Room was clean and lovely. Very nice bathroom. The rooms have WiFi and there is also a computer in the lobby that guests can use if they didn't bring one with them. Our third stay and we will certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: MissMo2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, i would reccomend it to anyone. The room we stayed in was decorated beautifully as was the rest of the hotel and although it was compact, was really clean and modern. The staff were very helpfull, with brilliant English and you are a very short stroll from the Eifell tower. Don't forget to try the bakery around the corner and the metro station is really easy to get to. We got the metro and the RER from the airport, which was fine as we didn't have loads of luggage but beware as there are plenty steps.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: holmgc
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for more in a hotel in a major city. It is updated and clean. The location is great...a brief walk to the Metro and the Eiffel Tower. The staff was helpful and friendly. They helped organize our visit and return trip to the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “A charming little hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: RCLPerth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were travelling around Europe for our honeymoon and in Paris we stayed at Hotel Londres Eiffel- I am so glad we did! The rooms are charming, with lovely décor. From experience, most Parisian hotels are quite small, so the size of the rooms didn’t bother us (although my husband had a bit of trouble turning around in the tiny shower as he has quite broad shoulders). The location of the hotel is brilliant- so close to the Eiffel Tower, and many lovely little restaurants in the area to enjoy. Overall we were very happy with this hotel and will definitely recommend it to others visitng Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, amazing location!!”
Reviews.Author: pandita
Reviews.Content: I knew from the map that the location of this hotel was going to be good. However, when I arrived I realized it was even better!! Just a very short, 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, plenty of amazing bistros and shops. Also a short walk to Pont De L'alma and George V Blvd. Check in was very fast and my room was clean and comfortable. The room was on the small side, although it had a nice sized bed and a bathroom with great ammenities. There was also a big plasma and free wi-fi internet (in the room) which worked wonderfully!! I typically travel with my big family but this time I was on my own. This is definitely a place for couples or solo travelers, since the space is small. If you travel with family you will need to get an extra room, but I think they do not have connecting rooms, so check in advance. So overall, the place was great and provided an amazing base to explore Paris. Recommend to try out some of the bistros nearby (definitely the "Au Petit Sud Ouest" for amazing duck and foie gras) go to Rue de Cler for some nice cheese and charcuterie shops and just wander around the adjacent streets.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noodle362
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Paris for my 1st wedding anniversary at Hotel de Londres Eiffel. Was such a gorgeous little boutique type hotel and has been decorated recently and is even more gorgeous then the website shows. I loved it. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms small but perfect for a couple. A stones through from Eiffel Tower and metro with quaint little wine bars, restuarants and bakery on the same road as hotel all added to the beauitul city of Paris. All and all was perfect for what we wanted, would go back in a second. Only minor concerns was bed was very firm and with the staircase being wooden could hear people walking up and down the stairs but would not deter me.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Paris and will be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: eastpath
Reviews.Content: This reasonably priced hotel was lovely and absolutely wonderful! Very clean, staff was friendly and helpful. Very close to amenities, shops, groceries, cafes' and a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and Metro. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Perfect”
Reviews.Author: iReview1980
Reviews.Content: The title says it all really. The rooms are small but perfectly adequate for a couple on a weekend break. Beautifully decorated with a great view of the top of the eiffel tower - very pretty at night. Bathrooms spotless and reliable housekeeping service everyday. Location fantastic - five mins stroll to Eiffel Tower and ten mins to Ecole Militaire Metro Station. Staff friendly and welcoming. Only disappointment was not being able to get a coffee/chocolate to take up to bed. No room service or even help-yourself station, which was a bit disappointing. A self service drinks station would be great for those of us who get back late after a meal out and fancy a nightcap. Will return, no question. Definitely pick here if you are heading to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Short, 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: AndyMaxx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 1 night only, because our other choice was not available for our first night in Paris. We arrived late and departed early, so we cannot make any comment in regards to the breakfast, or room service (if there was any...), so will only discuss the room. We were greeted with a smile, and check in went smoothly. The lift (elevator) was tiny for sure, so that might bother some people (but hey, where there is a will, there's a way, right?). Clean, tidy, very well kept. Our room was great, and we had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower (that was good enough for me! Over all, a cute, little boutique hotel, in a fantastic neighbourhood! And like I mentioned...no breakfast experience at all at the hotel, but in my opinion...breakfast...in a hotel...in Paris...??? Where this hotel is located you really best get outside and eat some great food!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gourmont
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near the Eiffel Tower, Metro, RER stops and several excellent restaurants. We found the room very comfortable and clean. Importantly, the staff was very friendly and helpful. I stayed here with my 16 year old daughter and she stayed behind in France for another three weeks for a volunteer program. When I needed to arrange a shuttle for her to get to the airport from Gare de Lyon, the hotel was kind enough to arrange this by email without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, we'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: love2travel0226
Reviews.Content: The team at Hotel de Londres Eiffel is great. They were very helpful in arranging dinner reservations and shuttle services. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay...”
Reviews.Author: ssbe
Reviews.Content: We recently return from our second trip to Paris in 3 years. Since we enjoyed our stay on the first trip at Hotel de Londres Eiffel, we decided to stay there on our second trip since we had an excellent experience on our first trip. There are many good things about this hotel: very, very helpful staff, "clean" rooms, and a perfect location. It sits on a quiet street and you have a bakery, supermarket, laundry, metro stops and plenty of restaurants with a block or so of the hotel. You are within 5 minutes of the Eiffel Tower which makes it nice to end the evening with a bottle of wine and watch the lights on the Eiffel Tower. While everything met French standards, the rooms are small as compared to American standards, but very adequate for your stay since you spend most of your time away from the hotel. I like this hotel very much and would recommend it to friends and will stay there again. If your are in doubt, stay here. Say hello to Cedric, he's an institution there. Bob from Warner Robins GA

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was wonderful and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: LKS45
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel de Londres Eiffel for about a week. It was a great hotel and perfectly located. Cedric and the staff at Hotel de Londres Eiffel were wonderful!!! They had great suggestions and helped us find our way around Paris. Next time in Paris we will definitely stay at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel again.

Reviews.Title: “Position, Position, Position”
Reviews.Author: Calsie_11
Reviews.Content: We found the Londres Eiffel location and the quiet street exceptional. The other thing we really appreciated was the helpful staff; if ever we had a question, they were available to help with directions etc. Although the breakfast is an extra charge, it was excellent and is served by the two lovely ladies who were always a joy to be around. The rooms are quite cosy, but comfortable. If ever we are in Paris in the future, I would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Eiffel again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was incredibly helpful and very kind.”
Reviews.Author: gvilledoris
Reviews.Content: The rooms are equipped with all amenities and were roomy compared to many Paris hotel rooms. This hotel is located near the eiffel tower and near all shopping and sightseeing destinations. Most of the staff spoke English. I had a pickpocket experience and one of the staff took time to help me call the US embassy. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jim R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently traveled to Paris for the first time and stayed at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel. The staff was extremely helpful. The location in perfect - in the Rue Cler area. It is close to all the attractions - easy access to Metro - and within walking distance of the best food you can imagine. My wife and I literally ate our way throughRue Cler! Rooms were spotless and tastefully decorated. Arnaud was particularly helpful maneuvering us through Paris. He arranged for shuttle to CDG Airport - which was great as the train to the airport went on strike the day we planned to leave. We also were so very happy to see Simba the Puppy each day. We are dog lovers and missed ours - so it was like a touch of home. I strongly recoomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rick Steves 7 Day Paris Tour”
Reviews.Author: Gayle90
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to win a trip to Paris with the Rick Steve Europe Through the Back Door last year--scheduled for June 2010. We tour was booked in this hotel which turned out to make the tour even better than expected. The hotel is very well furnished and each room is clean, modern and has a bathroom with shower. It's located close to the Eiffel Tower and is within walking distance to all of the world famous sites. I will definitely choose to stay here when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A charming, well-run and well organized small hotel within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower.”
Reviews.Author: judynwes
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the neighborhood feeling this hotel location gave us. There are excellent restaurants, pastry and bread stores, green grocers, wine shops, anything a visitor could need nearby. The staff was accommodating and always pleasant with any requests. The hotel is newly updated and pleasantly decorated. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Postcard Pretty and close to Rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: sarahej
Reviews.Content: Thank you Rick Steves for recommending Londres Eiffel. Location, location, location. The hotel is close to Rue Cler, Eiffel Tower, metro station, great little markets, fantastic brasseries, etc. The rooms have character and just enough space for those more intent on discovering Paris than lounging in a hotel room. We overlooked Rue Augereau across from a wonderful flower shop and watched the baguettes being delivered to the hotel every morning. Tres Parisien! It's not a Hilton or a Sheraton or anything like a chain hotel. The front staff were very helpful and the croissants and coffee in the morning were just what we needed before heading out to get in our second round of croissants on Rue Cler. Free internet access in the lobby was nice.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: mike1088
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel in an ideal location and with friendly, helpful staff. The location was perfect, within walking distance of the Eiffel tower and Les Invalides. Staff were extremely helpful in giving us Metro/RER directions to Notre Dame and Gare du Nord. Our adjoining rooms were not large but were perfectly acceptable for our needs, and as one of the other reviews says, who goes to Paris just to stay in the room?? If I had one criticism, it would be that the en suite shower was rather small. It could be an issue for someone of a larger build, but that’s just being picky. We would definitely stay here again. Thank you Cedric and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Deekarlen
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to Paris and it was the BEST hotel!! The staff helped us with restaurant locations and taxis especially the one at 5am. The decor of the room was great. We traveled with 2 teenagers and having 2 bathrooms was a priority. The view from the 5th floor was breathtaking. The Eiffel Tower was our "night light". We got to see it sparkle each night. The breakfast was nice and a good start to the day. The location was the best---3 blocks from the Eiffel Tower, buses and boats. And the hotel was surrounded by shops and restaurants. I would love to revisit this wonderful hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Cookie48570
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable rooms even though small. The staff was great, always friendly and helpful. A great location, very "neighborhood" feel.

Reviews.Title: “If we return to Paris again we know where we will be staying.”
Reviews.Author: David6_11
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with a wonderful, freindly and helpful staff. The location was perfect and within walking distance to Eiffel tower. Also very close to the Metro and bus stops for connections to major points of the city. Also very close to the Seine and the RER train which takes you to Versailles. Rooms are small but recently renovated and clean, with little to no street noise. But who goes to Paris just to stay in the room??. Arnaud and Cedric at the desk went out of their way to assist us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, wonderful staff, wonderful view, wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: madge63
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from trip advisor and it did not disappoint. We requested a view room and it was great. The location is great, food nearby was great(Cafe Constant and his other places as well) , we were close to the subway, and of course, the tower was right there! I want to thank Arnaud, Cedric, Isabelle, and the rest of the staff for being so helpful with reservations, transfers, and diligent about making sure things were done right. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, good choice.”
Reviews.Author: ruslov
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from trip advisor and were not disappointed. Booked a room with a view and it was great, just as advertised. Had a problem with being picked up at the airport, but the staff made sure that the company that did not pick us up compensated us for the cost of alternate service. The staff was very responsive to our requests by email for dinner reservations and any other questions. Our thanks to Arnaud, Cedric, Isabelle, and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: HawaianCruise2004
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel which has recently been renovated and is very comfortable and clean. The location is just perfect, within walking distance to restaurants and shops and the Eiffel Tower. The staff is efficient, friendly, helpful, very service-oriented. Before we arrived, they made suggestions for our transfers from the airport and back and made the arrangements for us - one less detail we had to contend with. Upon our arrival, after an exhausting overnight flight without sleep, they graciously arranged to have our room ready for us four hours prior to check-in time, even though we didn't ask for that courtesy. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: SandBTokyo
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with Hotel Londres Eiffel. Firstly the location is great; it is a few minutes walk from the Eiffel tower and many nice cafes, restaurants and shops. The area is a beautiful neighborhood, very authentic Paris feel and easy access to all the main sites in Paris. It is a small hotel with the staff always helpful and kind, and they will speak English if necessary. We felt very welcome there. The hotel is clean, which is a key for us. The rooms are modern and comfortable, although small which I guess will bother some people. The bathroom can be quite tight. The size was not an issue for us as we are willing to accept it. They gave us WiFi access upon arrival for our whole stay. We had the top floor facing the Eiffel tower for the first few nights, this was given to us upon request with no extra cost. It was romantic to watch the tower at night. For the last night we were moved down to a lower floor. Both rooms were of high quality in cleanliness and comfort. The breakfast is nice and relaxing. I found it better than going out to a cafe as there were more choices and everything was tasty and fresh. The spread is not big, but quite enjoyable nonetheless. We had a great experience at this hotel and would happily return and highly recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect boutique hotel for a perfect visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: 0206Susan
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to all points Paris-- stroll to the Eiffel and minutes from buses and metros. The staff made us feel as if we were their only guests. Our room was perfectly comfortable, exceptionally clean and very well appointed. Modern bathroom had all of the amenities one could need. Isabelle and her hand-picked staff make you feel as if you are staying with old friends. For our first visit for our 40th wedding anniversary, this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BBoomer53
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in early May. The service from the front desk staff was very good, and they were always ready to help with anything. Comprehension of English varied from excellent to good. The reception area was still being finished - it presently has a wooden floor, which makes that area, and the lounge it incorporates, and the breakfast room off it, noisy - a problem compounded by the breakfast wait staff talking with each other very loudly, sometimes yelling, which wasn't conducive to a pleasant start to the day. Against that, however, breakfast was always served promptly and was of good quality. There was a computer in the reception area available for guests, but the keyboard is French, and although you can switch the computer language/keyboard to English, of course the physical marks on the keyboard don't change, so you need to remember where all the punctuation and some of the letters are on an English version - the European arrangement marked on the keyboard is quite different. On some sites, like gmail, the computer had a habit of resetting to French once you sent anything, so you have to keep checking. Given that the vast majority of guests at this hotel were English-speaking, perhaps the hotel might consider installing an English keyboard, or having wireless keyboards, one for European and one for English that could be easily swapped. The room - we had a pavilion room in the annexe at the back - was very comfortable and large enough (for Paris) with plenty of hanging space, a drawer and good shelves in the wardrobe, along with a small fridge for personal use (nothing in it except what you might put in it). The bathroom was a treat - far bigger than I'd expected, all new and shining, fully tiled, large walk-in shower with sliding glass door and excellent shower heads and water pressure. The bed was comfy and the pillows good. They also had multiple accessible power points for charging phones and devices, and also free wireless throughout, a big plus. The air-conditioner worked well and there was a large, openable window to the courtyard. At night the area was very quiet, ensuring easy rest. The premier feature of this hotel is its location. The area is perfect for reaching all the main sights easily, be it the Eiffel Tower five minutes walk away, or Versailles by the RER, about five minutes brisk walk to that station. The metro is about 5 mins the other way. Rue Cler is a few blocks away, and every street, including the one the hotel is on, has numerous good restaurants - easy to eat well without ranging far. We had friends who were simutaneously staying at a very nice hotel in the Latin Quarter, where the night life was very lively and the restaurants even more plentiful, but the noise through the night kept them awake - we had no such problems as the area of the Londres-Eiffel is essentially mid-to-upper level residental. The old buildings in the streets around Champs du Mars are lovely - and pricey - so no noisy students to disturb your rest. I have only two quibbles about this hotel - the first being the noisiness of the reception area, even when there are few people there. One can only hope they are going to re-carpet soon, which will immediately solve the problem. My second quibble arises because of the predominance of tour groups (Rick Steve's tours, I believe), and the fact that the hotel has no adequate space to house their necessary meetings. This resulted in us having to tip-toe our way, trying to be unobtrusive, which was utterly impossible, straight through group meetings on multiple occasions just to get from the front door to our room. That was not comfortable for either us or the tour group and their leaders. The hotel management needs to address this issue because it mars an otherwise excellent experience, and the location, location, location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel with helpful staff in very nice area”
Reviews.Author: katonahkid
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this hotel and we found the rooms to be clean, the bathrooms very nice, but the lack of space surprised us - however we understand it is not unusual for Paris. More on that later. The location is excellent. There are many restaurant choices just outside the hotel entrance, including one Michelin rated - so if you are tired after a long day of sightseeing you don't have to go far for a very good meal. There are a lot of appealing shops just outside, plus many more a few minutes away on Rue Cler. Rue Cler has a lot of food offering and many shops and restaurants. One of my favorite things was buying bread, chocolate, cheese, wine and pastries and enjoying them when we wanted. There are also convenient stores nearby, so if you need picnic things or bottled water, it's right outside your door too. We also enjoyed getting pastry for breakfast in nearby shops - it was a real treat. If you look you will find some that also sell tea and coffee (café au lait for me). As far as transportation goes, it's a little less than a 10 minute walk to the Metro or the RER (the latter is the way to Versailles as well as Notre Dame and Musée d'Orsay area). There are buses even closer, but this being our first trip here I spent more time on the trains because I was more confident there. However if you want to take public transportation to the Arc de Triomphe area - the bus is the way. You are also a short walk from the Eiffel Tower and the Seine (where you can begin a river cruise which I recommend), but we found the Eiffel Tower area to be more like Times Square (I work in NYC), with tourists all over the place and people selling junk. We also never climbed the Tower because of the crowds, and we heard the Arc de Tiromphe view was better because you could see everything while closer to the ground (I would agree from my experience). However, we did find ourselves drawn to the park located south of the tower (2 minutes from the hotel) and it was fun to watch the people - especially at night. The English speaking staff at the hotel was very helpful with recommendations and making reservations for us. It was clear they would do anything to make our stay more enjoyable. About the space - we had a regular sized room and I walked it and I got 9 x 12. There was a small half closet that was in the wall, so my wife couldn't hang a dress, but it accomodated several shirts and pants. There was no other storage, not even dressers, just a small desk and end tables. That said, we used every inch of the place to make ourselves comfortable, were used to it in a day, and the size definitely didn't detract from our stay. I would just say get a bigger room if you can afford it. We simply didn't because we couldn't tell from the website that the rooms with the Eiffel view were larger. In summary, a very nice hotel in a desirable location and we would definitely return. A great trip overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ia2k
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in March. Five minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, metro accessible from there. The rooms are clean, well decorated, and cozy (it's Paris, majority of rooms in hotels are on the smaller side, no complaints on room size). The staff was extremely friendly - I mistakenly picked the wrong room in my booking and Cedric got us in the right room. We also arrived at 8am and had a room ready for us - thanks!!! There was another front desk attendant that was extremely friendly as we came and left the hotel. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel, but there is a great place to pick up croissants and more just a few doors down, delicious. Rue Cler nearby - hotel on border of Tourist area and Locals.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: shaznay76
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel late and entered a building site. There wasn't a reception room and we had to walk over rubble and dodge builders before we got to a room with a man behind a desk. They said there was going to be temporary building work during our stay and as there was no restaurant t we had to have breakfast in our rooms. We weren't notified or told at any time that building work was going to be happening while we were staying there and we were paying full price. Our room was very small and the beds were very uncomfortable. In the morning we complained to the manager and after a while he moved us to another hotel. Awful experience when you're spending just a weekend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Truly charming hotel near the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: DiZzyDMon
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. We stayed here on our last night in France because it is very close to the Eiffel Tower, where we were having dinner that evening. The hotel was being renovated the day we stayed. We weren't sure where to enter, because the lobby reconstruction was in full swing the afternoon we arrived (April 15, 2011). Don't worry - by the time you visit the renovation will be complete. The staff were quite helpful and very apologetic that we had to endure the renovation (and gave us a discount on our rate), though we found it fun to dodge the (very polite and helpful) workers and fascinating to watch the lobby come into shape. Our room was one of those whose renovation was complete. The renovation is so well done - tastefully appointed, very stylish, lovely choice of demure colors and fabrics. I really like that they put extra light switches and plugs inside little nooks on either side of the bed, with a shelf just big enough to hold small personal belongings - quite a nice touch. The bathroom was well appointed and comfortable, just right for freshening up before dinner. There are all sorts of wonderful dining and shopping possibilities in every direction around the hotel (including not one but two laundromats on the relatively quiet side street the hotel is located on). I only wish we could have stayed here longer, but (sigh) all good things must come to an end...

Reviews.Title: “Aloha in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RaygErng
Reviews.Content: Stayed there the last week of March. Took Eurostar form London and were able check immmediately. They made us feel at home right away-very courteous-showed the Aloha spirit- although the room is small by US standards, we weren't planning spending too much time in there. Area is very convenient-Supemarche , patisserie's, cafe's , Eiffel Tower, buses all a couple minutes away. My AC wasn't working too good, but didn't need it-quiet neighborhood so open window wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good neighborhood to use as a base for your travels”
Reviews.Author: maxwellst
Reviews.Content: They were just upgrading the hotel lobby when we stayed there, so it should be spanking fresh and new as of spring 2011. The location is the main selling point: you are walking distance from the Eiffel Tower, which puts you at a pleasant walk from the Champs-Elysees and other destinations. Plus, the neighborhood is clean, quiet and upscale, as compared with some other pockets of Paris. The hotel itself is snug. The rooms are very small, albeit nicely appointed, so if you are looking for something more modern, this is not the destination. But it is most definitely characteristic of the older Paris of artists and poets while kept very clean and updated (plumbing, etc.) so if you are looking for character, this may suit you well. Note: Be sure to ask for a view of the Eiffel Tower if you want it (although it's just a little peak over the rooftops). We paid 360 Euro for a family suite (two small bedrooms with two locking doors, also ideal for couples traveling in tandem).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting and helpful service”
Reviews.Author: daphne68
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I were in Paris for 5 nights at the end of March, 2011. Our arrangements were made online with the staff at Londres-Eiffel. They were always helpful, polite and eager to be of service. As requested, they arranged for the paris shuttle to meet us at CDG. Friendly greetings met us coming and going, in and out of their door each day. Our room was tiny (as are most in Paris), but comfortable enough. Nothing luxurious about it, but all necessities were met and it was clean. One gaff -- they tore out their lobby mid-stay! We left one morning and came back that evening to an empty front room. A little notice might have been nice, but every staff member we interacted with after that was graciously apologetic. It didn't interfere with our trip, but it was a surprise! More than anything else, the location of Londres-Eiffel is excellent. A few moments walk from the Ecole Militaire metro and the Eiffel Tower. Walking along Rue Grenelle and Rue St. Dominique is wonderful. And, don't miss the restaurant next door, FL. The chef, Nicholas Valanchon, is unpretentious as are his food and wine pairings -- delicious. Check out www.parisbymouth.com for a great Paris food blog with many suggestions. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: maripili1977
Reviews.Content: This place immediately felt like home. As a previous reviewer noted, they are completely remodelling the lobby, and so they have had to set up a makeshift reception area. However, this doesn't detract in any way from the immediately warm and personalised approach to the customer. The room my husband and I had was great for two people: good closet space, clean and beautifully decorated, the bathroom was one of the best I've ever seen (shower was heavenly). We also were able to sleep comfortably and without any noise. Walk out in the morning and you are five minutes from the Eiffel Tower and several Métro stations, not to mention that there are great cafés, épiceries and bakeries in the surrounding area. I strongly recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Way too small!”
Reviews.Author: drhale50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 day trip to Paris. We were quite disappointed in this hotel mainly because of the size of the room and the misrepresentation of having a breakfast when there wasn't any due to their renovating the breakfast area. I had been in communication with them prior to our arrival however there was no mention of the renovation. Also there was constant noise outside our room from construction. But the main problem was the size of the room! There was no place to put our suitcases, so we left them on the floor which took up walking area around the bed. We had requested a double/ which was 2 twin beds put together. There was only the space of 1 suitcase on either side of the bed. It was almost untolerable, except for the fact that we were new to Paris and didn't know how to make changes. The only good point was that the hotel was about 3 blocks from the Eiffel Tower. Also we did not get a view of it. The staff was nice enough but I would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, spotlessly clean and really friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CarolTansley
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel over the weekend and we could not fault it one bit. We arrived at the hotel via a shuttle bus which was organised through the hotel and were warmly greeted by Arnaud at reception. Even though we arrived mid morning, we were immediately given a key to the room and found it to be spotlessly clean. Most hotel rooms in Paris are small so we had no problem with this. The beds were very comfortable and both the bedroom and bathroom looked brand new. Decor was lovely and it looked as if the hotel put some thought into it. We were told that the dining room was being renovated but could have breakfast in our room. We didn't opt for this and went around the corner to the patissserie for breakfast al frescoinstead. Mention must also be made to Cedric who arranged for coffee for us late Sunday morning and didn't charge us for it. He is a very genial, friendly and helpful person. The location is superb. Lovely boutiques around the corner and hair salon right next to the hotel, all of which we tried out with great results! I would go back here again and again. Great value, great location and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, nicely decorated, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ailskin
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 2 nights staying in this hotel. Like most Parisian hotels the room was small enough but was newly decorated and very clean. The staff were very friendly and the hotel is well located. It's also situated on a nice quiet street. Only downside was that the dining room was being done up so we had to go out for breakfast (not too bad) but we weren't informed of this when booking. Will be nice to have the use of it when we return on another visit. :)

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: ready2travel06
Reviews.Content: The proximity to the Eiffel Tower, rue Cler, Constant restos ... excellent! Rooms quite small - fitting 2 twin beds gave very little room to open your suitcase, even when traveling 'carry-on only.' But charmingly renovated somewhat recently. The lobby is hopefully on the list for renovation soon - very tired looking, not like the photos on their web site. No morning breakfast room at this time, but room service offered (extra 12 euro when room booked with the on-line promotion rate). Very helpful reception staff. Both my friend and I used the airport transfer service offered by the hotel (Paris Shuttle, 28 euro), arriving separately. Each of us experienced problems with them - extended waits until they filled the van with pick-ups at different terminals, last to be delivered to hotel 1.5 hrs later. Avoid, if possible! Back to the hotel - very nice, good value, enjoyed my stay, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Turn81
Reviews.Content: As a young couple this was a great hotel to stay in. I couldnt fault it at all. The room was smallish (but have seen smaller!), decorated very nicely, and very comfortable. It might be a small room, but it was a big bed! We were also lucky as, like other reviewers, we were upgraded into room 62 on the top floor which had a great view of the Eiffel Tower. The breakfast room was being redecorated, and so they told us breakfast would be in our room. This was actually much better, as it was effectively room service whenever you wanted it! Lovely croissants! For some reason they then deducated the cost of breakfast from our bill at the end, which was another bonus...! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and really tried to make sure everything was OK during out stay, without being over bearing. In terms of the location, obviously you are right next to Eiffel Tower, and also it is only a short walk to the river. Metro station is also only a couple minutes walk. There are so many lovely things on your doorstep I can hardly remember them all, but within yards there are lovely resturants and a wonderful Macaroon shop. I will definately be recommending this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: GR_xoxo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights, and was simply a place to sleep as there was so much to do during the day. Work was being carried out in the dining area, so we were upgraded to a room with a view at no extra charge. The room was a decent size, and what you would expect for Paris, most buildings being tall instead of wide. The bathroom was fairly small, as was the stand in shower, but still manageable. This hotel is fantastic, if only for the area in which it is located, with plenty of restaurants with reasonable prices (Try les Cocettes, turn right out of the hotel, turn right at the end of the road, rhen walk about 2 minutes!), numerous shops and patisseries. The supermarket is only around the corner, so we could pick up a few snacks and drinks for the day. The hotel charges 10 Euros each for breakfast, but we went elsewhere. All staff we came across spoke English, and were really very friendly and helpful. Much like a previous review, we were also getting a late train home, so had to leave our bags in the hotel lobby, which also left me feeling quite unsettled for most of the day, even though we were reassured that a member of staff would be in the lobby all day so the bags would be ok, but would have still much preffered the bags to be stored elsewhere, away from the view of others. Will likely get an earlier time in transport on my next visit, to avoid this. Other than that slight issue, the hotel cannot really be faulted, for us, a perfect location and a perfect stay, will be staying here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Staff and Locale--Now Our Favorite Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTeachers
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much returning to Hotel de Londres when we visited Paris, because of its location, charm, and accommodating staff. We celebrated our 10th anniversary during this stay and in 2001 honeymooned at Hotel de Londres--enjoying the view of, and close proximity to, the Eiffel Tower. Each stay encourages us to return since the excellent location makes it convenient for us to visit the major historic and cultural sites of Paris and the staff is very helpful and gracious. We enjoyed walking to many interesting nearby places and found it convenient to access the Metro or the bus (be sure to purchase multiple one-ride tickets at any Metro Station). Depending on the direction, the 69 Bus runs along the nearby streets of Saint Dominique and Rue de Grenelle. Nearby Hotel de Londres are a floral shop, butcher shop, chocolate shop, a bakery, a small super market, a laundry mat, the postal office, a wine shop, several nice clothing shops and a variety of nice bistros, cafes and restaurants. Around the corner from the hotel is the La Fontaine de Mars bistro where President and Mrs. Obama had lunch with one of their daughters and two friends two years ago and another block away is the wonderful rue Cler which, with its many interesting shops, is a great place to stroll, unhindered by traffic (since it's closed to cars and allows abundant room for strolling along the cobblestone promenade). On this trip we learned that the hotel is almost complete in remodeling all 30 rooms. Remodeling the reception area was scheduled to be completed soon after our stay, so we know it will be especially nice at the time of our next visit. Much detailed and well-designed work was reflected in the remodeled rooms and bathrooms. I liked the towel warmer and the efficient use of shower space in the bathroom. Each room has its unique interior design for variety. It was easy to sleep, because the rooms were quiet and dark at night. The bathroom hardware, tile work, etc. is the best we have ever experienced in our extensive travels. The breakfast each morning was quite nice and the setting was very comfortable and very nicely decorated and cozy. On this trip we revisted the Louvre, climbed the stairs of the Arch of Triumph and sat on the steps of Sacre Coeur and gazed across Paris enjoying seeing it beautifully lighted at night. A real treat was seeing the sparkling lighting of the Eiffel Tower as we returned to the hotel. Our main goal on this trip was to explore the neighborhood of Hotel de Londres (primarily the area between the Eiffel Tower and the Sorbonne). We received great recommendations from Cedric and Arnaud at the front desk. My favorite colorful street to walk is rue Cler and began the walk at its intersection with rue de Grenelle. I discovered an Outlet Store at 71 Avenue Bosquet, 75007 where I purchased several cashmere sweaters. Arnaud, Cedric and Patrice were helpful in recommendating sites and restaurants. We highly recommend the following restaurants which are within walking distance of Hotel de Londres: Gusto Italia 199 rue de Grenelle, 75007 Paris Tel. 01.45 55 00 43 Le Petit Cler Maison Boudon 29 Rue Cler, 75007 Paris Tel. 01.45 50 17 50 Bellota-Bellota (Spanish) 18 rue Jean-Nicot Tel. 01.45 55 64 04 Sancerre (for breakfast) 22 Avenue Rapp, 75007, Paris Tel. 01.45 51 75 91 As a souvenir I got my hair shampooed and styled by Gilbert who works at Un Look Pour Toous. He is located only two blocks away at 39 avenue Rapp, 7500067 Tel. 01.47 05 9151 Outlet Store 71 Avenue Bosquet, 75007 Paris 01 45 55 21 11 and at 34 Avenue de la Motte Piquet, 75007 Paris 01 45 50 39 90 NKO Cashmere 116, rue Saint Dominique, 75007, Paris +33 0 1 45 51 05 05

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Debsydoorknocker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February with our 12 year old daughter. We never normally stay anywhere with less than 4 stars but that was in the days when my daughter shared a room with us! Now we need two rooms and as Paris is so expensive we had to lower our usual standards. I was a bit appehensive about staying here I must admit despite the good reviews. We arrived in the evening to a very welcoming male receptionist but I did think reception looked a little tatty and small. We were given our rooms and used a small lift to reach them on the second floor. The rooms themselves were very nice and I believe newly decorated but they were small and cramped. We had one room over looking the back and the other overlooked the front. I was disappointed as I was led to believe the rooms were interconnected but they were two seperate rooms and therefore I ended up having to sleep in with my daughter as I did not feel comfortable allowing her to sleep alone. We slept in the room overlooking the front and I had the window open in the night as I dont like it stuffy. However I had to get up during the night and close it as it was very noisy. The bathrooms were very clean (as were the bedrooms) and I have no complaints at all. We never used the breakfast room and I didnt even know where it was as noone told us. There was a vending machine near the stairs to get coffee so I assumed they didnt have kitchen facitlities!! Work was being carried out during our stay and every morning we were awoken by banging. The builder had dragged a cable all the way up the stairs outside our room which was so dangerous. The location is excellent and you cannot fault it. The area is wonderful, plenty of restaurants, a supermarket and lots of lovely patisseries with fantastic french pastries and most of them do coffee/tea and have seating areas in them so getting breakfast was never a problem. The Eiffel tower is just around the corner and you can also get the tour buses here which will take you around all the main areas in Paris. I would stay here again simply for its cleanliness and its location. It does what it says on the tin! Provides you with comfy accommodation at a reasonable cost and in a good location. I would just know exactly what to expect next time. Oh, one other thing. We were not travelling until 4pm on departure so we asked to leave our cases somewhere. They obliged but when we returned, we realised they had left them in reception all day together with other peoples cases. I had bought a Tiffany necklace on my holiday and was horrified to think that this was left sitting in my bag in reception all day! I also had a panic when they aked me in the airport if anyone could have tampered with the cases and I realised that yes, matbe they could have. I kept quiet and just prayed that noone had!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: pintac90
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my dad and teen daughter to Paris in December. Although the weather was cold we had a wonderful time. The hotel was very nice and comfortable. Although the rooms are small they are just being completely renovated. I stayed in a new room, the bathroom was nice and clean and the room furniture was totally new. It has free Wifi and cable tv. The hotel is located very close to the Eiffel tower, 2 minute walk and is surrounded by typical french restaurants, boulangeries, cafes, supermarket etc the neighborhood is wonderful. The Metro is 2 blocks away and that connects you anywhere you want to go. What really makes this hotel stand out is the front desk staff. They were extremely accommodating and helpful. The tips they gave us were priceless. I have to say that without their help our trip to Paris would have been much more difficult. We enjoyed eating in restaurants they recommended where the food was very good and not to pricey. My wife will be traveling to Paris next week and she will definitely stay at this hotel. Merci beaucoup to Matheaus and all the other front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “can't imagine a better experience”
Reviews.Author: argus18
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to France and my husband and I were celebrating our anniversary. We had decided that we'd like to stay in a "quintessentially French" hotel. We found it here! The rooms are quaint and small but plenty of room for two. There is a good size bathroom. I saw someone posted there was no lift, but there is a very tiny lift if needed. We stayed on the second floor and it was wonderful. Windows opened out onto the street where you could watch people come and go. The front desk staff was warm and friendly and patient with us when we tried out our broken French on them. We were blocks from so many awesome things. The restaurant called Le Bistro 7me was fantastic! The street market on Rue Cler, Le Fontaine de Mars, the Eiffel Tower, it is close to the train stations and the neighborhood was so beautiful. We feel like we really lucked out by staying at this hotel and can't imagine going anywhere else in the future. We're already planning our next trip to France and will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, very cozy”
Reviews.Author: GenW
Reviews.Content: Sensational location for Paris in my favourite neighbourhood, the 7eme, just off Rue St Dominique. Had a small poets room at the back of the hotel, second floor, no lift, so taking large luggage up and down stairs would have been difficult. No view at the back, but very quiet & peaceful. Room was small but comfortable, recently refurbished and had a sparkling new bathroom. Very clean. Good value overall, but did have a kind of small and cramped feeling being at the back and up two flights of narrow stairs. I didn't love it as much as some other reviewers but great value for the area and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel w/ cozy rooms in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDiver399
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris this past April and stayed at this hotel with a friend. The hotel is in a great location, just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower. The park in front of the Eiffel Tower is only two blocks to the west of the hotel. There are several restaurants down the street, a laundromat and a grocery store are across from the hotel. Around the corner from the hotel are a couple of stores, including a chocolate and wine shop. Rue Cler, with its open air market stalls, is about 5 or 6 blocks east. The hotel itself is small, cozy, and wonderful, almost like a second home. On the first floor of hotel is a lobby and dining area for breakfast, which was included during our stay. Breakfast consisted of yogurts, cereal, some cold cuts of meat, several cheeses, and dried and fresh fruit. There is a computer located in a little nook by the lobby, but they use a different keyboard than the US does, but I had no trouble using it, you just have to double check the keys when using it. There's also a small elevator. When I say small I mean really really small. My friend and I were traveling with a large rolling suitcase and a backpack each, and we were barely able to fit inside the elevator. The rooms are tiny, and consisted of two single beds pushed together, with a table on either side of the bed. On the wall across the foot of a bed was a small work desk and chair with a TV. Next to the desk was bureau/closet that was dug into the wall. We had to put our rolling luggage and backpacks into the closet otherwise there would be no room to walk around. Attached to the room is a small bathroom containing a standing shower, sink, and toilet. The bathroom was separated from the room with a sliding door. If found the room to be pleasant, and the beds comfortable, but I don't recall finding a control for a heater or air conditioner inside the room. I think every room has a window that can be opened (everyone I spoke to had at least one window in their room). It was great to be able to open the window in the morning and breathe in the cold crisp air. You could smell the city waking up, not a bad way to begin the morning. When we first arrived I thought the staff seemed distant and aloof, but after awhile they seemed to warm up and were very friendly and attentive. One night a few of us were in the lobby talking about what we wanted to do that evening. A friend commented on how she wanted a cup of coffee at the time. The man working the desk disappeared for a bit then came back to our group and announced that he had made some coffee for us. He even walked us into the kitchen and made us our coffees. The staff were always able to recommend nearby spots to us. And they were all kind enough to help me bone up on my French. This hotel is a great place to stay, in terms of location, affordability, convenience, and helpful staff. I would stay here again, and recommended it to my parents who were looking for a place to stay in Paris for their trip.

Reviews.Title: “That's the spot!”
Reviews.Author: Sasharoo
Reviews.Content: This place was a great little find. We of course love the location. It was easy enough to get to Metro and minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. We stayed in the poets house, room 107. It's in the back past the breakfast area and was quiet, no elevator and no views but nice. Our room is the black and white one with grey and the bathroom was all redone in tiny grey tiles. It was a little tight in the room, but that seems to be expected in Europe I would think. The breakfast was 5 Euros each and was worth it. Breakfast ladies were a slice, always laughing and singing. Overall Great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for a First Time Traveler to Paris”
Reviews.Author: JETEX
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby staff were excellent in providing service and assistance in seeing the sights. The breakfast ladies were very friendly. Across the street there was an economical coin operated laundry mat. Easily reduced the amount of clothes for this trip, if I knew. Next door was a Supermarket. Dry cleaners and tailors easy block away. At least three restaurants in the neighborhood as well as a bakery (best bread) and chocolate and coffee shop. Pizza is down the block as well as a nice Italian restaurant. Rue Cler is an easy walk to neat small shops. Of course, the Eiffel Tower, the Tracadero, the Seine are a couple of blocks away as well as transit stations.

Reviews.Title: “More than we could have hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: DJT01
Reviews.Content: I wanted to have my 50th birthday in Paris, and spent considerable time locating what I hoped would be a memorable room for the (all too) short stay. We booked a room on the 6th floor, hoping the views would be as good as other reviewers had said. But what we did not know was that we would find ourselves in a lovely hotel, with wonderful and friendly staff, and a truely beautiful room with a view of the Eiffel Tower which I will remember forever. The hotel's location in the 7th Arr. is fantastic with great cafes and restaurants, and the Eiffel Tower itself, within easy walking distance, as is the (very easy to use) Metro. Our room (#64) was small, so don't expend a grand suite, but this is Paris! We also made use of the Airport Shuttle to and from CDG, which is good value at 20 Euros each, in fact as we are not Parisien, the white knuckled drive into Paris was worth it alone! To Arnaud, Cedric and the rest of the staff at Hotel de Londres, thank you. To other travellers, I highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: ruthio17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the fall and had such a wonderful experience. After trying to book several hotels and having no luck, I found openings at this hotel. I was wondering if all the "good hotels" had been taken, but was pleasantly surprised upon our arrival. The desk staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our room the most out of the three we stayed in while in Europe. The location couldn't be better. We walked to the metro station, the Eiffel Tower, and the most magnificent bakery. Do yourself a favor and enjoy breakfast one day (or every day, like we did) at Les Gourmandises D'Eiffel (on Rue de Grenelle). Great memories! We also enjoyed dining at Cafe Constant twice. Very good food. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for Paris vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kmr75
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Londres Eiffel was a great home base for exploring Paris. It's a few minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower and close to bus stops and the train station so we never took a taxi. We walked to the Louvre as well. The staff were very cordial and offered to help in any way they could. The hotel had a computer in the lobby that we could use and the gentleman at the desk helped us when we were stuck trying to access email because of the difference in language. On the corner, 30 second walk from our hotel, is the Cafe Constant. A great place to have dinner and so convenient when you're tired from traveling or exploring. Amazing bakeries for breakfast and the grocery store are also very close. Our room was small, but not too small for comfort and most importantly very clean. Nice shower and bathroom and closet for hanging clothes. Loved having a small refrigerator in the room as well. We travel a lot and are picky about hotels so it says a lot when we have so many positives to say about a hotel. It was a big part of making our Paris trip so wonderful that we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Tres magnifique! Great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelLF
Reviews.Content: This hotel came to feel like home to us. We were there for 9 days. We went on to Rome and to Venice, but I must say that Paris was the most beautiful and wonderful city of them all. The people were so friendly and so helpful, everywhere we went. We tried hard not to be “ugly Americans” and tried to fit in and speak as much French as we could. We knew just enough to get around, and beyond that people helped us. Truly a great experience in a wonderful and incredibly beautiful city with such fantastic history. The Hotel Londres-Eiffel is situated in the Rue Cler arrondissement (neighborhood) which is considered the "American quarter." Many people speak English, all are helpful. The Eiffel tower is a few blocks away, as is Rue Cler. The Paris metro is easy to master and makes it easy to reach every part of the city. The rooms are a bit small, but very clean, and this is Europe after all. The top floors have partial views of the Eiffel Tower. I didn't expect much from the view, but I must say that when the Eiffel tower strobe lights start sparkling in the hour, every hour, it is simply delightful to see this from your very own room! Very charming, very beautiful, and very romantic. The staff at the Hotel Londres-Eiffel were wonderful. Mr. Cedric was very helpful when planning the trip, and what a wonderful smile once we arrived! The other gentleman at the desk whose name I did not get was really, really great! He was there for most of the time for our 9-day stay and worked very long days. That gentleman went out of his way to provide assistance, and even during what were obviously stressful and difficult times with many people making demands, he kept a smile and was very professional and courteous. Tough job! If you are looking for a Paris experience, this hotel is one to stay at. The bathrooms are "American" enough to make us comfortable--we had some strange bathrooms in other locations! :-) But the room size and decor and those wonderful, wonderful French windows make it all very European. We hope to return soon and will recommend this hotel to friends. Stop at the cafe on the corner for a double espresso! Tell them I sent you! After all, I feel as if Hotel Londres-Eiffel is my home-away-from-home in Paris! And how cool is that?

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! BAD SERVICE! Sold our room and lied to us!”
Reviews.Author: ajblackers
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here after seeing all the good reviews on Trip Advisor. We specifically chose this hotel because it was walking distance from my parents hotel - we knew we'd be getting in late on a Friday night and wanted to be able to quickly change, then walk to meet my parents for a planned supper without any taxi fuss. I called to confirm the booking at around 5pm, advising we would be in late around 10pm and making sure they would hold the room. At this stage nothing was mentioned. We arrived at the hotel just after 10pm to be told they were full and we were being moved to their sister hotel, which was not near to my parents. I asked why this was happening and the receptionist shugged. We asked whether it was possible they had made a mistake, and mentioned my phone call - which he remembered - but they did not care. The receptionist lied to us and said he'd give us a room if there was one but there just were none free. Shortly after that another couple arrived and asked whether their friends had checked in yet - to which the receptionist said no. He had blatantly lied to us about the availability of rooms - when we challenged him on this - he told us we booked on the internet (paying up front) at a discount price and the other couple were paying more. Overall, we were terribly disappointed with the attitude of the staff and being moved so late even after having confirmed the arrival time. Hotels like this trade on their good reputation, offer deals on the internet and then shove you off when they might be able to make a few more Eruos. I would not recommend this hotel and strongly advise you to re think before booking here....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: WandMMcIlroy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the above hotel for 5 nights at the beginning of our vacation in September 2010. It was a great introduction to Paris,5 minutes to the Eiffel Tower, and situated in a very interesting neighborhood near busy Champs de Mars and a 8 minute walk to the relatively tranquil Rue Cler. The hotel was very clean and cosy with a well appointed room ,including a very comfortable bed. Cedric at the front desk was very kind and eager to give information about the surrounding area and Paris in general,a very nice young man who worked very hard to accomodate everyone.The buffet breakfast was very good,served by 2 cheerful ladies who also did housekeeping duties. In general a very nice and comfortable hotel. Free internet was available. My only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 was,for us most important. There was no safe either in the room or front desk to store valuables. Surely this matter could be easily rectified. All in all, we highly recommend this very pleasant hotel. Marjorie and John McIlroy Victoria BC Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended on all levels.”
Reviews.Author: dmvcomics
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Europe was easy and comfortable thanks to Hotel de Londres Eiffel. I stayed there with a Rick Steves Tour, and I can see why he would be eager not to just recommend the hotel, but to also use it within his own tour company. The staff was friendly, helpful, and never seemed put off by the lack of French speaking that I heard from nearly all customers. The rooms weren't large, but I wouldn't guess they were small by what I understand as European norms. They were comfortable, clean and modern. Breakfasts were relaxing, good-tasting, and always a cheerful way to start the day. And let's not forget to mention the location: just a 5 minute walk (if that) to the Eiffel Tower is never a bad thing.

Reviews.Title: “charming and elegant...great location!”
Reviews.Author: photobugNewYork
Reviews.Content: We had two joining rooms for 4 women and had the floor to ourselves. Charming hotel with wonderful bathrooms! The english speaking staff was so helpful and the location was perfect: near the Eiffel Tower but a low key comfortable neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: ece2
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel three blocks from Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler. We were here as part of Rick Steves' Paris tour. Great location just minutes from the whole spectrum of dining, shopping, metro and bus lines. Markets, pharmacies, banks, laudromats all close at hand. English speaking staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly parisian”
Reviews.Author: Bri076
Reviews.Content: My partner and I loved our stay at this quaint little hotel. We had reviewed dozens of hotels and found the reviews to be very helpful. The rooms looked exactly like the photos and the rooms were so quaint. The romeo and juliet balconies had beautiful flowers overlooking the tiny street. It is a five minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The only downfall is we ended up falling in love with the latin quater and spent most of our time there which was far from the hotel. And we found the breakfast to be ridiculous money when you could just buy a croissant down the street. We would definately stay at this hotel again if we wanted to be close to the eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zumawaukee
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful visit to Paris and this hotel was a comfortable base for our explorations. The location was excellent and the neighborhood was pleasant. Our room was neat and clean. We enjoyed many restaurants and creperies close by. All of the staff were helpful and friendly, at the front desk and serving breakfast. We were part of a group, but stayed on for 3 nights after the one-week tour. We highly recommend Hotel de Londres Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: suoerklopper
Reviews.Content: Have booked room with eiffel tower view. View was perfect, room a bit small but it´s Pars,. Location was perfect as well,only short walk to Eiffel tower and good connection to public transportation. You can also walk on river Seine to Louvre etc. Staff was perfectly friendly and English speaking. Also nice neighbourhood. Booked also breakfast but guess you can have same also in neaby locate cafes, bars etc. Wld choose this hotel for sure again.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: mvilcin
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Londres-Eiffel. We found the hotel to be inviting, the staff to be very pleasant, and the room to be surprisingly comfortable. The location is a plus as it is situated in a neighborhood and not in a high-traffic area. We would stay again if ever in Paris and would recommend the hotel to others visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: NancyLynch1122
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. Staff was very knowledgeable about the city and help us navigate public transportation. Morning breakfast was simple but perfect. Rooms were modern and comfortable. Definitely recommend and will stay again if we're lucky enough to have a return visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT location; comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: gottmeinwasist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a quiet neighborhood about 2 minutes from the quieter side of the Eiffel Tower, about 5 minutes walk to the Seine (at a location where boats are available). It is also a very short walk to the shopping areas of Rue Cler, a very "neighborhood" pedestrian street with fromageries, butcher shops, patisseries/boulangeries and restuarants among others. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable with reasonably-sized "Parisian" rooms. The staff is very helpful & friendly. The breakfast space is light & comfortable and surprisingly, for Paris, not underground!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay as always”
Reviews.Author: jmc78041
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Londres Eiffel 4 years ago and we wanted to return because we had such a great experience the first time. It did not disappoint as we had a great stay this time around too. Their service level and the property has not changed a bit, it may have been even better . We have and will continue to recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris. Great location and services are all available a block or two from the hotel. Restaurants, bakeries, grocery stores, ATM and even a laundry are all one block or less away plus the Eiffel tower is a 5 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay - accomodations good, staff friendly and helpful, location great.”
Reviews.Author: Plato21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located close to the Eiffel Tower, near convenient bus stops, RER and the Metro. A number of good restaurants are within easy walking distance. The rooms were nicely decorated, modern, clean and well maintained, but small and lacking a full length mirror. Free Wi-F is the rooms was a big plus. The bathrooms had high quality fixtures and amenities. The concierges and staff were personable and helpful with tips, answering our questions, and arranging airport transportation. Breakfast service was excellent and relaxed. With a three minute walk any evening you could watch in full view the spectacular Eiffel Tower light show. It all made for a pleasurable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cute as a button - and not that much larger”
Reviews.Author: Numun
Reviews.Content: What a find. This place was fantastic. The rooms are beautifully decorated and themed. Ours unexpectedly included a view of the Eiffel Tower which is only a few minutes walk away. Some might find the rooms a little on the small side (you’ll struggle to bend over in the shower) but hey, this is Paris! Friendly service, free wi-fi, a fantastic location, quiet, air conditioned, and stylish rooms means we highly recommended this hotel for your stay in beautiful Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff! Charming! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: argentine57
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel helped make our stay in Paris wonderful! It seemed at times the friendly staff was God sent! They go out of their way to ensure your stay is pleasant and comfortable. Each morning before the hotel breakfast we were greeted with a smiling face. Arnaud, who usually greeted us in the morning, went above and beyond one day and helped us by calling the tour company to help us with a discrepancy. In addition to wake up calls, calling taxis, breakfast, Internet, and other standard amenities--the friendly staff is what makes the difference and separate them from other hotels in Paris. This was my fourth visit to Paris--I have finally found a hotel I will use over and over again for all my trips! Another perk, the hotel is just a short 5 to 10 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Yellow and Red Open Bus Tour stops. The neighborhood is safe and there is an incredible restaurant right next door. Many, many thanks to my new friends at Hotel Londres! I hope to see you all very soon! Keep up the great hospitality! Your kindness helped make our trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful spot!”
Reviews.Author: Rochester_NYMargaret
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on the end of a 10 day trip to France. A relaxing venue in transition to home. It was in a quiet neighborhood, a secure entrance by giving the key to the front desk on each exit, and offered hospitality. The room size was small, but comfortable. The bathroom was great. Free wireless internet reliable. Breakfast was simple, but plentiful and included. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lmgdundee
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked into the Duquesne but due to the air strike had to rearrange our flights. The Duquesne could no longer accommodate our alternative arrangements but contacted de Londres on our behalf. They said the could provide us with a double room with an extra bed as they had no triple rooms available. When we arrived, we found that we had been upgraded to connecting double rooms at no extra cost. The rooms were beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean and we always found the Reception staff very polite and helpful. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. I would certainly stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Refined”
Reviews.Author: Meekles
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here to celebrate our two-year anniversary after a two-week trip through Morocco. Hotel Londres Eiffel was a lovely break. The room was small, well-designed, and truly elegant, and we found it very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but good value...”
Reviews.Author: sweety8517
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay at this hotel again...I was fortunate enough to get a good last minute deal on this hotel, however, despite the great location, I did find that the room was too small to just completely unwind and make the most of the stay in Paris. Perhaps if you just need a base in central Paris this is the ideal hotel! For me personally, I wanted more...but for the price paid, it was fair! Helpful staff throughout the hotel and always on hand to give advice on where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice location, room small but pretty”
Reviews.Author: Arkeotraveler
Reviews.Content: We reserved here because of Rick Steves' recommendation. It's in the Rue Cler neighborhood quite close to the Eiffel Tower. It's also just around the corner from the extremely interesting new Musee de Quai Branly. It's convenient to the Metro and therer were sveral good restaurants very nearby. The hotel itself was pretty. The staff were very friendly, gracious, and helpful. Like all hotel rooms in Europe (apparently), the bedroom was small, but it was clean, fresh, and nicely appointed. Again, like almost all the hotels in Europe I've stayed in, the air conditioning was weak, but it was adequate (barely). We enjoyed our stay and would return. The Continental breakfast was very nice and a good value (considering the extraordinary prices everywhere else). The restaurant only served breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Dream hotel exudes neighborhood charm and welcoming service - yet convenient to tourist destinations”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Vanko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed an excellent stay at Hotel Londres-Eiffel. We appreciated the friendly service, including recommendations for restaurants - both of which were great. We had the privilege of staying in two different rooms - both were beautiful and very comfortable. Although this lovely hotel is in close proximity to the Eiffel Tower, it feels secluded on Rue Augereau and exudes the wonderful charms of the Rue Cler /Rue St, Dominique neighborhood. It made our first three days of vacationing in Paris a wonderful success and we will definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this Hotel, stayed from July 1 - July 11, 2010”
Reviews.Author: BlondGhosts
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, close to bus and metro (Line 8). Great staff!! Good Breakfast included (with real coffee in good sized mugs and a hot carafe at the table. No limit on refills.
