Meat, bread, jams, butter, fresh fruit, orange juice, grapefruit juice, and yogurt. English News papers, English speaking staff, even the housekeepers. Who did a great job at cleaning the room on a daily basis. Desk Clerks were very helpful, pleasant, and willing to go the extra mile for their guests. Even shared a Single Malt Scotch with me. Reasonable rates, check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel With Million Dollar Views of the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: cjm00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend trip during a visit to Europe. I picked this hotel based on other reviews and the fact the room offered a view to my favorite sight, the eiffel tower. The pictures on thier website are exactly what you get....a clean, nice, a/c ( a must anytime) and perfect views. It's on a quite street but only a short walk to the eiffel tower one direction or the famous Rue Cler street with great cafes. There is also a metro station close by. The staff was extremly nice and helpful. I will say, I stayed at a much higher-end hotel near the Opera House on a previous visit but all my future visit will be at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Practically perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: dlp454
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the Eiffel Tower, the Metro, plenty of cafes, restaurants, Rue de Cler market, cruise on the Seine. Cozy, attractive, spotless room (with air conditioning!), yummy breakfasts. Friendly, helpful staff. We would book again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money and the location”
Reviews.Author: Oggiedoggie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Londres Eiffel is a wonderful little hotel on a quiet street in an excellent location for touring Paris. It is within blocks of the Eiffel Tower and close to Metro stops that can take you anywhere you wish to go in the city. The rooms are comfortable, clean and air conditioned (a must in July in Paris) and the staff is incredibly welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Edwar2dc
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Londres Eiffel. The staff were extremely helpful in recommending sites and restaurants, giving directions, and generally just helping to get the most out of our stay in Paris. One day it was raining, and they gave us umbrellas to use for the day! It is in a nice quiet area, but within easy walking distance of some great restaurants, and of course very close to the Eiffel Tower. As others have said, the rooms are small, but adequate. We had a family set up, two bedrooms and two baths. Our shower was very small, but our daughter's was adequate. It probably varies room to room. The air conditioning worked very well. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jls0025
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Londres-Eiffel is a 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower in a lovely residential area. The hotel and the staff were excellent. Our room was comfortable and modern with a very nice view of the local street and building with shuttered windows with window boxes. We always felt good returning from our daily travels. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful and felt that whatever our concerns or needs, they would be someone to help us. When we again travel to beautiful Paris, we will definitely stayy at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Ellie0372
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to be a guest at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel with the Rick Steves Tour in 2009. It has now become my hotel destination when visiting Paris. The hotel is located close to the Eiffel Tower on a quiet steet in the Rue Cler area. The view from my room of the Eiffel Tower and the hotel breakfast was devine. The ambience in the hotel from the hotel decor to the helpful and welcoming staff allows you to capture the whole Paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel de Londres Eiffel for many reasons....”
Reviews.Author: mjg90
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time. The Hotel de Londres Eiffel was the perfect place to stay. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. The location was ideal. Breakfast was delicious. We were given wonderful restaurant recommendations. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Eiffel Tower view”
Reviews.Author: Janiekins53
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for one night - my last night in France - after renting an apartment in Paris for 7 nights and then 3 nights in Normandy. I wanted an Eiffel Tower view and I sure got one. My room was located on the 6th floor. It was VERY tiny but the tower view was unbelievable. I watched the lights twinkling at night and I loved it. I would probably never stay here again but the room was so tiny. My husband is 6'7" inches so he could barely walk around. The staff was very nice. The hotel is located in a great area.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jandmus
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the londres de eiffel and had a wonderful experience in Paris. The location is great - short walk to the eiffel tower, the Seine and the colorful rue cler neighborhood. Very friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, nicely decorated with a very small shower. We loved Paris and will stay here again when we come back. It was tres French.

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon We Could Have Asked For!”
Reviews.Author: jackcadillac
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect. My wife and I stayed here for a week. The staff was very accommodating ( we got Metro directions from them daily) in every way. Breakfast was good, but expensive just like everything else in Paris. There is a small grocery store across the street so you can get anything you need. It's very quiet and very safe. We walked to the eiffel tower nightly and it's about a 4 minute walk. Rooms were very clean and big enough (you shouldn't be in your room enough to complain when you're in Paris). No complaints here. Thanks for a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: EllieHope
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, if on the small side. Good concierge(s). Great location. Good breakfast. Decent value. Everything I hoped for, for the price. I can't knock it in any way. Would happily use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted--charming”
Reviews.Author: Bath88
Reviews.Content: We had a second floor, front room----window open all night---very quiet. The room was small, but arranged and decorated nicely, and very efficient. Nooks and plugs and closet space. The staff made us feel 'at home'. I hope to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: minnWaseca
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at your hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Loubyloo67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location. Everything was withing walking distance. We bought Hop on Hop Off tickets for the Red Bus and an evening cruise down the Seine. Because of the hotel's location we were able to safely and easily walk to the starting point of both. This made our weekend in Paris exceptionally easy! The only reason I've given this hotel a 4 rating instead of 5 is that they advertised a shuttle to and from the airport/train station and they don't have it. We were told to get a taxi...we had to wait almost an hour in a long line at the station to catch a taxi ride to the hotel. However, we didn't let this small detail spoil our enjoyment of Paris and you shouldn't either.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de Londres Eiffel and its staff captured our hearts!”
Reviews.Author: SuzAnnapolis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming, the staff friendly and helpful, especially Cedric. The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. It was very quiet. The breakfasts are very good and the "breakfast ladies" are so sweet and fun. It's in a beautiful neighborhood and we felt like we were at home after a few days. I couldn't believe that we could walk everywhere, including the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, Louvre, Seine River, etc. I highly recomment the Hotel de Londres Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Some Like It Small”
Reviews.Author: huffyaj17
Reviews.Content: For our 35th wedding anniversary, I took my wife to Paris. Choosing a hotel from afar left us concerned about what the accomodations would really be like since we had never traveled to a foreign country. Our concern was lessened upon entering the hotel and meeting Cedric, the day's concierege. He answered whatever questions we had, and took care of calling for cabs or giving instructions on where to catch a bus or train to various tourist locations if we needed them. He even taught us about how to make the keyboard work in English for their in-house computer tucked away in a space that I assume used to be for a pay telephone. That was helpful for keeping up with family news from the States. Since we didn't know if we'd ever make it back to Paris, we decided to splurge and get a room at the top of the building that would have a view of the Eiffel Tower as advertised on their website. As you lay on the bed in our quaint room, you could see the top two-thirds of the tower perfectly framed by our opened tall windows. Amazing! Though the elevator and room seemed small compared to American hotels, my guess is that may be normal with established hotels that close to the Eiffel Tower. Because part of our upper room was a dormer, it may be smaller than a regular room. I didn't ask, though, because even with ducking a little to take a shower, the view makes one forget everything else. Though it had only a small space to eat, the hotel was within easy walking distance of cafe's, and patisseries as well as to buses to various sites around town. Thanks to the entire cocierge staff of Hotel de Londres Eiffel Tower!

Reviews.Title: “A Place You Will Never Forget”
Reviews.Author: SPMTampaFL
Reviews.Content: April 2010 My husband and I recently spent two weeks in Europe. During our stay in France, we stayed in a very romantic and lovely hotel, Hotel de Londres Eiffel. The location was perfect! Two blocks from Eiffel Tower in an upscale quite neighborhood. Everything we needed was within walking distance, market, wine shop, bakery and coffee shot. The room was a little small but very comfortable and clean. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful. They gave us tips and pointers of places to visit and dine. I strongly recommend staying at Hotel de Londres Eiffel. I know I will stay there on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great neighborhood near the Eiffel Tower. We felt like locals!”
Reviews.Author: MaryRyanFL
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, immaculate warmly decorated rooms, cozy public spaces and a service oriented staff. Near the Siene, the Eiffel Tower, the Champ de Mars Park and the Rue Cler neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value in heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddictYYZ
Reviews.Content: A super great place to stay in Paris. We just returned from Paris after staying 3-nights at Hotel de Londres Eiffel. This was our second time staying there this year and we will definitely be back. Great location steps away from the Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler market and restaurants such as Fountaine de Mars and L'ami Jean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Cedric at the Reception went above and beyond to assist us with our travel needs such as booking our shuttle to the airport and restaurant reservations. He took very good care of us. The hotel was recently renovated and the rooms are charming and very clean. This is the kind of place we like to stay when in Paris. Thank you from Canada!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, outstanding value with friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: SALTJR
Reviews.Content: In our fourth trip to Paris, my wife and I spent 8 days in this magnificently located, well maintained, well furnished hotel in a sufficiently large, comfortable room with very adequate bathroom facilities. The staff was efficient, friendly and helpful... particularly important since our last four days were a result of the recent volcanic unpleasantness. Both WiFi and computer access were effective and the breakfast quite adequate and the coffee good. We would stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Charm and Cleanliness are the three pluses of this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: brihet85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just recently stayed at the hotel during the week of April 10th -16th. I have been to Paris before and stayed at a chain hotel. This was my husbands first trip to Paris. I had researched hotels in Paris and had used Tripadvisor as a guide to our choice. We loved the Hotel de Londres Eiffel. It is a charming boutique style hotel in the heart of the 7th arrondisement. To say the location was amazing is an understatement. You are literally a short walk away from the Eiffel Tower. Our room did not have tower views,but it did not matter. We could open our French door style windows and lookout on the beautiful buildings surrounding the hotel. I have read some people complaining about Paris sized rooms, and yes they are smaller than US rooms,but to us that just added to the charm of the room. The bathrooms are tiny compared to US but they are IMMACULATE.....the beds changed daily and quite comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Patrice was especially helpful to us when we were trying to get in contact with our son. Evangeline, Im not sure it Im correct on her name, but she served breakfast the one morning we ate there , was like a ray of sunshine. Everyone on staff was great. Back to the location, you are just around the corner from the Tower and the Rue Cler neighborhood. The Rue Cler was amazing, open air markets , great little cafes,we especially liked Tribeca. In summary, if you want a more intimate hotel stay nearby the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler area ,you have got to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: powell_diana
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Londres Eiffel. 2 couples travelling together had an overnight flight from California, and arrived about 10 AM (check-in usually 3 PM). We were very tired and the staff prepared our rooms right away so we could rest. We enjoyed the location of the hotel, a nice, quiet and safe neighborhood, near great shops (especially Rue Clare) and so close to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is very clean and the front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. The front desk person even made several urgent phone calls when the airport shuttle car was late arriving the day of our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very accommodating and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTravelingMom
Reviews.Content: I arrived with two teenagers to stay in the one triple room. I was able to move to two adjoining rooms with a minimal price increase. Nice location near the Tour Eiffel and fun Rue Cler. Good restaurants and patisserie down the street. Staff was helpful and friendly. Nice to be able to walk to such destinations at the Musee Rodin. Nice to have free and easily connected to WiFi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: akpkuehne
Reviews.Content: My husband, my brother, sister-in-law, and I loved this hotel. It was a very charming hotel, in a great location. We loved the Rue Cler neighborhood, and the hotel was the perfect walking distance to the Eiffel Tower! There is a metro stop only a short stroll away too! The hotel breakfast was delicious...the croissants and coffee were the best! All of the staff were very nice and helpful. I cannot wait to return to Paris, and we will definitely stay in this hotel the next time we go!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: kh10701
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel from 3/16/10-3/25/10 was absolutely wonderful! This was the second stay at this fine establishment for two of our group of 4 (we stayed here previously in March 2008). The hotel is very charming, decorated beautifully and close to so many things of interest. The neighborhood locale also adds to the charm. We also found transportation to be very easy from the hotel location. The daily walk to the bus lines and/or the Metro is a very easy and convenient walk. Plus, there is a great restaurant about 1/2 block from the Metro stop, the Cafe de l'Alma (absolute best brioche in all of Paris!). And what could be better than the 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower each night! Each of the 4 desk managers were very helpful to us during our stay - from arranging tours for us ( a great Normandy tour and a fun champagne tour), to restaurant recommendations to assisting with our overload of luggage! Particular thanks to Matteus and Arneau for all their help as we probably saw the most of them during our stay. All four of them (Cedric, Matteus, Arneau and Patrice) are an absolute delight to deal with and added to the fun of our trip. Ms. Pringent is very fortunate to have such wonderful employees. The hotel has a section that is newly renovated and the owner, Ms. Pringent, gave us a tour of the new rooms (they are not yet open to the public). The rooms are beautiful and I am sure guests will be very happy be placed in the new rooms. Should we return to Paris (and I hope to again one day), I would not stay anywhere other than the Hotel de Londres Eiffel! It feels like our Paris home. Indianapolis, Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGrits08
Reviews.Content: Great value for the location, three streets from a great market, on the same street with a laundrymat, post office around the corner, close to many patissaries and resturants, 2 1/2 blocks from metro stop, view of the top of the eiffel tower from some rooms! The staff was accomidating and spoke good english. The room and bathroom were both good size for a European hotel. Breakfast was excellent; large seating area, selection of international papers, broad selection of good food in a buffet style. Internet access available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Valentines in Paris 2010”
Reviews.Author: Ernyrosali
Reviews.Content: My hubby was posted to London for work from 7-12 Feb 2010, so we decided to take this chance as part of our anniversary presents to treat ourselves to Paris for Valentine Day. This is our second honeymoon to Paris that was way back in 2002. We reached Paris by coach from Victoria London and the journey took us 7 hrs, and we reached the hotel around 8am in the morning. We were exhausted from the trip not enough sleep, it was snowy that morning so we try our luck by checking in early, what a relieved when we were greeted by friendly & warm staff who check us in. Lovely rooms with a nice modern setting. Light sensored infront of rooms hotels. closed to the Eco Militaire metro, 5 mins walk to Eiffel tower, nearby open-top bus station, close to all vacinities. Free wireless, LCD TV (but must have English cable tv - for non speaking French tourists). Atmospher e very serene & quite. Supermarket nearby, laundrette very convenience. Would love to come back again for the 3rd time, this time will try the 5th floor with the Eiffel Tower view hehehe...AuRevoir from Mr & Mrs Rosali (Singapore)

Reviews.Title: “Awesomely located hotel! and really cute room :)”
Reviews.Author: mumbailuvtravel
Reviews.Content: Loved this place...and everything about it...its small but cute, rooms specially loos are excellent (though small but i guess that's Paris for you!)....the location is a big plus because everything from the Eiffel Tower to Champs de elysses is at a walking distance from here...the only difficulty is in finding out the place coz its in one of the numerous streets that look the same...Hotel staff is very very very co-operative! and the place is so peaceful that you dont feel that you actually are in the heart of the buzzing city! I strongly recommend this place..and would love to go back on my next Paris visit!!

Reviews.Title: “My 5th stay at this hotel and it gets better each and every time.”
Reviews.Author: SeaBlume
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the kind and friendly staff (Arnaud, Cedric, Patrick and the rest) who work hard to make our stay and our visit to Paris always wonderful. They are always there to help and make recommendations to enhance our time. The lobby is welcoming and the rooms cozy. The nice, clean bathrooms feature good lighting and hair dryer, fluffy towels and recently updated appointments. The beds are comfortable and reading lights are well located. The flat screen TV is nice for a break and to catch the news. I have stayed at this hotel 5 times over the last 10 years and I can only say that each time I have noticed very well planned improvements. Free internet is really a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: scrg06
Reviews.Content: We have mixed reactions to this hotel.. On the one hand it was a nice, comfortable room, but on the other hand we had some issues with it. The location in relation to the Eiffel is great. It's a very short walk and some rooms have a view of the top of the tower (we saw one, it's nothing to pay extra for, trust me). It was easy to find and there are a lot of great restaurants and patisseries in the area (highly recommend the Cafe Champ Du Mars and the Cafe Du Monde nearby). The staff was extremely nice and friendly. The bed was comfortable, and the room was nicely decorated. The large dual closets were nice, we were able to tuck all of our stuff away so we could keep the floor open (very necessary, as the room was tiny). Now for the downsides. Aside from the Eiffel, the location was terrible. It was a very long walk to the metro stop - and believe me, you WILL use the metro. We got so sick of making the long walk every day, especially at the end of the day when we were cold and tired and our feet hurt. Next time I go to Paris, the #1 thing I will look for in a hotel is proximity to a metro stop. The room is TINY - hardly any room to move around at all, and very little room to set down a suitcase. This didn't bother us that much, but if you're used to big open hotel rooms like you see in the USA, be prepared. The bathroom was unimpressive.. It was clean, but very small and the lights would intermittently stop working. We called down to have them fix the lights but as far as we could tell nothing was changed. The bulbs would randomly stop working while we were going to the restroom or showering which was NOT fun. Also, the bathroom tile is very VERY slippery when wet, so be careful. No included breakfast, which added to the overall trip cost. One tiiiiny elevator, so not great for large groups. The neighborhood was REALLY loud. Every night and every morning there would be loud trucks that came by (at one point they decided to chop down some trees at 2 AM in the morning which was awful). This is not the hotel's fault but it certainly kept us from getting a good night's sleep. Overall, although we generally liked the hotel, we wouldn't stay there again due to the location being so far from a metro stop. If you don't mind walking a lot and you want to be close to the Eiffel and you don't mind a small room, this hotel was comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “MIDDLE CLASSIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kamerone
Reviews.Content: Hotel located very well close to the Eiffel tower with a sight very agreable.The rooms are small and expensive. the reception of night is very well and less better the day unfortunately. That say we would like at the time of our next passage in the capital to find more sincerity and simplicity.

Reviews.Title: “A Small Romantic Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: worldlycanuck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel during the last week of October, 2009. As it was our first time in Paris, we wanted a convenient and reliable location to set out to explore the city. The Hotel de Londres Eiffel proved (almost) perfect for us. We arrived from London via the Eurostar to the Gare du Nord. Taxis were plentiful, even if you have to line up for a few minutes at the side of the station for one. The train station is well policed to discourage "gypsy" cabs. The cab ride to the hotel is about 20 minutes. If you do not know any French, I would suggest writing down the address or name of the hotel to show the driver. All the taxi drivers we had had a very limited knowledge of English. It wasn't a problem for us as I speak French, but it could be a problem if you do not. All the cabs are well maintained and very clean, though. The hotel itself is on a small side street about 5 blocks away from the Eiffel Tower. We were glad we splurged on a top floor room with a view of the tower. It was definitely worth it. The rooms are very small, but very clean and well-maintained. Full maid service every morning. Be prepared for the smallest elevator known to man. The front door is always staffed. A small breakfast is optional, but we instead took advantage of the many small patisseries and cafes on Rue Saint-Dominique just up the street from the hotel. There is also a small supermarket on Saint-Dominique half a block over that has quick snacks to take back to your room at reasonable prices. Ask the front desk staff for restaurant suggestions. They were spot on. A wonderful Italian storefront restaurant is at the bottom end of Rue Augereau. The same restaurant occupies two corners of the same intersection at Augereau and Rue de Grenelle. Pick the least busiest. The cafes along the Parc du Champs de Mars near the Eiffel Tower can be very expensive. By getting away from the tourist points, you can find some very reasonably priced restaurants. Cafes and restaurants are everywhere in this city. You will not go for want of good food. The Eiffel Tower is always busy. If you are athletic, there is an alternate entrance at the base that leads to stairs up. You can buy a two or three day pass for the Metro, which we used to get everywhere. Very convenient and safe. The station at Pont de l'Alma was the most convenient to the hotel and had a tourist officer selling tickets and giving info from the street level office. A short list of touristy things that we hit: Pere Lachaise Cemetery: Half hour by Metro. Free entrance. Maps and a washroom are available at the cemetery office 500' into the grounds. Many of the tombs are in quite a state of disrepair. Lots of walking on cobblestones uphill. We weren't too impressed overall. I guess everyone needs to see Jim Morrison's tomb (unremarkable). Musee d'Orsay: 10 minutes by Metro from hotel. Very impressive and well thought out. Some very famous works of art available for viewing. Musee de Louvre: Possibly the worst laid out building ever made into a museum. Originally the palace for French royalty, the museum is contained within several extremely long wings. Massive numbers of people. We got lost at least twice. The maps are terrible. I do not recommend it for people with small children or if you are not in good shape. The room where the Mona Lisa is kept was a sea of humanity all struggling to get near enough to take a picture. If you don't have time to see everything you want to in Paris, make this the place that you scratch off your list. Your sanity will thank you. One final warning about the hotel. Taxis do not usually wait for fares in front of it. On the morning of our departure we had the front desk call a cab. It took more than an hour to arrive (on a weekday), resulting in us missing our train back to London. Hailing a cab is extremely difficult on the streets around the hotel (at least it was the morning we needed one). Have the front desk book one for you the night before. This was the only negative point about the hotel. With a little planning it shouldn't be an issue. All in all a beautiful city. Don't let the language stop you from coming, but you will get a much richer experience if you make an attempt to use some French while you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good area”
Reviews.Author: davidfsutton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found the hotel excellent on all fronts. The room rate was very reasonable (relative to other hotels of this quality in Paris anyway) and the room itself was clean, well decorated, spacious with a large bathroom and quiet. It is located within a 5 minute walk of the Eiffell tower but the are is not overly touristy. There are plenty of good local restaurants. The pizzeria at the top of Rue Augereau is highly recommended. The nearest Metro station is about a 10 minute walk to get you back into the central areas.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful hotel from beginning to end of our stay.”
Reviews.Author: EvelynFlorida
Reviews.Content: We reserved an Eiffel tower view room on the top floor of the hotel for our several days in Paris to surprise our granddaughter and celebrate her 13th birthday with her family. Two very sleepy travelers arrived at this hotel many hours before our check in time. What a delight when the staff graciously arranged for breakfast and an available room for us in spite of our early arrival time. We ended up staying in this lovely courtyard room for our whole stay as it was quite comfortable, clean and quiet. Our granddaughter's 13th birthday celebration was so special for us all at their restaurant recommendation. The buffet breakfast was grand each day and we certainly look forward to booking this hotel for our next visit to the wonderful city of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Bazilu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned (9 Nov 2009) from Paris where we stayed for the second time at Hôtel de Londres Eiffel. It is on the Left Bank, on the edge of the Rue Cler neighborhood, about 2.5 blocks from the Eiffel Tower, and surrounded by many restaurants and pastry shops. Metro and RER lines close by (maybe 10 or 15 minute walk). Various bus lines very close by as well. Staff is friendly, helpful, and they always seem to have smiles on their faces. Free internet service in the lobby and free wifi. Rooms are quaint and hotel is quiet. Our room was near the elevator and we never heard it running. Will stay here on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in Europe... Back for a 3rd stay!”
Reviews.Author: JourneyTogether09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, classy, and in a perfect location... a true retreat in a city with so many amazing things to see and do. For this trip, we travelled all over Europe for 3 weeks, but unexpectedly chose to conclude in Paris knowing we could rely on a wonderful finish in a charming hotel in this amazing city. The room was tastefully decorated in classy French decor. The staff is exceptional - greeting us kindly, booking reservations as needed, and maintianing the rooms excellently.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Geoviki
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff, everything you need (groceries, restaurants, laundry, transportation) very close by. We took the basic double room and it was perfectly adequate space-wise – yeah, we were expecting the smaller Parisian rooms, but who spends all that much time in a room when you have Paris to explore? The internet/computer in the lobby was helpful to keep in touch with the kids back home (and we discovered that the French keyboard is slightly different than an English one, which explains why all my 'a's were 'q's. Ask the desk for help finding the @ key!) The cleaning staff could have been quieter in the mornings - they start enthusiatically dragging stuff around the halls at 8 AM. We didn't eat breakfast here - instead we grazed over on Rue Cler,a short walk away. We were convinced that everyone staying here is a Rick Steve's-toting American. If you left your copy at home, there's a set behind the desk. If you do some research on the nearby transportation options before you go, you'll find lots of inexpensive options. Some Americans at the hotel were bemoaning the great expense of taxis to get around, but they just didn't know how to use the Metro or the bus. I admit the lack of English signs complicates things a little, but one subway system is pretty much like another the world over. The #42 bus goes directly from Gare du Nord to a few blocks from the hotel. The RER train goes directly to Charles deGaulle Airport with one small transfer, and takes about an hour and 11 Euros from Pont d'Alma station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean room”
Reviews.Author: AGS39
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location: the closest hotel to Eiffel Tower that we could find. We pack light, so we were able to get to the hotel from Euro star train station by bus #42, which was a sightseeing tour already. And to get to the city center, you can use bus #69, which is also a great sightseeing tour. A lot of Paris attractions are just in a walking distance from the hotel. So we hardly ever needed to use metro! The staff of the hotel is incredibly polite and helpful. And the room was clean and comfortable too.

Reviews.Title: “Fabuous Hotel...super location”
Reviews.Author: eternaltravellerPa
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Londres. We are a family of 7 (kids ages 17 to 5 yrs) they were able to accommodate us in two large rooms. We stayed in the "older" part of the hotel...so no elevator there..a tight staircase three floors up. However, there is an elevator in the "newer" part of the hotel. Breakfast was ok…pastries, cereal, yogurt, etc. The hotel’s location is perfect for walking to the Eiffel Tower..and just down the street for the hop on and off bus. There are many great restaurants in the area. We enjoyed our stay and have already recommended it to friends. A great find in an expensive city!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel de Londres Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: ParisLover90
Reviews.Content: I have to say I had the very best time in Paris and I loved this hotel. I was very comfortable with my room. It was very clean and modern. I was afraid the room would be very small but it was just right for one person. I found the staff very friendly and helpful. I was so happy I could go in my room early. After not sleeping on the flight to Paris, it was much appreciated. Oh, and the breakfast was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Great Decor”
Reviews.Author: pclotus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel de Londres Eiffel for 3 nights in Sept. Terrific location, near lots of great restaurants and a very short walk to Eiffel Tour. Not too far from a Metro stop. Hotel is very nicely kept, service was a bit mixed: one staff member was terrific, spoke English very well and helped us out tremendously, another staff member however wasn't helpful at all. The rooms are small but well laid out, the bathrooms are very nice (white tile, framed art, nice bath products). There's a small computer closet in the lobby with free internet that's great to have, and the elevator is very helpful as the circular staircase makes it difficult to move suitcases. Overall a bit of a splurge but worth it for the location and quality of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, courteous and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: newtraveler5009
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11:00 AM, and our rooms were cleaned and ready. Throughout our five-day stay, the staff was ready and able to answer all of our questions (someone is on duty 24-7). We were very close to the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler. The only negatives were that the rooms were very small, and, because we were in an older part of the building, there was no elevator service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel ran by a staff of professionals with an attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: furnacefighter
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Londres Eiffel family made our stay "a wonderful Parisian experience". Their dedication to service, attention to detail, friendly attitude, and diligent work ethic was evident and appreciated during our recent visit (Sept 18 to Sept 22). It is people like these who keep us returning to our adopted Republic (France) and the City of Paris again and again. Rooms were spotless, bathrooms were modern, location was just a couple of blocks from the Eiffel Tour and Seine River. The morning breakfast was fresh and tasty. Best part about this hotel was how quiet it was. Almost no street noise could be heard. Could not remember hearing a siren, horn, or street sound during our entire visit. We slept very soundly here.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again the PERFECT spot!”
Reviews.Author: realgem1
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 10 year old son for 3 nights and will definitely go back when we are next in Paris. The staff are fantastic and friendly, the location is dreamy... The picture of the window with the eiffel tower was the view we had as well and it was spectacular (although I will not pay for the view next time I will get a room on a lower level). It was clean and tidy and all the fixtures were new and modern. The elevator is tiny but that is part of the charm! You have everything close by and we always felt safe even walking around at midnight! There is a laundry mat a few doors down in case you need one! Cafe next door and many others all around! Takes about 3 minutes to walk to the Eiffel Tower (WOW) and the location is perfect to catch the paris bus or boat that will take you everywhere else. The staff handle everything for you so nicely and are very friendly! The rooms are small (this is Paris after all) but it is truly charming! I can't say enough about how great our stay was! They also have free wireless access for the laptop and there is a shared computer in a little booth in the lobby if you need it! I thought it was a great value for the location and quality of rooms. We were able to walk with luggage from the Pont de Alma train stop to the hotel with no problems and ecole militaire metro is very close as well! Found the room really quite as well considering the age of the building and the fact it is in the middle of a HUGE city! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, location a little less convenient”
Reviews.Author: cvu79
Reviews.Content: We had reserved 1 double and 1 triple, but when we got there we were given 2 doubles and a pull out bed in one of them. The price difference between a double and a triple is huge (which we would have been charged), so after I complained, we got one of the rooms rectified. It's great that they solved the problem, but it was dissapointing that they tried to pawn off the double as a triple. Otherwise, the rooms were well decorated, very quiet, and were clean. Our double room was very dark, but the triple room was well lighted. Both bathrooms were ok, but ours was kinda dirty with black mold in the shower. It was listed in Rick Steve's book, so that's how we chose it, but I wouldn't stay here again b/c it's too far from a metro stop and that's mainly how we got around Paris. It was a 10 min walk at a brisk pace from the hotel to the Ecole Militaire station. But, it was close to the Eiffel Tower (only a couple blocks away) and it was a nice area with good restaurants and Rue Cler nearby. We liked that there was free wireless internet and Arnaud (at the front desk) was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect All 'Round”
Reviews.Author: Hwdfltraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to Paris in August 2009. The hotel is charming, and located in one of the nicest neighborhoods in Paris (7th Arr.), just a few minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. Our room was spotlessly clean and the front desk staff extremely helpful and friendly. There is a laundromat located directly across the street, in addition to a grocery store, bakeries and restaurants just steps away, not even mentioning its proximity to Rue Cler! We would not hesitate to stay here again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short break in Paris! At a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyLimassol
Reviews.Content: Pretty and cozy hotel at a convenient location; rooms not the size we are used to in Cyprus but ok if not spending much time in them! The staff were very helpful and gave us a few tips on where to go and how!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!!! An excellent boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PepesLoveToTravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and Rick Steves recommendations. We stayed there for six nights. It is a lovely hotel. The rooms are small, but very practical. The bathroom was very functional. The bed was comfortable. The hotel and rooms are nicely decorated. There was good storage in the room and a small refrigerator where we could store water, etc. The room was very clean. A/C - kept the room at a comfortable temperature. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Excellent location - about two blocks from the Eiffel Tower. We noticed a clean laundry facility across the street. Great cafes, patisseries and restaurants within very short walking distance. A store is about a 1/2 block away. There is a small Italian restaurant 3/4 of a block away on a corner. Excellent gourmet food reasonably priced. The Metro system is not far way and is easy access. We had no problems going to all of the different sites using the Metro/subway system. DO NOT RENT A CAR - easy to get around everywhere and inexpensive. The hotel set up a shuttle service from and to the airport. Good price and reliable. We will definitely stay at the Hotel Londres Eiffel again. Paris was wonderful and we are already planning a second trip. The French people were very nice and helpful (somewhere along the line they got a bad rap), the food was delicious, and the accomodations excellent. Paris is a must see!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was perfect, the front desk personnel were extremely helpful, polite, and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: jgmckm
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms on the 6th floor with views of the Eiffel tower. The rooms were reasonably sized, compared to the usual cramped Paris hotel rooms. The bathrooms were quite nice, very clean, and adequate in size. The front desk was so welcoming, very helpful and gracious, arranging transportation for us, and accomodating when we arrived earlier than our room was available. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A charming little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: heyfromtx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel for two nights and had a very pleasant stay. The staff was always there and ready to help with anything - directions, transportation, reservations - anything we requested. The room situation was something we wanted - but couldn't reserve ahead of time. We were allowed to see a couple of rooms to see which one we liked better, which we appreciated. Our room was on the third floor and had two windows (with flower boxes) that overlooked the Rue Augereau below . We could hear the street noises below with windows open but we wanted that as a part of the experience. The room was small but we expected that. It had more closet/storage space than much bigger rooms. I thought the bed was hard at first but I slept like a log. One very notable point of interest about this hotel was that it was very clean. The Eiffel Tower, bus and subway, highly rated restaurants, boulangerie and markets are all within a very short walk. The Seine, Les Invalides and the Rodin Museum are also fairly close. We had a great time in Paris and this hotel was a big part of that.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: rochesterguy
Reviews.Content: Summary: Our trip to Paris was fantastic, and we were sad to have to leave. Part of the reason was the hotel. Hotel de Londres Eiffel was wonderful, and we have high standards. Great location, great staff, nice rooms, and even free wifi. Front Desk: The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful, making excellent restaurant recommendations. Rooms: This is Paris, so hotel rooms are never large, without spending double or triple what we paid. More important than size, the rooms were clean and comfortable. Location: The hotel is ideally situated, within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, the Metro, grocery stores, restaurants, and shopping. Overall: This is not the cheapest hotel in Paris, but it is a great value given its quality and location. We will definitely stay at this hotel again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: ssbe
Reviews.Content: Since we had never visited Paris, we did a little research and found that Rick Steves uses this hotel for his tours. So we decided to use this hotel and were very pleased with everything. Rooms are small compared to US standards, but they were very clean, adequate, and in an ideal location for transportation, bakery, grocery store, laundry, and places to eat. The maids kept the room spotless. I believe the hotel was recently remodeled. There is a phone, tv,hair dryer and ac in the room. There is no need for a transformer/converter unless you bring something (like an old 110V hair dryer) that doesn't a have the variable voltage built in. I used the small adapter to recharge my camera and phone battery and had no problems. Everyone on staff was very helpful and willing to do anything to assist you. This was very important for us since we had a lot of questions. Be sure to ask the front desk to make you a reservation the day before your departure for a shuttle van to the air port, cost 38EU for a couple. It took us 30 minutes to the airport, but time will vary depending upon traffic. We had a 6am pick up for a 9am departure. Unless you can find a better hotel with a cheaper price, I suggest you start with Hotel Londres-Eiffel. I would use the hotel again and definitely recommend to my friends and relatives. A few suggestions, buy the Museum Pass, buy a carnet of 10 Metro tickets, plan each evening for the next day sightseeing, start early to avoid lines and give you more time to sightsee instead of waiting in line, have water with you at all times (buy liter at grocery store for approximately .60 EU), bring dried fruit for snacks, do one picnic at the park or on a bench near the Eiffel Tower at night, have a small Paris map with you at al times, get a good night's sleep since the days are long with a lot of walking, and keep the name, address and phone number of your hotel with you at all times. Finally, I give the hotel an A+. Bob

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel and location for your visit to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: BethHouston
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel during our week in Paris. The location is perfect - a five minute walk to the Eiffel Tower or the Metro. The hotel is clean and attractive. We received excellent service from all the staff. They all seem to really enjoy their jobs. Our room was comfortable and provided everything that we needed (including a blow dryer and a small refrigerator). It was quiet and the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and very good. There are two great restaurants practically next door and a launderette across the street. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: CandLRanch
Reviews.Content: If you can live with a small room, this is a great place. The room was spotless and very comfortable. Fresh air and a street view with the windows open, and quiet with them closed. The location is 5 minutes from the Eiffel Tower and a 45 minute stroll to the Louvre. Plenty of close places to eat, a nearby grocery store and laundromat. Finally, a superb staff to help with anything you need. A great end of our visit to France.

Reviews.Title: “Super location with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: daeganroot
Reviews.Content: Great location, convenient to the Metro, but on a nice quiet street. Like most Parisian hotels, the rooms are small, but clean and tastefully decorated. We were very comfortable. The staff was superb! Very helpful and pleasant. I miss the fresh breakfast croissants! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A VERY NICE CENTRALLY LOCATED HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: dufferFlorida
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was very knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. The breakfast stafff was delightful and the front desk staff was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, excellent staff, can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: murrayPortalnd
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much at your hotel. The newly renovated room was lovely and comfortable. All the staff were extremely helpful. The breakfasts were very good, and your assistance in arranging our return to the airport was helpful. We would definitely stay at your hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: USATravelers01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Paris for four days in late March. It was our first time in Paris and our first time visiting abroad. We can’t say enough positive things about our experience, including where we stayed. A charming hotel, located 2 minutes walking distance from the Eiffel Tower, Hotel de Londres Eiffel definitely ranks high on our list. Clean, comfortable, ideal location and helpful staff – what more could you ask for? This hotel is located in a convenient spot for the visitor who wants to see all she/he can while staying in Paris. In addition to being located close to the Eiffel Tower, it is surrounded by plenty of fabulous places to eat, the metro, and isn’t very far from other popular attractions, such as the Louvre, Arc de Triomphe and Musee d’Orsay. Our compliments and special thanks to Arnaud, Cedric, Ninette and Jacqueline. These were the staff members we primarily interacted with during our stay. All of them were very helpful and made our visit a comfortable one. Bottom line – we absolutely LOVE Paris and the next time we come back we are staying at Hotel de Londres Eiffel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de Londres Eiffel was a most enjoyable and beautiful with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: beckylindell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our France trip last summer in Paris. The Hotel de Londres Eiffel was very welcoming after our long journey. We loved the room, the bathroom (which had a nice bathtub), the bed...everything was so comfortable and inviting. Although we did much site-seeing in Paris, we were always happy to get back to this nice, relaxing room. The service was great too. And a nice breakfast was provided in the mornings. We would definitely enjoy returning to this beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: sdtx
Reviews.Content: What a great little gem of a hotel. Friendly staff, spotless rooms, quiet, terrific location and ease of airport transport. Everyone there was helpful, gave us wonderful tips and always had a smile. We'll be back ;-)

Reviews.Title: “What a great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Noles79
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Paris and our second time staying at the Hotel Londres Eiffel. We had the same room and felt right at home. Cedric, Armand and the entire staff made us feel so welcomed. The hotel arranged for transportation from the airport to the hotel, absolutely the way to go. Anything that we needed was taken care of. We loved the river cruise (at night, it's the best). The neighborhood is perfect, close to the Eiffel Tower, Metro, Rue Cler, Champs du Mars, and lots of fantastic restaurants. Springtime is Paris is truly magical. Thanks Hotel Londres Eiffel for making it extra special. See you soon.

Reviews.Title: “We have had a great time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: moelzen
Reviews.Content: Due to the 50th birthday we went a weekend to paris. Luckily we found this hotel, it gave as a perfect Paris feeling. The best croissants in the morning and nobody was giving us times for breakfast. We felt welcome and at home. The rooms were small but perfect for our city trip. The girls had an older dousche, the boys a bath and we had a very nice new douche, the rest of the family was jalous of this one. The staff was great and everyday a help with advising how to get at our destination. The `eiffeltoren` was just arround the corner. For busses and metro we only have to walk a few minutes and a perfect privat parking was also around the corner. O yes I forgot internet in the room was also there

Reviews.Title: “Wow this Hotel was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: mamamargew
Reviews.Content: We had to write a great review for this Hotel!! I have travel some but not too much in Europe and got this recommendation from the "Rick Steves France 2008" book. I booked it online and was contacted directly by the staff. He gave us recommendations on how to get to the hotel because we were coming from Amsterdam by train, he told us the number of the bus to get us very close to the hotel, since we were carrying our bags. His communications prior to our travel really helped us feel more confident that this was a great choice. While we were there the night and day staff were exceptional and so friendly. The maids got flowers from guests and I'm sure good tips. There was a friendly relationship between the staff. The rooms were so French and lovely. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Shogan77
Reviews.Content: Paris as you may or may not know is a very expensive city to stay in. Hotels are very expensive and quality varies considerably even if you pay the same amount. With that in mind - this hotel is in a nice quiet street, in a good neighbourhood, not too far from metro lines (and also close to the Eiffle Tower). It has nice, clean, cosy and functional rooms - by Paris standards. Finally, the staff are very friendly and helpful. For the price - in Paris this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: nocwodi
Reviews.Content: Excellent 3 star hotel. My wife and I stayed 3 nights after reading all of the reviews on Trip Advisor. Small room, but very clean, and well presented. Supermarket about 1 minute around the corner, and the Eiffel Tower a 10 minute walk down the Champs de Mars. The absolute find was the restaurant next door (Chez Agnes), and if you are lucky you will get a table. Would recommend this hotel to anyone - the only reason it is not 4 star is because it does not have all the fancy facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service, location in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: biggyboy123
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the reviews of Rick Steves and the subsequent good reviews here at tripadvisor and we were not disappointed at all. We had our 4 yr old boy with us and although the room was small by US standards, it was clean, quiet, cozy, charming, and comfortable (non-smoking, double bed with a foldaway sofa bed) (I included some pics with this review). All hotel staff were excellent, very responsive and willing to assist in any way. Special mention to Arnaud at the desk who was always willing to go the extra mile to help us in every small way (most especially when my wife and son got sick and we needed recommendations for pharmacies and good safe remedies as well as translations) and also to Genevieve and the housekeepers who kept our room spotless. The location (Rue Cler 7th district) was simply wonderful, safe and welcoming-- a true neighborhood in every sense of the word where you can see Parisians living life as they do each day from walking their dogs to carrying grocery bags on the way home after work. Around the short corner we had everything you could need: a very complete and reasonably priced supermarket, two pharmacies, a pastry shop, a meat shop/deli that opens only in the afternoons but which serves the best rotisserie chicken we'd tasted in awhile, a superb family-owned Chinese restaurant, a cafe, boutiques, souvenir shops, bookstores, convenience stores and so much more! But the icing on the cake for our first visit ever to Europe was seeing the Eiffel tower right around the corner! Every night we'd sneak out for a short stroll from the hotel just to see it sparkle at the top of each hour for 10 mins. Five days in Paris will never do justice to the beauty of this city and its people but we are very much certain to have found a hotel that we will be returning to in the future because of their staff's warm hospitality, location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: trifriends
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We found it to be lovely. Well-priced, clean, modern facilities, yet quaint, convenient - we could walk or easily take transit anywhere. We stayed on the top floor - so narrow winding staircase to a modern and well appointed room. Our friends stayed across the hall from us. The English speaking staff were very informative and helpful to these 4 Canadians - first time to Paris for all of us. We cannot comment on breakfast, as we chose to walk to the local patissier for pastries and caffe au lait. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem?”
Reviews.Author: gailtj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Londres-Eiffel for seven nights in late January-early February to celebrate my birthday. Cedric, who was manning the reception desk, gave us a warm welcome, and directed us to our room, which--though not huge--was very prettily decorated and had a rather small, but extremely modern bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable, and everything in the hotel was immaculate. They changed the towels daily, and there was a lovely towel-warmer! (It was bitterly cold outdoors!) Breakfast, which was included with the room, was quite pleasant--juices, coffee, a variety of yogurt, cereal and granola, dried fruits, cold meats and cheeses, and fresh croissants and baguettes. The hotel is non-smoking, and it was very quiet at night. All of the staff was very helpful and cheerful, and the location--very near the Eiffel Tower--was perfect! There are a number of interesting restaurants nearby, and the hotel is located only about a five-minute walk from RER and Metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Sally1984
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in anice quiet street. It is two minutes away from the eiffel tower and there are plenty of nice restaurants to go to nearby. The staff were friendly and helpful not minding that we could speak very little french! They were very acoomodating to anything we asked . The rooms were sparkling clean and well decorated. Although it was small i felt that it just added to its cosiness. Downside was that there was building work going on in the room next to us which meant an early wake up of half eight every morning which we weren't warned about - just as well we were eager to get sightseeing. The room was very small which was fine for me but a big of a squeeze for the other half who found the tiny bath a bit of an experience. Also like to be able to make tea and coffee in the room which we couldn't do.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Charming Place”
Reviews.Author: carpediemCanada
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at this hotel. It has such wonderful Parisian charm! The decor is welcoming, cozy, and tasteful. The location is perfect; the metro is nearby. Also, it is walking distance to the Eiffel Tower as well as charming streets, including Rue Cler. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are tastefully decorated, comfortable, and clean. This is excellent value: a beautiful hotel with loads of character in an awesome location!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Not As Good”
Reviews.Author: greggcl
Reviews.Content: OK. Here goes. As you will see on this site, we have stayed here before, two years previously. Good points ok. Clean hotel, and small, typically paris. Staff helpful and pleasant, although a bit 'stuffy' for a small hotel. Bad points....... no tea or coffee making facilities. Bath plug and shower broken TV channels poor. Empty mini bar Breakfast at 13 euro pp was poor. Considering we booked 8 months ago, we were in the back of the hotel, and not having a 'tower' view. Even though we had to expect things to be more expensive due to the value of the pound against the euro, the nightly rate for the room was 135 euro, and with the bad points considered it wasn't value for money, even at better exchange rates. I guess the rate made it even more painful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Jazot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very nice area. You've got everything you need around: shops, restaurants and subway. The decoration was lovely and my room was exactly what I needed. Also, we felt at home and not in a hotel. The breakfast was delicious ! I always wanted to have a French breakfast. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to have a nice time in a charming place.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, A Little Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JohannVienna
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel owing to the reviews on this website. Our stay was quite nice and there is a lot on the upside, but also some disappointments. The Hotel is very good situated in one of the most upscale neighborhoods of Paris. Many nice shops and restaurants are in a short walking distance, the area is not so crowded by tourists as many other areas we have seen. And the view of the Eiffel Tower on the way back to the Hotel after sightseeing or shopping is simply stunning. Our room was extremely small, but more or less comfortable and nice. The bed was ok and the bathroom as well. I guess we were just a little unlucky with our room, while cleaning i got a glimpse of other rooms and some of them looked much nicer. In a small Hotel like this i expect a more personal or more welcoming atmosphere. Don't misunderstand me, it is not a bad hotel but on the other hand don't have too high expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Merman101
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our accommodation at Hotel de Londres Eiffel. I'm glad I had read the other reviews that warned of the tiny rooms. Our room was very small, but was clean, nicely decorated and very comfortable. There were some lovely touches, like tealights lit in the small courtyard outside our room. We found the reception staff to be efficient if not over friendly. We loved the area - we headed across to the lovely Rue Cler for breakfast each day (don't miss the amazing patisserie) and enjoyed strolling home catching glimpses of the Tower illuminated at night. It's a little walk to the nearest Metro - but this wasn't a problem at all for us. Choose your cafes carefully in Paris as the prices vary hugely. We paid E100 for our room and felt this was good value considering the huge prices charged for accommodation in Paris. I would happily go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: chintsuu
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and clean hotel. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. After a ten hour flight, I was grateful for an extremely early check-in. The location (rue Cler) is great; because, it’s in the middle of everything. Actually, location is the reason I chose to stay here. The neighborhood is quiet and I felt safe walking around at night. The hotel is within a few minutes walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. Also, it’s just minutes away from the metro stop ecole militaire. The room is somewhat small, but that’s Europe. The walls are a little thin. So, you can hear the person next door or noise in the corridor. Also, depending where your room is located, you can hear the trash pickup or street cleaning services driving down the street. To me it wasn’t an issue, but it is noticeable. There is a laundry across the street which comes in handy. I enjoyed my stay and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you go to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: VersaillesGurl
Reviews.Content: Everyone who worked at this hotel were so sweet and knowledgeable. The gentelemen at the desk were there 24/7 and answered any questions anyone had and would help you with any places you are looking to see. Alos, I don't want to leave out the ladies who made sure you have fresh coffee, bread and/or croissants. I have to say the beds (and pillows) were the most comfortable I'd ever had. They have free internet and it can be switched over to English. The location is wonderful! It is very close to the eiffel tower, bus stops and the metro. I strongly recomend this hotel for any who wants to visit this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Only the Basics”
Reviews.Author: Justpassingthru37
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Paris for the first time in September and we pretty much got what we expected at this hotel. The room was small but clean with a nice bathroom. We had a room with a view of the Effiel Tower which was really pretty, especially at night. The only surprise we had came at checkout, when we found out that the daily breakfast service is not included with the price of the room. Probably would have opted for local fare had we known. We chose this hotel mostly for its location which proved to be wonderful. The neighborhood offers a nice choice of restaurants, shops and cafes and the Metro is only a brief walk away (10 minutes). We really felt safe in this residential neighborhood at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: moykky
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for sleeping and honeymooning. It has great location, it is comfortable, it is quiet. Staff is friendly and helpfull. Wifi is free and Eifel tower is just outside. Will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little place - a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: eeteee
Reviews.Content: This place is a really nicely fitted out hotel. Its small but not too small. The bed was super comfy and the guys at the front desk were pretty helpful too. Great location in a neighbourhood with all the necessary shops. There's a laundrette right across the road too which was handy. The only problem we had was that we booked the 5th floor with Eiffel tower views and when we arrived, they'd given it to someone else. The view wasn't quite so good in the room we were given - looked straight onto other windows and walls. It'd be worth phoning to confirm your room if you book the tower view room. Other than that, the hotel was just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic weekend in Paris ....”
Reviews.Author: djukfish
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I never went to Paris before and we wanted to spend a romantic weekend there. We've chosen this hotel for its location, it is only 5 minutes away from the Eiffel Tower! We didn't regret our decision. The staff was really nice and very efficient. We had a lot of questions and they answered them with good ideas. Our bedroom was perfect: quiet, divine decoration, althoug it was small but we spent most of your time enjoyed Paris's streets. IT was nice to be in a hotel that is not part of a chain we really flet like we were priviledged and not just clients. I would really recommend the Londres Eiffel to any couple looking for a romantic time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “not sure why so expensive”
Reviews.Author: Champagne12
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean and perfectly located close to Eiffel Tower. Room was quite small with no tea/coffee making fascilities. The front desk weren't the most helpful. We borrowed an iron one day, but they didn't give us an ironing board. The next day they said they didn't have an iron, but eventually lent it to us anyway with a long lecture of all the problems they'd had with other guest burning the carpets and curtains. Couldn't help thinking it was due to them not giving out the ironing board with the iron in the first place. All in all much too expensive for what you get, but great location, although we tried figuring out if there really was any of their rooms with a view of the Eiffel Tower, and we don't think so, unless you have a very long neck or can look around corners.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Basics”
Reviews.Author: DNW080980
Reviews.Content: I spent a terrific week in Paris of which 3 nights were in this hotel. If you need a centrally-located, clean hotel where all you need to do is sleep and have a restroom, then this hotel will fill the bill. The room is extremely small, but you don't go to Paris for a hotel. Front desk help provided minimal and at times rude assistance. Our room did not have a special view, but you are close to everything anyway. Great restaurant down the street at Cafe Constant. Many cafes nearby as well. My one caution (this coming after staying at another hotel where breakfast was included) is DO NOT EAT THE BREAKFAST AT THE HOTEL. AT APPROXIMATELY $18 PER PERSON, YOU CAN FIND MUCH CHEAPER AND BETTER CEREAL AND FRENCH BREAD ELSEWHERE. We were never told that the breakfast was not included, nor did we receive a receipt until checkout where we were hit with the charges. Shame on me for not asking or reading the fine print on my reservation confirmation. I'd stay here again, but will go out of my way to protect people from being ripped off on the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to do Paris, do it here.”
Reviews.Author: dmartin316
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our destination as part of a Rick Steves tour of Paris. However, my wife and I arrived two days prior to the start of the tour to get a little extra time in. A very charming, clean and affordable hotel. What makes this hotel so valuble is its proximty to the Eiffel Tower, good food and public transportation. The staff is very accomodating and helpful. When we return to Paris, and we will, this will be our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 Star Experience at The Londres Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: Steve92753
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Londres Eiffel Hotel in Rue Cler for 11 nights in a single room & was very satisfied with the hotel room, location & services. The hotel is very well maintained & very clean. The air conditioner (quiet) , hotel elevator, free computer & internet access & all facilites work flawlessly. Hotel staff are very attentive, pleasant. & professional. There was virtually no internal hotel or extraneous street noise so I was able to sleep well. The hotel provides a healthful breakfast including cereal, yogurt and fruits. The Rue Cler area is very nice. I learned following my stay by talking with Paris residents and frequent visitors on the return flight home that Rue Cler is one of the most upscale neighborhoods in Paris & that I could have not done better. I will return to the area and the Londress Eiffel in particular in the future. Overall a very pleasant and satisfying experience at a reasonable price. Steve San Francisco, California

Reviews.Title: “Just as promised”
Reviews.Author: gardenstate71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Londres Eiffel on the recommendation of a family member. Best thing about Londres Eiffel, location, location, location: minutes from the Eiffel Tower, market around the corner, laundry across the street (necessary for a two week trip), city bike rental down the street, and a great little restaurant right next door. Others had told me that city noise was a problem, but Londres Eiffel is down a little street away from the traffic, so no noise problems at all. The room was small as expected but very clean. There's no other place I'd stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoisInNc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in June on a family vacation with our two teenagers. Booked two rooms, which were side-by-side, as requested. We really enjoyed our stay here. You do have to overlook small room sizes, like just about every hotel in Paris. We loved the location - on a quiet side street, just a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel. We had no view, other than the back side of some apartments, but we didnt spend much time in the room. A couple of nights we grabbed a bottle of wine, bread and cheese at a nearby grocery store and laid out a blanket under the Eiffel to watch the lights come on. Very nice and romantic! You also are close to Rue Cler (10 minutes), a metro stop (10 minutes), laundry (across the street), and at least 25 restaurants within a 15 minute walk. Our favorite restaurant was the Cafe Central on Rue Cler. Good food at a reasonable (by Paris standards) price. The hotel staff was very efficient and helpful with directions or anything else. We will probably stay in another part of town if we were to come back, just to enjoy a little different atmosphere, but we would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: simgrila
Reviews.Content: Following a visit to the Alsace region, my wife and I stayed 3 days in Paris straddling July/August, 08. The location of this hotel cannot be beat. It is located in a great neighbourhood, convenient to many attractions yet very quiet. While the room is small, it is cleaverly organized like a cruise ship cabin and we never felt cramped. I now understand why Rick Steve would billet his tours here. The staff is indeed very helpful even before we arrived. They were helpful in getting us a reservation at the Jules Vernes restaurant at the Efffel Tower a month before we arrived. We got the only available spot. We had booked an airport shuttle on our day of departure but when they called that they would be late, the hotel managed to get us a taxi for the same price. That is above and beyond my expectation. The included breakfast is excellent. It is more than just "continental". It has cold cuts too. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great People & Service”
Reviews.Author: tshook80
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The staff is super helpful and very friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The breakfast is delicious and tasty. The rooms were very clean and cheerful. It is very near the Eiffel Tower and Seine River. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Parisian Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IndyBeachGal
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed our short two night stay at this charming, boutique hotel. My husband and I stayed in room 62 with a great nighttime view of the Eiffel tower. Very Romantic. Location was close to the tower but also a short distance to the Metro as we went to the Louvre and Notre Dame Cathedral. Rue Cler was only a short distance from the hotel and was full of nice outdoor markets although it was pouring rain the morning we went. This is where we ate breakfast and had delicious crepes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: LLindaC
Reviews.Content: This is not a five star hotel, but I give it five stars for being all that we expected and more. We trusted the majority of reviews here at Trip Advisor and booked two rooms (Poet's) one for myself and husband, and one for my two daughters (14 and 18) for three nights. We had just spent a rainy cool week piloting a houseboat up the Burgundy Canal, so almost any room would seem luxurious at this point! We stayed in room 22 on the second floor facing the street and my daughters had room 20 in the back- across the hall. They changed the reservation from a double bed to two singles for them- very nice. Our room was better, it had a tub and bit more space, but nobody complained. I didn't find it too small- we had closet and shelf space, two cubby hole shelves beside the bed and a writing desk. We had working windows in the bedroom and bath and a good a/c system which was digitally controlled and quiet. Even though we faced the street, it was a very quiet street so we were never bothered by noise. We enjoyed the small refrigerator for storing our drinks and cheese. The flat screen TV worked well. The free internet in the lobby was a nice perk. We wrote to the hotel twice before our trip with questions about the metro connections and they answered promptly. We didn't really have opportunities to talk to the staff, but they were warm and friendly and helped us with a few needs. We didn't eat breakfast in the lobby, but found many other places at every turn. The block is well served by many bistros, restaurants, boulangeries, wine shops, two markets and a laundry across the street. I am very happy that we chose a less touristy area to stay, as we didn't spend time in the room but needed to sleep well at night. We also enjoyed people watching from the Rue Cler cafes- lots of fun. We thought this hotel was a very good bargain for Paris. It was exceptionally clean, quiet and had lots of charm. I have always preferred small, family run places in Europe for the personal touch and authenticity. We were very happy with our stay and will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The prior reviews are very accurate!”
Reviews.Author: sharklover75cc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Londres May 15 - 19. We chose this hotel based on the rave reviews and hoped they'd be true. Well they were! The front desk staff is very helpful, but not at all intrusive. So if you need help, ask. Or stand there with lost looks, that worked for us! lol! The rooms are incredibly small, smallest I've ever been in. And that's compared to NYC and Italy. But really how much time do you spend in your room?! The metro isn't exactly close to the hotel. It's several blocks away. Not a bad thing, just be prepared. After a long day of walking around Paris, you'll have one more short jaunt to the hotel from the metro. The Metro system is amazing though. While there are several magnificent restaurants around the hotel, we decided to hop the metro and go across town for dinner a couple of nights. There is a Starbucks several blocks away, not just around the corner, but if you head toward Rue de Clar you almost can't miss it. I highly recommend Rick Steve's Rue de Clar walk, its incredibly short, but this little street is great! Every little store you can imagine, a great look into Parisian life! If you're looking to get out of Paris for a day, you must check out ParisChampagneTour.com!!! Lots of amazing reviews here on tripadvisor and they're all true! One of the best tours we've ever been on. We'd definitely recommend this hotel, but next time I think we'll stay on the other side of town, just for a change. For a first visit to Paris or access to tourist destinations, this hotel can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: trwmjs
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. The hotel was recommended to us by some friends of ours who stayed there. We especially liked the location and that they offered free internet service. We appreciated the complimentary boat ride ticket that they gave us as well. That was a wonderful way to see Paris. The main staff person that we dealt with was very helpful and professional. He was there from early morning to evening. He gave us detailed directions on the Metro and gave us the name of a Bistro that we loved. He was very helpful and took the time to answer our questions. Our only reservation was that the breakfast at the hotel was overpriced. We really did enjoy our stay and will recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven In Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Junie13
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this gem of a hotel. The first time we had a lovely room on the 4th floor during a wonderful experience with the Rick Steves tour group. We couldn't wait to come back on our own! We booked an Eiffel Tower view room on the 6th floor for fun. Seeing the Eiffel Tower lit up at night from our window was a delight!
