Upon our arrival we received a little thank you note and gift from Isabel, the manager. Arnaud was there at the desk to greet us and was, as during our previous stay, most helpful again. He not only helped obtain our luncheon reservations at the Restaurant Jules Verne but he assisted us with our telephone confirmation call for our Loire Valley Tour and ordered taxi service for our night at the Moulin Rouge too. We noticed some recent upgrades in our room. It appeared that the bath had new fixtures and a new hairdryer. The flat screen tv seemed to be a new addition and had excellent reception. Ninette, Jacqueline and the other ladies who clean the rooms and serve the breakfast are polite and efficient. We always look forward to the hotel breakfasts to start our day. The rooms are spotlessly clean and very quiet. We highly recommend this hotel to our friends and relatives. This is our Paris home-away-from-home. All of the staff make us feel welcome. We will definitely return in the near future, if we are so fortunate for a yearly trip to Paris. Meanwhile, thanks for the memories!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarmonyinWV
Reviews.Content: Friendly and competent staff, everything well maintained, very clean and pleasant. Nice location and we enjoyed being able to stroll out to the Eiffel Tower every night before bed much more than we expected. Room was small, but about what you should expect in a major European city. Bathroom was quite adequate size, though the shower floor was horribly slippery. I especially enjoyed the computer with high speed internet available in the lobby - free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice small independent hotel. Great location only a few blocks from the Eiffel tower. Good neighborhood - a few blocks from the metro stop. Room was small for US standards. My room had a double bed - only a couple feet from the end of the bed to the wall. A small closet - no storage like dresser. Two small tables on each side of bed. A small desk with a refrigerator underneath was a plus. Small flat screen tv on wall. Another plus was individual room temperature control - meaning air conditioning/heat. I had to ask the desk to turn my air on as it wasn't on centrally for another few weeks, but when I asked the air worked. Bathroom was modern and a pretty good size. Shower was a little small but with glass doors. Maid staff didn't replace all the towels each day - used two, got one, but for Europe had several different sizes of towels. Internet free in lobby was a definite plus - very easy to use. Breakfast buffet was adequate and since it was free with the room deal it was ok. Cereal, cheese, deli type meat, juice, coffee, tea, etc. Only downside was security with room keys(cards). The staff wanted you to turn the card key to the staff at the lobby desk when leaving. There was no security check when you came back to the hotel and asked for room # key. Technically anyone could ask for any room # and receive a key card for that room. Other problem is inside the room the lock on the door didn't seem to lock from the inside - maybe it did, but another person told me she turned the knob to lock it from the inside and then didn't hear the maid come in while in the shower - so obviously hers didn't lock from the inside. Hotel was on a quiet street, and close to Eiffel tower, Rue Cler neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Londres Eiffel is my New Paris Favorite”
Reviews.Author: travelmeister8
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent and the hotel is lovely on a quiet street--the rooms very clean and comfortable, nicely appointed, and breakfast is grand. Having stayed a dozen times at another nice hotel but on a noisy street near the Eiffel Tower, this is now my new favorite. All the folks who were there attending to the hotel were great, and one made extra effort in just about everything from the best way to get to a location, to advice on tour options, to getting our shuttle to the airport. He was so very pleasant and kind. For the best views of the Tour Eiffel, pick the 6th floor rooms. 64 is larger than 62, and 62 has a tub rather than a shower stall. You won't be sorry with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Eliza_8
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 8 ladies staying in 4 x twin bedded rooms at this hotel for 3 nights in February 2008. All of our rooms were lovely. Extremely clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were on the small side but perfectly adequate and spotless. The hotel is just a few minutes walk from the 'militaire' metro and the Eiffel Tower. It is extremely conveniently situated in a small side street. We did not experience any noise at night and all was quiet. Having said this there are no shortage of restaurants in the area, all within easy walking distance and they all served lovely food. The hotel served breakfasts, but we chose to use a little cafe closeby as this was cheaper. The reception desk was open 24/7 and Arnaud was friendly and helpful. All in all our stay was wonderful and I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Sacratomato
Reviews.Content: I tried to book two rooms at the Hotel de la Tulipe, a smaller very charming hotel closer to the Rue Clare, but they were fully booked. So our stay at the de Londres was not really our first choice, but our three night stay was enjoyable. As usual for Parisian hotels, the room was small but the bathrooms were newly remodeled; all white sparkling tiles and new fixtures. The staff was polite and most were very friendly. The lady manager was so charming and friendly. We stayed in room 107, one of the "Poets Room". We didn't request a room with a view, so we weren't disappointed. But, if you have mobility problems you need to be very specific when you book a room. There IS an elevator for guests. But what isn't clear is that the "Poets" rooms aren't serviced by that elevator. Our room 107 was up three flights of narrow stairs. So tell the booking clerk of any special needs. Actually, I like those narrow curving stairs, they always make me think of Paris. The hotel breakfast was 12 euros ($18!) for cold cuts, cheese, cold cereal and bread. Walk out the lobby door and turn right, make another right on to Saint Dominique. Walk about 100 feet and across the street is the prettiest, friendliest little patissier shop you could hope to have breakfast at. If you keep walking about three blocks further there is a Starbucks. Although why any American would go to Paris to drink at Starbucks is beyond me. The best thing about the de Londres is the location near the Rue Clare. After a visit to the Opera house and then to the hectic department stores behind it, we escaped the crowds and popped out of the Metro at La Tour Maubourg. My son looked around the quiet streets and the pretty little park and sighed "Home!"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris057
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel in February with our 2 teenage sons. We booked directly with the hotel via phone/email - all very easy and we had adjacent rooms as requested- and a good deal on room rates. We can thoroughly recommend this hotel to all - we even had the breakfast which set us up for the day! Plenty of good restaurants nearby. Great position near to Eiffel Tower and many other sights. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Londres Eiffel is a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cthrlyn
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Londres Eiffel. I was there as a single female traveler in my thirties and felt very comfortable and at home during my 3 night stay. I was ugraded, prior to my arrival and without asking, from a single room for 110 euros, to a double room on the fifth floor which was meant to be 180 euros. Of course, this greatly added to my enjoyment of the hotel, but I think I would have enjoyed it at full price almost as much! The bed was very comfortable, the room quiet, and the vew from the room and bathroom was beautiful. The air conditioning worked perfectly, and the flat screen tv was great. The room was small, but had a lot of storage space, and seemed bigger because of the French doors/window which could be opened during the day. The location was perfect for walking around, and seemed very safe at night. I did not have breakfast in the hotel, rather on Rue Clere which was close by and more interesting than the hotel lobby. There is also internet access in the lobby, and a handy shuttle service to the airport. The only very minor complaint that I have is that there was no safe in the room, & the hotel was not willing to keep valuables behind the desk. At the end of my stay in France I went back to Paris, but had already booked a different, more expensive hotel in the St. Germain area. I much preferred the Londres, and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful Mother-Daughter trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Motherdaughtertrip77
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, after reading the reviews and deciding on Hotel Londres, we made the right choice. We actually stayed there twice, first for 3 nights before we left on a European Cruise and for 2 nights after we returned. The Staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful in assisting us with restaurant reservations, transportation and directions to things we wanted to do. We were so excited when we arrived in Paris, it must have shown and they gave us this quaint room with a view of the Eiffel Tower, which we just admired all night long. The rooms were not large, but were cozy for the two us, who had definitely overpacked and had six bags between us. Once we rearranged a little to accomodate the luggage, we were fine. The bathrooms were clean and fresh and the beds were comfortable. We enjoyed our coffee and breakfast in the mornings, the women were always happy to serve whatever we wanted,the croissants were the best!! It was a very enjoyable atmosphere. Cedric and Isabelle were both instrumental in procuring us reservations in hard-to-get-into places. It was so worth it. Our stay in Paris couldn't have been more perfect. This hotel definitely captured the feel of Paris that we wanted to experience. I would certainly recommend this hotel to travelers. We're looking forward to returning again hopefully in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: Basle
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good and bad points. Bad: Our room (62), and bathroom were both small. They were o.k. for two people for two nights, but I wouldn't want to spend more than a few nights in it. It would be o.k. for a single person for a longer stay. The bed was narrow - I think two obese people would be really cramped in it. Our bedroom was directly next to the lift which was noisy. The breakfast was nothing special, and at 12 Euro per head expensive. (We had a smaller but nicer breakfast in an historic bakers shop near the hotel for under 10 Euro for the two of us). The lady serving breakfast was not friendly, and seemed put out when I asked (in French) for plates and a clean glass. Good: We had superb views of the Eiffel Tower from our bedroom and bathroom. The room and bathroom were clean, mould free and nicely decorated. The hotel is s short walk from the Eiffel Tower, and Les Invalides and other tourist sites are within walking distance. All the receptionists, night auditors and manager were polite and friendly. The hotel is about ten minutes walk from Ecole Militaire métro station. The hotel is in a smart, but at the same time lively area with shops and restaurants. If you would like the superb Eiffel Tower view, ask for room 64. This was next to ours, but not next to the lift. However, you wouldn't have the view from the bathroom! This is a good hotel, but I couldn't say fantastic. Perhaps my expectations were too high having read some of the other reviews here.

Reviews.Title: “Does the Job”
Reviews.Author: etan92612
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights on Rick Steves advice. The staff was helpful. We got great directions and maps whenever we asked and received vouchers for a Seine cruise when we checked in. Had croissants and coffee in the morning in the little breakfast area. Tiny little elevator provided enough room for two people with one suitcase. Room 64 had a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower. Double bed took up most of the room and bathroom was very small. Shower almost too small to pick up fallen bar of soap. The cleaning ladies were absolutely charming. They sang "Bon Jour" as they greeted us in the morning. They could be heard singing alternate lines in a French melody as one cleaned the bathroom and one made the beds. Overall the hotel served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Orchids”
Reviews.Author: lizw2000
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, small, cozy hotel close to the tower. Great little restaurants and shoppes close by. We had the room with the Eiffel tower view. The hotel was clean and the bed was quite comfortable. It was a beautiful place to spend the weekend of our engagement!!!! The lobby was small and quaint. The orchids were beautiful. The front desk staff member named Armeaud (i don't think i spelled that right) was terrific. A great ambassador for the hotel. Great service!!! The elevator was a very small, but two with luggage could fit quite comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Andrea327
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice at the hotel. They gave us free tickets for a boat ride and a map of the city. They also called us a taxi for the next morning and let us check in early (10:30am instead of 2pm, I believe). The room was very small. My boyfriend barely fit on the toilet it was so narrow. The bed was a typical European bed, small and hard double bed. The place was clean besides the few ink(?) stains on the bedspread. The hotel had breakfast for an additional price, WiFi, and A/C although we didn’t use any of them. The hotel also had a lift which was very helpful when you have heavy bags and are on the fifth floor. The hotel was not very far from the Eiffel Tower, and you could actually see a third of it from our room. It was also pretty quiet for being right in the middle of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Visit!”
Reviews.Author: juliennee
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful boutique Paris find! Hotel is in a great location, near the Tour Eiffel, and Dome Church, close to Metro, and within walking distance of Arc de Triumph and more! Arnaud was very helpful, and gave us great recommendations on restaurants in the area. If you are looking for a personal, quaint, friendly, clean, quiet, restful haven from the hustle and bustle of Paris, Hotel de Londres Eiffel is for you. We were recommended this hotel by a friend who has stayed there twice, and we were very happy. Remember, you are not in the states, rooms are small, but very clean, and private bathrooms with elevator. We will definately go back and stay! Thank you Arnaud for making our trip easy and a welcome sanctuary after a busy day sightseeing! We loved every minute. Julienne - Orange County, CA, USA

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Carlsons
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris was wonderful. A bit nervous about how we would be treated, we were relieved to find this haven after a long day of travel. We received a warm welcome and were soon in the twin room we had booked. Though small, it was immaculate, well appointed and quiet (at the back of the building). We were very happy with the location; easy strolling distance to the Eiffel Tower, around the corner from a market (cheap snacks and bottled drinks), shops and cafes, a short walk to the Metro, #69 bus (to Louvre), Pont d'Alma RER, and Rue Cler. Best of all, we felt a part of a real neighborhood; local residents going about their daily business, escorting their children to a nearby school, shopping and hurrying by on bikes and scooters to work or play. Hotel de Londres Eiffel, thank you to your wonderful staff for making our stay so pleasant. We hope to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Londress Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: Redleg71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Londres Eifel in mid-september. FWIW, I used trip advisor for all of the research for our european vacation and by and large the reviews from other contributers were fairly accurate. Bottom Line upfront- the hotel was nice, clean and affordable. For someone who had never traveled outside the states unless I was on a cruise ship, the size of the rooms was something you need to get used too. The rooms and baths are immaculately clean but they are small. It doesnt really matter because you will find yourself spending hardly anytime there anyways. a slight annoyance was the fact that despite numerous email confirmations they failed to have our eiffel tower view room available when we got there and put us on a lower floor. To compensate they offered us two free tickets for a cruise on the seine. (which was offfered without any complaining on our behalf-they genuinely felt bad for the mix up and we were so tired from the flight we just wanted to get in a room) The room on the lower floor was like a closet and I would STRONGLY suggest the tower view rooms which seem a bit larger and are nicer and are well worth the additional cost. We opted out of the breakfest and found numerous places to eat around the Hotel. La Gourmandaiss which is on Rue de Grenelle seemed friendly to tourists and has great take-out breakest food at a fraction of the cost---plus its on the way to the metro. To our surprise, despite checking in to the smaller room, our eiffel tower room became open and the hotel moved all of our belongs up while we were out to lunch. Which was nice. The hotel also has WI-Fi so if you bring your laptop you should have no problem logging in. They have a computer in the lobby but it is a french keyboard and unless you read and write french will probably be a bit cumbersome for most. It is a few blocks from the Eifel Tower which makes for a romantic evening stroll and is a a short walk from the Metro Stop Ecole Militaire. There is also a Laundry right next to the hotel which is great if you plan on traveling light. All in all would a reccomend this hotel to a friend? Absolutely! but if going back myself I was not impressed enough to say I found the perfect hidden gem and might be inclined to see if there were some other alternatives. At 180 EUR a night you can't go wrong and if you are on a budget you will not have buyers remorse.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel de Londres Eiffel - Again”
Reviews.Author: Edmonton017
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for seven consecutive evenings from late September to early October, 2007. We had previously visited the hotel for about a week in 2006 with our two adult children. As usual, we found the staff to be very helpful and professional. Cedric was very helpful and professional (as he was on our first trip) and helped make our second stay at the hotel most enjoyable. We also appreciated Ninette in the breakfast room where we ate every morning. The hotel is situated in a very good location in Paris (safe, clean) and is very close to the Eiffel tower. There are many fine restaurants nearby, especially in the Rue Cler market. Naturally, there is an abundance of grocery stores, bakeries, chocolate shops, etc. There are also several laundromats close by. Although the breakfast may seem a bit expensive (12 euros), it does include an assortment of meats, cheese, yogurt, fruit, juices, cereal, buns, croissants, coffee, etc. At nearby restaurants, you will need to pay about 7 euros just for a coffee, two buns and a juice. Once again, we found the hotel to be excellent and we would certainly stay here again. Thanks Cedric and Ninette!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Naperville”
Reviews.Author: jlejsek
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris and loved the city. My husband and I were hugely disappointed in this hotel. The hotel is in a great neighborhood- Rue Cler and is convienent to restaurants , patisseries and The Eiffel Tower. We had booked hotel about six months in advance with a written confirmation from hotel. I e-mailed them prior to our arrival to reconfirm. Everything seemed to be on track. We were to stay four days at the beginning of our trip and a final night at the end after returning to Paris from Loire Valley. When we checked out after four days Iwas informed by Cedric that owed for five days. I said no we only stayed for four. He said you told me you were staying for five. I said thats right but this time we are only here for four at which point he pulled out my fax to them which clearly detailed the dates we were staying. Cedric was very mad and said he had a room he could not sell. Why is this my problem/ He was the one who made the error in our dates. I told him repeatedly that we would be back on the 19th for a final night. I think he was so mad that he didn"t pay attention to what I said to him< very surly attitude. When we returned on the 19th we were told the hotel was full and no rooms despite my written confirmation. I was offered a free cruise on Seine and they managed to find another hotel for us albeit in a less concienent location. I was also told by Arnaund that is was my resonsibility eo schlep me own bags over to the new hotel. After I continued to protest he finally relentd and gave us 10 euro. Never recieved any apology from hotel-very bad customer service. I can net in good faith reccomend this property

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: mcarey
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect spot in Paris, the perfect hotel! It's located close to the eiffel tower (within walking distance) in the very upscale St Germaine district. For the price, you can't beat it. The rooms are adorable and the staff is very helpful. The shower was a trip because it was so small, but that's everywhere you go in Paris :) We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: dkmssmith
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days and had a wonderful time. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. Our room was cozy, clean, and comfortable. The location is great, with it being near the Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler (an exquisitely charming local pedestrian shopping area), bus stops, cafes, and a short walk to the Metro and the Seine River. The staff was always there when we had a question and they were great, especially since we speak no French. We would definitely stay there again and again. Thank you Hotel de Londres Eiffel for making our trip to Paris a joy!

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, excellent Hosts”
Reviews.Author: adnaud
Reviews.Content: It was by chance that our reservations at the other Hotels did not materialize,We wndered in the streets of Paris looking for some good Hotel as we wanted to be near the Great Eiffel Tower.We landed at the reception desk and here we came across Arnauld with his cheerful face who was glad and quick enough to accomodate us in a cosy room from with a view of the Eiffel Tower. As this was our first visit to Paris Arnauld patiently briefed us about the places to visit along with maps.We took his advice and were able to see Paris in a very short span of time. The room was cosy and the linens were clean, Breakfast was excellent and so was the staff.Basing on our experience I would always recommend Hotel de Londres Eiffel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: robthky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in early August. The hotel staff was very helpful, the rooms were clean and although I do not speak any french, I had no problems at all. Very convienant to the Eiffel Tower (5 min walk). Nice choice of small cafe's and shops in the area. Skip the pricey breakfast and walk to a nearby shop instead.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience All Around”
Reviews.Author: maximus97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel for 5 nights. Our room was very clean and tidy everyday. We also enjoyed the cleanliness of the bathroom. The entire staff spoke English and were extremely helpful with our transportation needs. I would definitely stay there again and will recommend them to anyone interested staying in a lovely boutique hotel near the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelhavenOrlando
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay at Hotel Appollon, the sister property to Hotel de Londres Eiffel, but when we arrived, they were doing some construction and they moved us to Hotel de Londres Eiffel. It was a great move! The location was fantastic--lots of nice restaurants and shopping. And the staff was really great! Cedric was very helpful. I will recommend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Your Best Choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pdxfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this marvelous hotel near the Eiffel Tower with our two daughters, and loved it! The always helpful Cedric saved our entire trip with a last minute plane reservation when a travel agent let us down. The Rue Cler nearby is a delight, and you do not want to miss the Eiffel Tower at night. It is spectactular.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for a week, it was great”
Reviews.Author: melissa326
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in May 2007 for our 10th anniversary. We were upgraded to a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower (Room 54) at no extra charge. We booked our room through e-mail and even had them make reservations for us at Altitude 95 ahead of time. That was all very easy. The hotel room was very small, as expected, but also very clean and comfortable. The hairdryer in the bathroom worked fine and it has a electricity converter thingy, so we didn't need to bring our own. I loved the bread and pastries every morning at breakfast and the coffee too. No, the woman who serves breakfast doesn't seem to speak much English, but this is France. And even though I don't speak any French I was able to figure out my coffee request (hint: noir means black). The elevator is small, but it looks newish, has a large mirror and works great, so even though I am claustrophobic, I never felt uneasy in the elevator. Arnaud was wonderful and very helpful. He made dinner reservations and recommendations for us several time and helped us navigate our way to Versailles and Chartres via train. Our favorite restaurants were Cafe le Bosquet (great mozzarella tart, frites and creme brule), Thoumieux (best onion soup I've ever had) and Le P'tit Troquet (fabulous endive-apple-cheese salad and pork wine stew). Every dinner we had was within easy walking distance to the hotel. One piece of advice. Arnaud can all you a cab, but they start the meter running as soon as they get the call, usually adding 4-6 euros on to the bill. Once it took over 20 minutes for the cab to come, causing us to miss our train and costing us 14 euros when we stepped in the cab. After that we figured out that there is a cab stand right around the corner and that was a lot cheaper! Check the map in the front of Rick Steves- it has taxi stands marked on it. I would go back to this hotel anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Arnaud was wwonderful”
Reviews.Author: karen99Florida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last July (2006) with another couple. We found the room to be very parisian...very quaint and cozy. It was kept very clean throughout our stay. It was abit small, which is of course normal for Paris so really had no problem with the size of the room. When we checked in Arnaud went out of his way to welcome us and to make sure I got the room I requested. I even swithced keys with my friend and Arnaud switched the keys back reassuring me that the original key given to me was for the room I indeed requested which was one with an Eiffel tower view. And the view was lovely. The tower "twinkles" after dark on the hour for ten minutes. I was however, shocked to see the tower completely dark in the wee hours when I woke up to use the bathroom. I'm not sure why this surprised me but it really did!! Arnaud was very conscientious and polite during our entire stay. Felt very safe in the area and came back to the hotel during the wee hours most nights. The lobby door is locked after hours so they will "buzz" you in. There is free internet in a small closet type room off the lobby. We had a delicious lunch at the Jules Verne Restraunt (top of the Eiffle Tower) at the tune of $750.00 (USD) for four of us...ouch!! The view was fabulous and it was several courses which took about 3 hours but the wait staff was stuffy, curt and even abit rude. My water glass was left empty after filling everyone elses at the table. Not sure what I did, but I definitly felt "blacklisted" whch was crazy considering we were spendind $750.00 for lunch!!! LOL...On a lighter note, the pastries in Paris are absolutly to die for. I can still taste them!! Would definitly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_in_London
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews and the original "newly developed" apartments we had booked with another company were not completely built, I took a chance and booked 2 rooms at Hotel de Londres Eiffel. And, I am thrilled that I did. It is completely perisian and as quaint as can be. The rooms are above average in size for European hotels. Very clean and well presented. We booked 1 room with Eiffel tower views (for my parents who have never visited Paris) and another room for my husband and I. Our room overlooked the street and flats across the way. Flower boxes hanging from every window. An amazing cheese and meat shop below. Our room was decorated in colours of creams and green. Very soothing. Our bathroom contained a shower cubicle just big enough to turn around in - but it's paris! I could hardly complain about a shower! Lovely olive soap and thyme body wash left as complimentary. Mini fridge stocked with fizzy drinks and beer.(No wine, however a terrific wine shop around the corner - closes somewhat early-before 10:00 pm, I believe). My parents room, with eiffel tower views was just as spectacular. The red and white toile wallpaper makes the room feel smaller than it is, but the view at night makes up for it. The bathroom held a nice size shower and bath. Mini fridge stocked with cold drinks also in this room. Extra blankets and pillows also available in the wardrobe space of both rooms. Just around the corner, a mere two minute walk stands the eiffel tower in all of its glory. There is a terrific "American" style bistro around the corner on your way to the eiffel tower. If the weather is nice, have breakfast outside (omletts to die for!). Cedric, the smile behind the hotel's front desk is spectacular. He will give you advice on places to eat, how to travel there, etc. He suggested we visit the Palace of Versaille which is a short train journey out. If you have time, do this! At the moment, there is a bit of development happening and down the street from the hotel, a building is being remodelled. However, the noise is only heard during the day when you would more than likely be siteseeing. Mind the rubbish and glass bins being emptied in the middle of the night - it startled me the first night. Again, I cannot praise this hotel enough. It shall be our second home from this point on, each time we return to the city of spectacular Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and friendly, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: RMFRome
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on previous recommendations and wasn't disappointed. The main important points for me were the friendly staff and lovely room. The front room I had on the second floor wasn't noisy (just a few US tourists every second day or so on the street or outside your room door by the lift but they didn't hang around long). Bring your own flannel/face cloth, body lotion, shower cap, teaspoon (no coffee or tea making facilities in the room and no food allowed and you might need it for eating food outside). Some rooms have a bath (not full-length) and the water was occasionally tepid at peak showering times over the crowded Easter period. I found the street view from my second floor front-facing room 'cute' and much more interesting than the quieter back-facing views. The free hotel internet access is standing up in a little kiosk, so useful for checking your email but not for anything more serious. Also explains why the kiosk is usually available when you need it. I appreciated French, US and English (Wall Street Journal, Herald Tribune, Guardian) newspapers available to guests in reception everyday. The hotel is a good five-eight minutes walk from the nearest metro, Ecole Militaire, but it was worth crossing the park to go to Dupleix or La Motte Picquet metro stops. Definitely take the 69 bus, at least as far as Bastille (its outward journey is along the Seine and the homebound one through the Louvre). You could also decide to take the 87 from the hotel to Bastille but the trip isn't quite as scenic. The stop for both is just off Place Général Gouraud on Av J. Bouvard (at the start of the park as if you were walking to the Eiffel Tower). The breakfast was fine but I preferred going to Rue Cler , even though it was more expensive, for a more Parisian atmosphere. Some tourists are disappointed that Rue Cler's not more exciting but I enjoyed seeing the same locals there every day and got chatting to some as well. At cafés and restaurants the French think it is an insult to offer you a carafe of water if you don't ask for it (presumably the gourmets stick to their wines) so don't feel annoyed at asking for some (de l'eau ordinaire because I am told de l'eau normale is still mineral water). Café Constant just a couple of doors away from the hotel does the best food but its atmosphere is very 'café like' and unexciting. Le Croque Au Sel just around the corner in the little Italian-like Square Sedillot has a much better atmosphere and its food is OK. Try and sit upstairs if you can. Their competitor next door looks even better (i.e. it was always more crowded), but I didn't get a chance to try it out. The square is literally just behind the hotel. Visitors who recommend buying a museum pass beforehand to avoid the long queues outside Gare d'Orsay are absolutely right! I didn't and ended up coming back latish on Thurs night (when it's open late) to avoid queuing for such a long time. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: needtravelfix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel last year. (I know, late review.) I just wanted to clarify someone's review about the hotel's amenities. Although the rooms are small, they are very clean. I know by U.S. standards they are small, but it's different in their culture. We adjusted well enough to the small room and bathroom. It wasn't a big deal. We read about Paris before we left in Rick Steve's travel guides, and expected the rooms to be small. In addition, I think the noise level around the hotel was fine. We did hear the garbage/refuse trucks sometimes, but that really didn't bother us. It was great to look outside the window and see what was going on below. It wasn't a very busy street; I thought it was a quaint hotel, with a small view of the Eiffel Tower. It did look quite nice at night when the tower was lit up. Additionally, the continental breakfast was really good. They usually served croissants, ham (wonderful), and cheese (la tomme). They also had cereal and yogurt there. A nice lady asked us if we wanted coffee and attended to us. It was pretty much self-serve. She was always very polite. The coffee was wonderful; the best I've ever had. By the way, the staff at the hotel were quite pleasant and helpful, even with the broken French I knew, the concierge was helpful. Thankfully, he was able to converse with me in English. Even before we arrived at the hotel, I was impressed with their service. I was able to email the hotel with my reservation and requests; they were quite responsive. They usually contacted me within a few hours of my email. I had emailed them about two-three months before our trip and with each email they responded to my questions. Equally important, we were able to get around Paris quite well from the hotel. We were able to take the metro (about 10 minute walk). It's not far from Rue Cler, and there's a wonderful restaurant a few doors down, which we visited at least twice. It's called La Varangue. We also discovered a few other restaurants on our own just by looking at the menus, and trying it out. By the way, if you are interested in internet access, the hotel does have a computer in the lobby for guests to use that has internet access. I was able to correspond with my kids using their computer. I didn't use the wireless internet access since I didn't bring any laptop or PDA on this trip. Anwway, I highly recommend this hotel and hope to return to soon! Just talking about this trip makes me want to go back! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de Londres Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: dpal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on what I read from Tripadvisor and this was the BEST advise I have gotten. This hotel is very sweet and quaint I might say. Quite neighborhood. We stayed 3 nights the first week of Feb 2007. We paid 105 euros a night . The staff was very nice. Our room was very clean and the best olive soap, Queen Bed was firm and comfortable. Too cool was the flat screen T.V. with remote. Free Internet access is available in the lobby and offered english newspaper. Only two tiny things you need to know.........#1. The shower stall is really small. So If you are larger than us you might have a problem... I am 5'3" size 18 and my husband is 6'1" 220 lbs. We were cutting it tight. It must have been made for smurfs......But The bathroom was Newly Remodeled ....Crisp and Clean & Modern. I loved that. #2. They DO NOT OFFER washcloths (facecloths). We had to go buy us kitchen cloths from the grocery store. I had to have something. :-). Our room ....I think it was room 24 .......it was facing the street...they are also small but that is the European style right. It was sooo cute. We went go downstairs and ask for ice.........they gave us 7 cubes. How funny. Better than nothing I suppose. Around the block we found a great little bar....in the mornings we would go there for our coffee....We did not eat at the hotel we just grab a roll from the bakery on our way to catch the sightseeing bus........and we would eat a big lunch somewhere. Also at night we would stop at the grocery store by the hotel get some salami & cheese and then stop at the bakery get some bread then go to our room and eat and have a mixed drink. We were tooooo tired to wait for the restaurants to open up for the evening and went to bed by 10pm. We really like the location the most. The hotel is in a very short walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. Around the block from the hotel was a grocery store, liquor store, bars, and across the street is a Laundromat. We were in Paris 2-days. That was plenty for us. We saw everything we wanted to see......Eiffel Tower, Notre Dam, Louvre, etc. What we did was walk to the tower and catch the red double decker sightseeing buses.......2-days for 22 euros. Unlimited - on and off access. This was great. They have think over dozen drop-offs. One time we were tired.....and the sun was out that day.......so we just rode the whole route and sat up top and enjoyed the views. You see everything. They pickup every 10 min. This was cool.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel near the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: minkKC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in early March 2007. Staff ranged from cordial to incredibly friendly - was frequently asked to let them know if I needed any help, how was my trip going, what I did that day, etc. Room was small by US standards, but perfectly normal size for a european hotel from my experience. I booked a single for 95 Euro a night, but received a twin bedded room. Not sure if that is their standard single room or if I was upgraded. Very clean, quaint decor, flat screen TV, extra pillows and blankets. The mattress was a little firmer than I prefer, so I padded it with one of the extra blankets and slept very well. I kept the windows open every night and never had a problem with outside noise, but this may be because my room did not face the street. I could hear hallway noises and the elevator from my room, but this was only a problem when I tried to sleep at off hours. Bathroom had grohe fixtures, hair dryer, and soap and sage scented shower gel (wonderful) were provided. Plenty of hot water! Loved the free internet access in the lobby, and it always seemed to be available when I needed it. I didn't take advantage of the (12 Euro) breakfast, just stopped at the bakery around the corner for a croissant or headed to the food stand in the Champ du Mars for a crepe. I loved the area - it seemed a little quieter than some of the neighborhoods closer in to the center. I often used the Dupleix metro stop instead of the closer Ecole Militaire stop so that I could wander through the park on the way there. The only thing that might keep me from staying here again is just wanting to experience a different neighborhood. If I were planning on staying near the Eiffel Tower/Rue Cler area again, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Eiffel View”
Reviews.Author: Peggysue45
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on past reviews & were were not disappointed. Stayed 5nights Jan. From gracious Arnaud at reception to the room with a view. We were on the top floor (6th) with a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower it is at night that you can really appreciate it when the lights twinkle on the hour. While the room as smallish is just added to the atmosphere with the very french wallpaper. The bed was comfortable & the bar fridge an added bonus. The shower was a little tricky due to the windows opening to the apartments over the road so one has to be a tad discrete until the windows mist up especially for tall people & while the lift is very small at least there is one unlike a lot of European hotels who do not have lifts but many flights of stairs to walk up. The tower is a mere 5-10min walk depending on how fast or slow one walks from there it is a short walk across the road to the river where we caught the Batobus river boat which is a hop on hop off version to the bus. From the river is another short walk over the bridge to the Trocadero area stand at the top & look back at one of the most amazing sights of the Eiffel especially at night - restaurants abound in this area The tube stn is a bit of a walk from the hotel especially with luggage glad we took a taxi instead from Garde De Noeud Stn which was very inexpensive - there is a well stocked grocery store, delicious pastry shops, restaurants & pubs in easy walking distance to the hotel even though it was winter we sat outside one of the pubs to have a drink as the smoke inside was unbearable but we believe the laws on smoking in France are about to change. Also do not try & shop in Paris on a Sunday as the shops in the "opera" area are closed this we found unbelievable something we are used to in Australia - some shops are open at the top of the concorde near the Arch de Truimphe. Found a great Outlet shopping village at La Vallee Village about an hour train ride from Paris but worth it to see the countryside & the bargins once we arrived. Do not miss a day trip to Normandie which was perhaps the highlight of our UK/Paris trip. Thank you Arnaud for all your assistance in helping us get around & for making our stay most comfortable The Aussies

Reviews.Title: “Nice... You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: minhwinn
Reviews.Content: This is my first time I have ever written a review for anything. I thought it would be important to express my opinion of this hotel. We stayed at Hotel de Londres from February 16th through 19th, 2007. First of all, I booked this hotel based on what I read from Tripadvisor. This was the first time I used Tripadvisor’s advice. Sometimes one wonders if the reviews are from the hotel owners, employees, friends and family of the hotel. Regardless, this is my experience of the hotel. As a Valentine’s weekend surprise for my wife, I booked a double bed for three nights at this hotel. The cost came out to be around $417.00 USD. We arrived at the hotel from an airport shuttle (CDG airport; 17 euro per person). Once at the hotel, we were greeted by a real friendly female lady at the counter. I think she was either the owner or a manager of the hotel. I had emailed the hotel and requested a room on the highest floor as possible. Based on reading the prior reviews, I did not think paying extra for the superior room with a view of the Eiffel was worth the money. The nice lady directed the clerk to give us room #62, which was the highest floor and a view of the top half of the Eiffel Tower. We really appreciate the upgrade without the extra cost. As expected, our room was tiny and the shower was small, but overall the room was spotless. Both my wife and I are small (5’-6”) and we could barely fit on the bed. Maybe its the European thing. The free internet wireless was awesome. We were able to webcam and talk to our kids in California everyday for free using Yahoo messenger. There was a slight issued. Since we were on the 6th floor, there was no Wifi connection from the hotel, so I had to tap into the neighbors’ unsecured line. Keep in mind that the walls at this hotel are very thin. Whenever my wife uses the webcam and talk from our room, you could hear her in the hallway (she doesn’t talk loud, but the walls are thin). On our 2nd day, a family from the US checked into the hotel with kids. 2 years and up. They were on the 1st or 3rd floor and we could hear them from our room (at 1am) so we went out for a walk and came back at 3am. By that time, the kids had fallen asleep…. That’s the biggest disadvantage of this hotel. I was unable to sleep 2 nights out of 3. Just my luck. I am a very light sleeper and in the middle of the night, I could hear the people next door using the bathroom. Yes, water from a person (pee) and into the toilet then flushing. If you are a slight sleeper, may want to consider. The location of the hotel is okay. It took us about 10 minutes to walk to the Eiffel Tower. On our last day at the hotel, again, we were unable to sleep and got out of bed at 5am and went for a walk to the Eiffel Tower at 6 am... Its nice to see the Tower without the other tourist. The other attraction at this location is Cler Rue, as mentioned by others. I thought this would be a big open market, but I was disappointed that the market was real small and it took us about 5-10 minutes to walk through the market. On our last day in Paris, we were near the Notre Dam and found a great location. I think the street is St. German or something like that. If you get a chance, take the underground train and visit this place. Lots of shops, restaurants and people (tourists, locals, etc.). I wished we knew this place sooner. Overall, I think this hotel is okay. If we visit Paris again, I won't stay at this hotel again due to the location and noise, but hey... you get what you paid for....Best of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room in great location”
Reviews.Author: finickytripper
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be charming, well-decorated and very comfortable, and in a very good location. The Eiffel Tower is a short stroll away (although that seemed in hindsight less important than it sounds), a delicious bakery is just a few doors down the street for a nice breakfast (more important than it sounds), Rue Cler is 10 minutes or less; the metro is unfortunately a little further. Bathrooms were functional and clean; room was a little small; no significant views to speak of. Internet service was easily accessible in the small "closet" in the lobby. The elevator was a little cramped and involved two doors to enter and exit, but was a welcome hassle vs. climbing two stairs with luggage. We found the front desk staff helpful but a little stuffy. The recommended Indian restaurant down the alley was fantastic. Overall, we were pleased with the stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy and charming Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Muralmakerinnewark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel for a week in October, 2006, while enjoying a Rick Steves tour of Paris. We arrived a day early and indulged in a upper premium floor with a "room with a view" of the Eiffel tower as a treat to ourselves. The room was the smallest I've ever been in, and had us a bit scared, thinking this was the premium room and that we would be demoted to an even smaller, regular room for the rest of our one week stay with our tour. The room was nicely decorated, with matchy fabric on the curtains and bedspread and deep colored walls which made the room feel even smaller than it probably was. It was all very attractive once you get used to the smallness of the room. The bed was comfortable and there were good pillows and blankets. Built in wall cupboards served as our closets which were a bit tight but manageable. The "view" of the Eiffel tower was comical, since only the top 1/10th of the tower could be seen due to neighboring buildings blocking the view. Not worth the splurge for the more expensive room with the tower view, since the whole tower was a short walk away and we could visit it any time we wanted on foot. Our "regular" room on a lower floor, for the rest of our stay was 25% larger, which was a big improvement and cost less. The bathrooms were spotless, with new fixtures, and a charming paned window that opened out to a windowbox and a view of the street below. Standard plain hotel towels, but plenty of them and they were changed daily. The tub (without any curtain or doors) had a hand held shower wand which required some creative bathing, but there was plenty of hot water and water pressure. A nice big sink mirror with shelf worked great for shaving and make-up. The street was a little noisy at night, with a garbage truck doing the rounds at least 3 times the week we were there and the occasional vespa whizzing by. It wasn't too bad, we got used to it, and we enjoyed having the windows open for the fresh air it offered. The breakfast buffet was pretty good, fresh croissants & baguettes, jams, some fruit, yogurts, coffee and teas. It's boring for 7 days in a row, but it's great to get you out the door. I wouldn't pay extra for it unless you're in a hurry to get touring. There's so many delicious bakeries and cafe's nearby to choose from. We had eggs out twice just to mix it up. The reception area is smallish, but sufficient, with a little closet equipped with a computer for internet access. I used it daily with little problem and rarely had to wait to get on it. The staff all speak perfect English and were helpful when solicited for advice. The neighborhood is great. Behind us was a service alley, but a few steps toward the corner was a nice shopping street with a variety of stores, restaurants and very pedestrian oriented with single lanes of traffic. The Rue Cler neighborhood was only a few blocks away and had all the wonderful open market style shops with groceries, cafes, specialty shoppes of all kinds. The Eiffel tower was about 2 1/2 blocks away and put on a light show every hour at night. Great location, couldn't be beat. This hotel is a good value considering the location and overall quality of what you get.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: antiquebusiness
Reviews.Content: I travel to Paris on Business once or twice each year. This is a very charming hotel with very polite, friendly and helpful staff who I have come to know as friends. I have tried several hotels in Paris over the past several years and this is definately my favorite place to stay. The staff all speak english fluently. The hotel is very comfortable and clean. All the rooms have been renovated and redecorated more than once during the time I have been visiting...the owners have a good eye for detail and the rooms are very nicely decorated. The staff try hard to make sure each visit is enjoyable...I can't say enough about them they are so nice. The breakfast room is really warm and cozy and the food and service is wonderful. The lobby has free internet that works great and is a big plus (most hotels in paris charge for internet use). Theres always a beautiful fresh bouquet of flowers in the lobby and complimentary news papers in English and French. The location is ideal near the Eiffel Tower, and is on a small quiet street near good restaurants and nice shops. Theres even a laundrymat steps from the front door...oh and a grocery store just a few steps further. You really can't beat the location. Writing this review has made me want to make plans for my next visit. I highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: brianshodge
Reviews.Content: We booked the Eiffel Tower view room and the sight was spectacular, especially when the Tower sparkled at night! The room was very, very small but exceptionally cozy. The bathroom left a lot to be desired with a shower that had a glass panel that only covered the first quarter of the shower, the rest of it was left open. There was a window looking out over the street in the shower and we constantly had a feeling of being watched while showering. The shower itself was ridiculously too small and if you're over 5'8" or so you will find it an unpleasurable experience having to keep your head in one spot to keep it from banging up against a wall that feels like it's caving in on you. The location was wonderful and only minutes from the Eiffel Tower. The staff, to me, was just average. They didn't go out of their way to do anything exceptional but they certainly did their job. This is a nice budget hotel in Paris with some things to be desired, but in a phenomenal location. If you can afford the extra few euros and you don't mind a dainty shower, I would definitely go for the Eiffel Tower view!!

Reviews.Title: “leaves alot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: rodeogirl
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed there late Oct. 2006. 2 of us were in a room on the first floor near the kitchen. Noisy and no ventilation. Staff misled us that the "air conditioning" would be fixed and it was not; we were finally told on the last full day that they were transitioning to heat so no a/c would be on. The vent/fan did not work in our room. Lift was out the first day for 2 of our group that travelled early. Small rooms; showers small, not very functional. Manager was angry at us for asking about the ventilation issue. Had to argue about a price adjustment for 4 uncomfortable nights. Not close to a metro station but close to Eiffel Tower. Nor were there lots of good restaurants around but breakfast places were good. Nothing was cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmc78041
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in the Londres Eiffel, all the reviews were true, it is a perfect place to stay. The area is very nice and safe and had all the convenieces that you need. There is a great supermarket around the corner where you can buy water and snacks at much cheaper prices than the news stands or souvenir stores. We paid 2 euros for a 6 pack of Evian water so we stocked up and did not have to pay the high prices they charge at the places you visit. There is also a great bakery next door to the supermarket where you can get fresh bread and the daily special of 1 sandwich( about a foot long) a drink and a great dessert for about 5.80 euro, great for a picnic at the park in front of the Eiffel tower. A self serve laundry is in front of the hotel, they charge 3.80 euros for a wash load plus 1 euro for the dryer. A pharmacy is in front of the bakery and you can get almost all the same items as a US pharmacy. The staff in the hotel was very helpful and answered all of our questions. A great little hotel with all the charm you expect of a Parisian stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and so Parisian!”
Reviews.Author: mevlana
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as charming as its picture in the website. The staff was very helpful with all questions and needs. The atmosphere was friendly and quaint. My mother, sisters and I looked forward each morning to the breakfast buffet. There was an excellent selection and it really helped us prepare for a heavy day of sightseeing. I liked the location: close to the Eiffel Tower, restaurants, a laundry mat across the street and a grocery store around the corner. The hotel was very clean and well-maintained. I would definitely choose the Londres Eiffel on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: wheelwatcher
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The location is great, close to Rue Clar. The rooms are very small, but clean. It was a five minute walk to the Eiffel tower and handy to public transportation. The bathroom was clean, but so tiny. Be sure to ask for a room with a window to the street, the ones in the back are a little dreary. There were wonderful cafes and markets all around the hotel and two very good restaurants on the same street. Be sure to try Chez Agnes right next door for a very unique experience. Also, my favorite meal was on the same side of the street at the other end at a place called La Varengue, best beef bourguigonne ever! The best part of this hotel is the location. The only thing we found hard was it did not include breakfast and we had no access to make tea of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Small but just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: bengo4
Reviews.Content: Small room, but it's Paris! Eiffel Tower provided an excellent landmark when our party was separated and half had to head back on their own. Only 1 tiny elevator vs. narrow spiral staircase, so pack light. Bring your own hair conditioner, as only shampoo & soap are provided, and weather is dry. Hairdrier provided. If you use a washcloth, bring one. Tiny but clean bathroom; even tinier glass-enclosed shower--I'm avg. height & weight for female & I banged my elbows on the door if I faced out (trick is to put showerhead on lower holder and face the wall while showering). My fiance is 6'1" and fit, and it was a tight squeeze but manageable for him. Large men will have problems with the shower--request a tub (view room had one). Tub had low head clearance, but at least it was wider. Free wireless internet. Coin laundry across the street. Breakfast (fresh French bread, croissants, cheese, sliced ham, jams & butter; cereal; yogurt; grapefruit & orange juices; fruit; coffe, tea, hot chocolate) was great for me--the cheese, bread, & ham, surprisingly, were even better than the croissants. A wonderful patisserie & a supermarket are just around the corner on Rue St. Dominique. Small fridge in room. No safe in room or at front desk, so hang onto your valuables if possible. Security was good--front door was locked in the evening & front deskers monitored who came in and out. Friendly, responsive staff, but arrange your own airport shuttle--hotel uses Golden Air Shuttle, which received consistently abysmal reviews on Rick Steves' website. We used Airport Connection instead, booking online in advance. Pics from rooms w/ & w/o view attached. See hotel website for room photos.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: tswanson
Reviews.Content: The experience of staying in this hotel is nothing short of perfect. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The accomodations are clean, comfortable, and charming. The location of Hotel Londres-Eiffel is great for site seeing, for shopping, for sipping a vin rouge in the shadow of the Eiffel Tower. You can never get lost because the East Pillar of the Eiffel Tower, which is visible from almost anywhere, always lets you know where your home away from home is. I definitely will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: MHB01
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and 3 kids aged 11, 13 and 15. We stayed for four nights at this hotel at the beginning of August, 2006. We found it through Trip Advisor, and so it is only fair that I write a review after staying there. Everything I had read on Trip Advisor turned out to be true and we have a great experience at the hotel. Arnaud was terrific and extremely helpful. The hotel has an elevator, however, the rooms that we were given were not accessible by elevator. Arnaud carried every piece of our 9 pieces of luggage up two flights of stairs for us. When we left, Arnaud was off that day, however we had help bringing the luggage down from the gentleman on duty at the time (his name escapes me right now) The hotel is walking distance from the Eiffel Tower and if you love to walk, you can walk almost anywhere from the hotel. Rooms were very small but we were only there to sleep. Hotel was very clean. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: rskeen
Reviews.Content: My 80-year-old mother, my sister and her three daughters (age 17-30) just returned from Paris, where we stayed at the Hotel Londres Eiffel. In view of some of the negative recent feedback from reviewers, I wanted to add my opinions. First, the location is ideal. It was very convenient, with a lot of sights within walking distance (including of course the Eiffel Tower). A few blocks away is the Rue Cler area, a popular pedestrian-only street with lots of shops and restaurants; and there are many convenience stores and fine restaurants just around the corner from the hotel. Second, the hotel itself was impeccably clean. Our room was small, but not too small, and the bathroom was very nice and bigger than in most European hotels. The beds & pillows were very comfortable, and we heard no street noise whatsoever. Third, the staff was courteous, helpful and friendly. They assisted us with hotel recommendations, reservations, shuttle service reservations, etc. , -- and they speak English. We thought the breakfast was good: a selection of breads, crossants, cheese, ham, yogurt ,and cereal, along with fruit juices, tea, coffee and hot chocolate. This was perfect for all of us because we wanted something more substantial than croissants or pastries. The woman serving us every morning was very friendly and upbeat. An added bonus: I loved being able to use the hotel's internet connection in the lobby to send email to family back home. (The keyboard is French, but you can switch it to an English keyboard by clicking on the icon on the bottom right of the computer screen.) My family entourage all agreed that the Hotel Londres Eiffel was far better than other places they had stayed in Paris, and we all agreed we would stay here again. Next time I'm going with my husband, and this hotel is where we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value”
Reviews.Author: gimmel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in the middle of August. I found it to be comfortable, safe, immaculate and in a great location. The staff are pleasant, professional, well informed and very helpful. It is an easy walk to Rue Cler, the Eiffel or the metro. Cafe Constant is literally next door. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: TjLaura
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July during a heat wave. We were happy that the room had air conditioning. Before arriving they had offered a cot for our baby but when we arrived there was an extra bed and no cot. To be fair with did not complain about this, since we found it easier for our son to sleep with us, so we don't know what they would have done had we done so. Our room was on a second floor but the only way to get ther was through a dark staircase that had some winding and weird steps, there was no lift in that area of the hotel. To get to other rooms there was a lift available. On our arrival we were helped to get our heavy suitcases to the room but on departure it was up to us to carry them down the stairs. The breakfast was very poor and had very little choices, I think this is the way it is in most french hotels so it's probably not a particular problem to this one. The ladies who served breakfast spoke nothing but french, so if your french is not too good you might be in a bit of trouble. The reception staff was not particularly helpful to us. I agree with another reviewer who wrote that they cater to USA tourist here so that might have been the problem since we're not Americans. The location is the best thing about this hotel. There are also several restaurants in the area as well as 2 laundrymats and a supermarket just around the corner. They also have free wi-fe internet access which was a plus. If you want a place close to the Eiffel Tower stay here but be sure to ask for a room with lift access. If the location is not an issue for you I'm sure that there are better places you can find.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: JD143
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel de Londres Eiffel for two nights in early July. The hotel was nice, and the staff was courteous. The room, while small compared to a hotel here in the states, worked just fine for us during our stay (we really didn't spend a lot of time in it). Everything seemed clean, bathroom was a good size, and the mini fridge was a plus for keeping a few drinks cold. The location of the hotel was just right for us. Despite reading reviews that the area was more residential (and had fewer shops, restaurants, etc), we decided that we really wanted to be near the Eiffel Tower. We loved the area, and found a few great little restaurants right nearby. The Eiffel Tower was just a few minutes walk (and was even more impressive than we expected), and there was a Metro station nearby. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and would definitely consider staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by all the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: LindyM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel in late May 2006. Our room was on the main floor , and the doorway to the dining area was immediately adjacent to our room. This door banged shut all evening long and then started up again in the morning when the dining area opened up. Our only encounter with the management / staff / owners was when we asked if we could possibly change rooms - we were told "NON". No help whatsoever. We noticed that the owners(?) seemed very friendly with all the American guests - however being non-American - we also seemed to be 'persona non grata'. In fact - we couldn't say if they were the owners or not - because they simply ignored us completely. I would have thought it was us - but some other non-American guests commented on the same thing and said that since the hotel is listed in Rick Steve's books - the owners are definitely catering to Americans. We were on a round the world tour and this was the only time we ever felt anything less than welcome anywhere. Despite this - we loved our stay in beautiful Paris and loved the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kabie55
Reviews.Content: Just returned! A wonderful location- neighborhood and restaurants make this the perfect paris hotel! Our room was wonderful- the view of the Eiffel tower and watching the light show at night was a delight! The breakfast is very good BUT be sure to clarify whether it is an additional charge or included with your room. All hotel personnel are helpful and offer great suggestions! The 1/2 day trip to Giverny and Monet's house was great and the hotel arranged everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful two day stay at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel. The location was great with only a short walk to the Eiffel tower. The metro and bus stops were also close. The staff were very helpful with buses, taxis and directions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay”
Reviews.Author: LAworld
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights with our two children at this small hotel. We booked two rooms. The rooms have everything you need (air con, hair dryer, very clean, quiet), but are very small. The staff is extremely helpful and made excellent dinner reservations for us (our favorite was Le P'tit Troquet). The hotel is surrounded by great food shops, bakeries and restauants. There are also two laundrymats across the street which is especially important when traveling with children. It is an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower and to boat rides on the Seine. We loved to buy a picnic lunch from the local shops and and walk the couple of blocks to the Parc du Champs de Mars. We found it to be a lovely hotel in a quiet and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: DarylFielding
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a tour of France. Rooms typically small and parisian, but well appointed and clean. The shower room was very clean and surprisingly big. Common parts not particulary spacious but loads to do nearby including the tower as others have mentioned. The market nearby is fantastic for fresh food, and people watching. And the confit de canard shop opposite is stunning. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rick Steves Paris Tour Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel mid May with the Rick Steves Paris Tour. The hotel was extremely clean and was in a great location. A stones throw from the Eiffel tower made it a breeze to pack a meal, a bottle of champagne and sit under the lights of the tower. High speed internet access made it easy to check in with the folks back home. If your looking for a nice place to stay in a great neighborhood this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Great!”
Reviews.Author: one4one
Reviews.Content: Made a last min. change to the Hotel de Londres-Eiffel .What a excellent choice! Spotless rooms .Super location. And a wonderful staff! Arnaud who was on duty was Very helpful in making our Paris stay enjoyable helping set up tours. and let me add Perfect English! On our next trip to Paris we will stay at the Hotel de Londres-Effel. Thanks Arnaud and Cedric !

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay near Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One great thing about the hotel was its proximity to the Eiffel Tower as it was literally about three blocks away. It was also a 10 minute walking distance to the metro; same short distance to RER which took us straight to Versaille, and 10 mins from Bateau mouche on Sienne river where we took the boat cruise. Location is good, however the rooms are tiny tiny tiny except 101 and 102 which were larger and more comfortable. Bathrooms are very clean, ok size with great water pressure. Breakfast for 12 Euros was average. There are many good eateries and restaurants near the area. All in all, I had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “such a great spot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in Feb to celebrate our anniversary. We literally could not fault the place. I have to laugh at people who say the rooms are small - you are in Paris to see the sights, not to hang out in a hotel room! The room was perfectly adequate, very nicely decorated and extremely clean. The bathroom was spotless and a good size. The staff were always friendly, the breakfast was very good (included in the price, which I believe was an off-season special offer) and the location would be very hard to beat. The neighbourhood is just fantastic and although we spent most of our time wandering through the Marais, along the Seine and visiting the usual tourist sights, we loved coming back to the 7th and nosing in the shops along rue St Dominique. Lots of great restaurants and cafes to choose from - Leo le Lion, on rue Duvivier, was a wonderfully Parisian choice for dinner. We would go back in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable in classic Paris neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Sam&Peggy
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable, personable hotel in a very comfortable, very friendly neighborhood (the 7e) . Quiet, and just the right scale, though some might find the rooms small, they were well appointed and recently remodeled. Staff particularly accommmodating; changed our room (to a lower floor) and adjusted rate accordingly with a smile; made excellent dining recommendations; all within easy walking distance, a real convenience since the weather when we were there was frigid. (Loved the corner restaurant Cafe Constant.) Also small shops and bars in the neighborhood quite welcoming and diverting. All and all, a great off season getaway well served by a well located and welcoming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel near eiffel tower”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: lovely stay and staff, we will rocommend you, hotel is just near the eiffel tower, and the Ecole Militaire Metro station is five minutes, the room was perfectly romantic clean and modern, free wireless and internet access. fitzerald.c
